title: Marketing Intern for Corporate Social Responsibility and Social Media
description: Share Email Opening Apply NowTITLEMarketing Intern for Corporate Social Responsibility and Social Media  LOCATION Technical Center - Jerome, ID  ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION Idaho Milk Products is an international milk processing leader, supplying IdaPro Milk Protein Concentrate (MPC), IdaPro Milk Permeate, and IdaPro Cream to customers around the globe. Our superior quality products are used in a variety of applications from nutritional products to cheese, yogurt and other dairy based foods. Idaho Milk Products is committed to our customers' success through teamwork, attention to detail, and valuing relationships.  FULL-TIME/PART-TIME Seasonal  SHIFT Days  DESCRIPTION DEPARTMENT: Marketing and SalesREPORTS TO:  Marketing ManagerFLSA STATUS: Non-exemptTIME PERIOD: 3 months, Summer 2017 JOB SUMMARY:Idaho Milk Products is seeking an intern majoring in Marketing or related field; preferably in Junior or Senior year to assist with Marketing initiatives in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and social media. The intern will work with members of the Corporate Social Responsibility Team to finalize, publish and distribute the 2017 Report. This internship will also develop a plan to use social media influencers in the fitness nutrition space using a pull strategy to expand the market for Milk Protein Concentrates and Isolates.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:Becomes very familiar with our major customers‰Ûª social responsibility initiatives and how ours fits within the framework of theirs.Assists in preparing CSR Report for publishing and works with to finalize production of CSR Report.Assists in writing introduction letter and works with Sales Team to distribute letter and CSR Report to customers.Crafts a plan outline for social media influencer campaign including a .Works with Sales to determine customers to work with on social media influencers campaign.Creates a list of potential social media influencers and makes recommendations for choosing influencer.Functions as a between customer and social media influencer.Contributes to Idaho dairy industry activities, or to health & wellness events or committees that can enhance job performance and industry knowledge.Keeps meticulous records to document all aspects of the work performed.Proofreads entire CSR report for any errors.Performs other duties and projects as assigned.  POSITION REQUIREMENTSJOB SPECIFICATIONS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Education:Required: Minimum of 1 year of work towards BS degree in Marketing, Business or other related field.Preferred: Junior or Senior standing towards BS degree or MS student in Marketing, Business or other related field.Experience, Skills and Abilities:Ability to review primary research data to build a presentation that highlights key information.Knowledge and understanding of fitness and nutrition in healthy lifestyles.Experience with a wide range of social media platforms with the to find social influencers within those platforms.Experienced analyzing information, highlighting relevant information and suggesting appropriate actions.Skilled at organization, prioritization and time management.Excellent MS Office skills including Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint. Experience with Adobe InDesign is a plus.Confirmed ability to work independently and meet defined deadlines.Solid written and oral communication skills.Able to write reports and prepare/deliver presentations.Creative, self-starter that enjoys building systems from the ground up.BENEFITS:Non-benefit eligible  EOE STATEMENT We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or other applicable protected classes.  THIS POSITION IS CURRENTLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS.Apply NowWE ALSO RECOMMENDOTHER JOBS WITHIN SAME CATEGORY-- None found --OTHER JOBS WITHIN 60 MILESElectrical/Instrumentation Technician in Jerome, IDPosted on: 1/30/2017[Apply Now]Packaging Assistant, Various Shifts (Days, Swing, Nights) in Jerome, IDPosted on: 12/14/2016[Apply Now]Production Supervisor, Night Shift in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/14/2017[Apply Now]Evaporator Operator, Days in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/15/2017[Apply Now]Separator Operator, Night Shift in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/23/2017[Apply Now] AppOne.comTM   copyrightå©1999-2017 HR Services, Inc.Click here for technical assistance.

title: Client Marketing Internship
description: ?Home > Search openings > Search results > Job details  Job detailsinShareJob 1 of 1Apply to job   Save to cart   View similar jobs     Auto req ID 13006BRExternal Job Title Client Marketing InternshipJob Description Client Marketing Internship: athenahealth is changing the way the healthcare industry works. With our best in breed suite of cloud software products, we've taken healthcare into the modern age empowering medical care providers to get back to what they do best-- treating patients. athena's culture is idealistic, entrepreneurial, and extremely fast paced; a sharp contrast to the culture typically found in medical offices or healthcare service companies. We aspire to be a diverse team of change agents driven by an entrepreneurial spirit, a passion for excellence and a desire to make the administrative processes in healthcare delivery run much better. athena employs over 100 interns in a variety of departments and office locations each summer. We don't believe in "busy work" around here, so our interns are given challenging projects that directly impact the business. Beyond their day-to-day work, interns also attend speaker seminar series‰Ûª, social and networking events, and give end-of-summer ‰ÛÏbusiness impact presentations‰Û to their department‰Ûªs leadership team to showcase their work. The athenahealth Internship Program was included in Vault‰Ûªs Top Internship Rankings for 2016. (Read more here: http://www.vault.com/internship_program/insurance/athenahealth-internship/overview) Check out our Internship Program Video here: https://youtu.be/9G23YgNnKiw  About the Client Marketing Team:The Client Marketing team generates demand among doctor practices with anywhere from 1-20+ physicians via integrated marketing campaigns, partner marketing, events and affiliate marketing programs. Our goal is to create interest and engagement resulting in a small group practice wanting to take a meeting with athenahealth to learn more. Responsibilities of the Client Marketing Intern may include: Lead and engagement generation for the 1,200 independent accounts over 21 physicians, in addition to co-marketing to help a handful of our largest clients add physicians to their network and grow.Research on our highest priority accountsAssist with the execution of direct mail, email, digital media and events to our target marketAssist with email nurture streams to our different groups of prospectsFollow-up campaigns following internal thought-leadership and closing events.Work cross functionally with web, media, and social/content teams to optimize content for our prospect baseCreate sales support documents for outbound marketing campaigns.Support partner marketing campaigns including, e-Newsletters, leaderboards, co-branding one-pagers, versioning event invitations, creating PPT presentations to effectively train and share informationDive into program reporting and analytics to make business recommendations for improved campaign performanceFulfill ad-hoc requests to support the client marketing team  Qualifications: Excellent verbal and written communication skillsExceptional organizational skillsDetail-oriented approach to everythingTalent for effectively interacting with individuals at all levels of the organizationAbility to follow directivesExcitement/Passion for MarketingMastery of Microsoft Office athenahealth is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit and hire applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law.  Location of Role Watertown, MAApply to job   Save to cart   View similar jobs

title: Corporate Communications Intern
description: Corporate Communications Intern (REQ7329) Westlake, OhioThe Corporate Communications Intern position is an opportunity for a recent college graduate or a college senior who wants exposure to the corporate communications function in a $1.8 billion global industrial technologies company. This internship will expose the candidate to a versatile communications role supporting all aspects of the Corporate Communications function, with a particular focus on employee communications.ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES‰Û¢ Creates engaging multimedia content for Nordson‰Ûªs global team of more than 6,000 employees.‰Û¢ Looks for opportunities to re-purpose content for Nordson‰Ûªs social media.‰Û¢ Uses established measurement tools to measure efficacy of communications.‰Û¢ Supports internal customers, especially human resources to develop content and serve as a liaison with the design team for employee materials‰Û¢ Manages special projects as assigned, for example, developing content for month-long Founders‰Ûª Day celebration to recognize Nordson‰Ûªs commitment to our history, values and innovation.‰Û¢ Supports financial and marketing communication efforts and community relations efforts as directed.‰Û¢ Provide support to marketing and communication managers in Nordson business units around the world.‰Û¢ Other duties as assigned.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE‰Û¢ Recent graduate or currently enrolled at an accredited institution, having earned or working toward a bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, English or similar.SKILLS & ABILITIES‰Û¢ Superior writing skills.‰Û¢ Superior verbal and presentation skills.‰Û¢ Superior project management skills.‰Û¢ Collaborative and customer service oriented.‰Û¢ Confidence and professionalism to work with employees and leaders at all levels of the organization.‰Û¢ Fluency in social media.‰Û¢ Eagerness to learn‰Û¢ Ability to multitask and switch gears quickly‰Û¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products‰Û¢ High energy‰Û¢ Culturally sensitive‰Û¢ Video editing skills a plus‰Û¢ Business and financial acumen a plus‰Û¢ Basic skills in Adobe Photoshop and other multi-media programs a plus‰Û¢ SharePoint experience and other web design skills a plusWORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL DEMANDSOffice environment. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.TRAVEL REQUIREDNoneNordson Corporation provides equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees. No person is to be discriminated against in any aspect of the employment relationship due to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening and background/criminal check, consistent with applicable laws.

title: Learning and Development Intern
description: ABOUT USWHY BLATTNER?MARKETS WE SERVEPROJECTSJOIN OUR TEAM SUBCONTRACTORS/SUPPLIERS NEWS CONTACT USOverviewAvailable PositionsCareer PathsInternship OpportunitiesCompensation and BenefitsTraining and DevelopmentLife at Blattner EnergyExisiting Applicant LoginAgency LoginJob SearchWork typeFull-time 1LocationsAvon, MN 1CategoriesCorporate Office 1Internship 1JOB OPPORTUNITIESBUILD YOUR CAREER ATBLATTNER ENERGY.Learning and Development InternAPPLY NOWJob no: 492531Work type: Full-timeLocation: Avon, MNCategories: Corporate Office, InternshipLearning and Development Intern  Reports to: Learning and Development Coordinator  Education Requirements: Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in the field of: HR Management; Instructional Design or related area.  Experience: A background in the design, creation, and implementation of training and development, media materials, and process management initiatives is preferred.  Position Summary: Partners with internal department subject matter experts to assess current company training materials; determine needs for updating and/or developing new training materials and execute on the purchase of, or creation of these training materials.   Essential Job FunctionsCollaborates with subject matter experts on training needs (e-learning, video, web based, virtual, etc.) and content.  Investigates training solutions with outside vendors or if an internal program needs to be created, and if so, create and develop the appropriate design and development of training materials.Incorporate all trainings into company's LMS system.Ability to assess and evaluate training needs through a formative evaluation process.Interact with Blattner employees and outside vendors in a professional manner to create and edit professional training materials.Other duties as assigned  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Advanced communication and interpersonal skills are essential.This position requires a combination of technical knowledge and skill in written and graphic communication.Strong organizational, project/time management is necessary.Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook)Proficient with digital video and photo editing software.Knowledge of Adult Learning Principles desired.Utilization of a LMS (Learning Management System) a plus. title: Design Engineer Intern
description: CAREER HOMEABOUT USFEATURED JOBSLOCATIONSNOT FINDING A JOB?LanguageAlready a member? Sign InEmail similar jobs to meCo-Op 4Apply nowDate: Feb 20, 2017Location: Greensboro, NC, USCompany: Skyworks  Skyworks Solutions, Inc. is empowering the wireless networking revolution. Our highly innovative analog semiconductors are connecting people, places and things spanning a number of new and previously unimagined applications. We possess broad technology capabilities and one of the most complete product portfolios in the industry. Our customers are global industry leaders who are driving innovative platforms that are changing the way we all live, work and play. Our global team collaborates daily to create the semiconductors the world relies on. If you're looking for a challenging and exciting career in a fast-paced environment, Skyworks offers a variety of roles in an environment that promotes prompt decision making, uninhibited sharing of best practices and individual ownership. Here, you'll find minimal layers of management, open communication and mutual trust and respect.Requisition ID: 21725 Skyworks Solutions, Inc. is empowering the wireless networking revolution, connecting virtually everyone and everything, all the time. Our highly innovative analog semiconductors are linking people, places, and things spanning a number of new and previously unimagined applications within automotive, broadband, cellular infrastructure, the connected home, industrial, medical, military, smartphone, tablet and wearable markets.  Headquartered in Woburn, Massachusetts, Skyworks is a global company with engineering, marketing, operations, sales, and service facilities located throughout Asia, Europe and North America. For more information, please visit Skyworks‰Ûª website at: www.skyworksinc.com.  This position is for an SAW Filter Design Engineer Intern in the Open Market Platforms (OMP) Division in Skyworks Greensboro, NC design center as part of a group of filter design engineers in support of high-volume front-end radio modules for cellular handset applications.  The successful candidate will possess a reasonable understanding of electromagnetics, microwave acoustics, and RF design, and be a driven, committed team player.  Our SAW filter design team is responsible for designing and simulating SAW filters and the surrounding RF module environment.  Detailed Description:  Our SAW filter design engineers design and simulate SAW filters and duplexers in a fast-paced team environment. Filter designers work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules using a holistic approach.  The filter design engineer‰Ûªs responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:- Designing SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, and other filters for cellular handset applications- Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance- Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment- Integrating multiple filters and duplexers together, in combination with RF switches, to facilitate carrier aggregation (CA)- Utilizing design of experiments (DOE) and other experimental methods to improve filter performance and model correlation- Laying out photo masks and completing necessary documentation for SAW filter fabrication- Assembling, measuring, deembedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules- Participating in and conducting design reviews  Software tools used include:- Ansys HFSS and Q3D- Keysight ADS and Momentum- Cadence SIP and Virtuoso- Matlab- Various custom filter design and modeling applications  The candidate must be currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) Masters or Ph.D. program.- Should have career interest in RF Engineering, filters, or microwave acoustics- Should have lab experience, including working with network analyzers and other RF test equipment- Must have experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook    Skyworks is proud to be an equal opportunity employer supporting diversity in the workplace.Nearest Major Market: GreensboroJob Segment: Engineer, Telecom, Telecommunications, Network, Electrical, Engineering, TechnologyApply nowFind similar jobs:Telecommunications Jobs in Greensboro, RF Engineer Jobs in Greensboro, Engineering Careers At Skyworks, Electrical Engineering Jobs in Greensboro, Design Engineer Jobs in GreensboroCAREER HOMESKYWORKSINC.COMTOP JOB SEARCHESVIEW ALL JOBSPRIVACY POLICYCopyright 2015 Skyworks Solutions, Inc.

title: Standards Analyst Intern
description: CREATE ACCOUNTSIGN INCORPORATE CAREERS at KELLYWant to work at Kelly Services?HELPMY ACCOUNTJOB SEARCH+ Advanced SearchClearAll CategoriesRadiusSHIRE Summer 2017: Standards Analyst InternShire is partnering with Kelly Services to offer an exciting internship program with a world-class global biotech company.  Newly combined with Baxalta, Shire is now the leading global biotechnology company focused on serving people affected by rare diseases and other highly specialized conditions. These diseases are often misunderstood, under-diagnosed, and potentially life-threatening.  Our 22,000 employees come to work every day with a common purpose: to develop and deliver breakthrough therapies that enable people with life-altering conditions to live their lives to the fullest.  At Shire, we are dedicated to expanding, building and sustaining leadership across our key therapeutic areas through our extensive portfolio of products, innovative pipeline and collaborative approach to working with diverse partners around the globe. We strive to earn and keep the trust of our patients, their families and physicians, and all others who support and advance their care.  Working together, the possibilities for our patients, healthcare partners and employees are unprecedented, with significant growth potential for our shareholders.  Shire's US Internship Program offers hands-on work experience to students completing their undergraduate and graduate degrees and allows Shire to engage with the local community and discover new and emerging talent.  Requirements for the Shire US Internship Program include:Enrollment at an accredited college/universityCompletion of at least sophomore year of undergraduate study by internship start date (Both undergraduate and graduate students that apply will be considered)Major in a field of study relevant to the internshipFocus on academic performance - candidates with a GPA above 3.0 is preferredLegal authorization to work in the USMust be at least 18 years of ageAbility to start on one of the designated start dates.Students are responsible for identifying their own housing ‰ÛÒ housing will not be provided  Please Note: Shire will accept and consider intern applications from relatives of employees; however, individuals will not be hired into positions where they would be in the direct line of supervision of a relative, or where there would be a work-related conflict of interest.Standards Analyst InternThe intern will be expected to work with members of the CDO organization to assist in identifying and defining metadata needed to improve the clinical data collection, processing and reporting from a clinical data standards perspective. As a result of their efforts, operational performance of the Shire Standards can be optimized. Through the internship period, the intern will gain key insights into study data processes and procedures in the clinical study life cycle.In addition, the intern will learn about the impact of regulatory agency regulations and requirements, the need for high quality data, and how this data is used to provide compliant data to regulatory authorities. The successful intern candidate will have:   A background of familiarity with programming languages like SAS, Visual Basic, .NET or Java and database systems and strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint.The ability to work independently and be a self-starter.To be able to develop and present their own ideas for improvements.Comfortable with data handling, processing and analysis.Good analytic, problem solving, and computer skills.Good verbal and written communication and inter-personal skills.Using their skills to create, maintain and document programs to manipulate metadata, summary listings and graphical outputs as reports. Creates and maintains SAS functions and programs for data quality checks.Review and maintain standard documents on governance portal.Knowledge of CDISC, HL7 or any Standards Developing Organization (SDO), or PhUSE would be is preferredDegree requirement is open:  Computer science, math major (statistics) may be helpfulWould prefer someone who has done a co-op elsewhere or professional experienceIf you are interested in this fantastic summer internship opportunity and meet the requirements of the program, apply online today! title: Public Relations Intern
description: Do you want to work on something that has impact? Amazon looks for students who are effective leaders with the ability to motivate, mentor, and engage. We need leaders who will have ideas on how to improve our processes and who arenÕt afraid to innovate. We need leaders who will embrace all the responsibility we give them and excel! Internships at Amazon are your opportunity to get meaningful real-world experience in your field of study, whether that be Finance, HR, Supply Chain, Operations Management, Facilities Management or Safety Management. Not only will you get a feel for how you can put what you're learning in the classroom into practice, you will also get invaluable exposure to top industry leaders who are consistently raising the bar at the world's largest online retailer. Job Description: Interns will rotate through the groups within the Global Communications team: á Consumer business: consumer goods on the Web site- everything from books to consumer electronics, to consumables. á Device PR team Kindle, Fire Tablets, Amazon Echo, Fire TV. á Amazon Video PR team: video content including our own originals. á Corporate Communications group: AmazonÕs corporate reputation. á Ops Communications group: Internal and external communications for our Fulfillment Centers, Customer service and innovations like Prime Air (Drones) and Prime Now. á And, potentially, AWS PR group, leading the way in cloud computing. Interns will likely have the opportunity to travel. We hold a media event in New York City each summer, and will likely have a few premiere events for Amazon Studios in Los Angeles. The opportunity to work on events like these is priceless. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS á Open to juniors and rising seniors á Any academic major Ð Diversity Encouraged! á 3.3 cumulative GPA PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS á Strong desire to learn along with professional drive á Excellent verbal and written communication skills á Experience working in fast-paced environment á Passion for the PR industry and its best practices

title: Social Media Intern
description: General Investment & Development | Windsor Communities | Windsor Business Parks | Contact Us        Careers BROWSE OPEN JOBSSEARCH OPEN JOBSSUBMIT YOUR RESUMEEDIT YOUR PROFILEVIEW APPLICATION STATUSJob DetailsTitle Social Media Recruitment InternLocation Boston OfficeCity BostonState MADescription  The Company: Windsor Communities is a national, privately held property management company headquartered in Boston‰Ûªs Financial District. Over the past 50 years, we have established our reputation as one of the premier managers of luxury apartment communities in cities across the United States, and have 650+ employees servicing the residents of our growing portfolio of apartments.The Job: We are currently in the market for a Social Media Recruitment Intern to help enhance our presence across various social channels and leverage it to boost our recruiting efforts. If you‰Ûªre curious, self-motivated, and willing to roll up your sleeves to get involved, we want to hear from you!The Fine Print: This is a 20-hr per week paid position based out of Boston, MA, and a great opportunity for total immersion into the Recruiting function of a large property management company. The hours are flexible (between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday), and we‰Ûªll throw in a T-pass so you can get around.You will report directly to the Director of Recruitment and work with our HR Business Partners and Property Managers to redesign and execute a recruitment strategy across our social channels. Your day-to-day tasks will vary, but key responsibilities include:Social Media Maintenance:Assist in actively managing and monitoring Windsor Communities‰Ûª social media on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Glassdoor, etc.Write and post effective and engaging content for our social media recruitment pages, while maintaining our brand voice and personality.Edit and create relevant video/photo content, post relevant articles, company accomplishments, company job fairs, local property events, job openings, etc.Identify mechanisms to grow the number of followers and reviews we have on all our social channels by engaging with potential candidates, posting content, etc.Work with current employees and internal staff to help them promote and share job openings on their social media pages.Online Recruitment:Engage social media to promote Windsor Communities‰Ûª to passive and active candidatesUse databases like LinkedIn and Indeed to identify passive candidates and recommend the most qualified ones to our Recruitment Department.Help create relevant content including posts, interviews, videos, employee photos, blog entries, etc. for the Windsor Communities Career‰Ûªs page.Requirements  Pursuing or completed Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Communications, Marketing or related field2+ years‰Ûª experience and strong familiarity with social media and marketing channels including (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest)Experience with social media analytic toolsExcellent oral and written communication skillsBasic photo editing skillsTeam player, but also has the ability to work independentlyApply On-lineSend This Job to a Friend  Copyright å© 2002‰ÛÒ2009 Windsor CommunitiesContact  |   Webmaster  |   Terms of Use  |   Privacy Policy  |   Fair Housing  |   Site Map

title: Digital Content Internship
description: Hanley Wood is the premier media, information, and marketing services company serving the residential and commercial housing and construction industry.  The Digital Content Internship Program is an opportunity for smart, motivated individuals to gain meaningful experience in content production and journalism. Digital Content Interns will be exposed to many aspects of our business and play a meaningful role in our editorial operations. This program is a unique opportunity to gain valuable insight and experience with a dynamic digital media company.  Participants will gain important insights into the media and publishing world, and overall will enjoy a fun and worthwhile experience.   Each position will offer 30-40 hours per week Ð specific hours are flexible within our core business hours (8:30AM Ð 5:30PM).    The Digital Content intern should possess exceptional writing and editing skills and strong analytic skills.  Meticulous attention to detail and factual accuracy are crucial skills in this role.  Responsibilities will include compiling news stories and profiles, researching story leads, writing, and fact-checking.   This individual should also have experience using blogs and social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube.  He/she may also be responsible for generating traffic, increase loyalty, encourage word of mouth promotion, and make connections with online audience.   Responsibilities will include:  Writing succinct, intelligent, creative, and cogent copy that drives traffic to Hanley Wood websites Expanding content using online social media platforms Conducting web research to find interesting products and story ideas Fact-checking page proofs for phone numbers, websites, etc. Overseeing the editing, testing, and deployment of e-newsletters.  Community Management: managing day-to-day community management, audience engagement, page and content moderation, and general outreach Research: conducting basic research in order to engage the community and investigate any trending activities within the community Surveying readers on issues and themes via telephone Conducting research and interviews, compiling art, managing special projects Attend daily Scrum meetings Administrative duties, as needed All qualified program participants will possess the following Skills, Education, and Experience: BachelorÕs degree in Journalism, English, Art, or a related field required.  Recent college graduates preferred.  College seniors will also be considered for the program. Ability to accurately understand scope of assigned projects, clientsÕ goals and requirements, and budgets through meetings, taking notes, and asking questions Demonstrated research, writing, and telephone skills Ability to adhere to all deadlines Excellent communications skills Strong sense of professionalism Ability to multi-task and manage projects and stories simultaneously Organized self-starter with a positive attitude Desire to broaden knowledge of emerging technologies Adeptness using digital technologies to engage with immediate environment and initiate change Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, web browser use, and Google Docs Strong presence on social media platforms including (but not limited to) Facebook and Twitter preferred Must display the maturity required to work in a casual, informal office setting

title: Marketing Internship: Consumer Behavior Analyst
description: HelpJob detailsinShare1   Job 1 of 1               Job Title Marketing Internship: Consumer Behavior AnalystLocation Minneapolis ( Bloomington )Country U.S.A.Work Area Marketing / CommunicationFull Time - Part Time Part TimeJob Type InternshipImageBody Copy We‰Ûªre looking for someone to take everything they‰Ûªve learned to a whole new level of doing in support of the IKEA ambition to be the leader in life at home.About the jobABOUT THE JOB You match IKEA home furnishing solutions to the needs and dreams of our customers. Plan, organize, and conduct interviews and analysis of the targeted customer segment's living situations (traditional university students) through visits to on campus housing, apartments, and house-sharing arrangements. With the support of IKEA staff and resources, you collect data about life at home for the traditional college student consumer segment; data may include information about living situations, room dimensions, home furnishing needs, tastes and preferences. After collecting data, you prepare a proposal using the IKEA 'Insight to Action' work method to to increase the understanding of the local market segment in the IKEA Twin Cities retail store, enabling staff to take action and create inspirational solutions relevant to the segment's needs and desires.YOUR ASSIGNMENT Your tasks will include:Create a proposed marketing strategy for recruitment of respondents from the targeted market segment for interviews and observations of living situationsUtilize the IKEA software to prepare interview teams for conducting home visits; establishing relevant interview questions, you coordinate with the IKEA Business partners to arrange for staff and resources to conduct the visitCommunicate and prepare the respondent for the interviews and observations; support the team in the home visit interview and observations by collecting data and insightsCompile the findings from interviews and observations and compare to relevant market data to create data trends. Provide analysis to store business partners for quick insights.Identifying trends and priorities within the segment, you transfer the learnings gathered from the home visit interviews to your IKEA business partnersCommunicate the home furnishing needs and desires in the targeted living situation through a formal presentation and written proposal to aid the IKEA business partners in developing relevant solutions in the local marketYOUR PROFILE Your knowledge, skills and experience include:You are working towards a degree in Marketing, Communication, Public Relations, Business Administration or a related field of studyYou have experience conducting research, interviewing research subjects, documenting observations, and preparing and delivering project presentationsYou have a strong interest in and knowledge of home furnishings, living situations, and the consumer/buyer in the purchase decisionGROWING TOGETHER IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global marketplace. And as the world‰Ûªs leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.Additional Information :PAID INTERNSHIP Targeted start dates: April 15 or April 29, 2017Anticipated weekly scheduled hours range:up to 20 hours weekly from position start through Mayup to 30 hours weekly from May through internship completion July/AugustYour Total Rewards Offer includes:15% discount for product purchaseSubsidized monthly mass transitTraining and developmentthe opportunity be involved in community projects that are People+Planet positiveOther perks such as Pet insuranceJob ID 275637BRBoiler Plate At IKEA, we see coworkers sharing from day one. We know it is a diversity of ideas that leads to real breakthroughs. Share your big ideas where everyone wants to hear them!Removal Date 03/10/2017              IKEA is an equal opportunity employerIKEA US participates in the E-Verify Program

title: Corporate Communications Summer Intern
description: HOME  ?Home Searchopenings SearchresultsCurrent pageJobdetails    Job details  Job 1 of 1Apply to job   Send to friend   Save to cart   Position Title Summer Intern- Corporate CommunicationsAuto req ID 3945BRLine of Business Corporate Administration (SSC, IT, Employee Services, Etc.)Department AdministrationPrimary Location Irving-TXEEO Statement Equal Opportunity Employer ‰ÛÒ Minority / Female / Veteran / DisabledJob PostingLehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified Corporate Communications Summer Intern.  This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products. Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, the global market leader in aggregates with leading positions in cement, concrete and other downstream activities. Following the acquisition of Italcementi, the company employs some 63,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in around 60 countries. Equal Opportunity Employer ‰ÛÒ Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled  Education Requirements:Junior or senior undergraduate studentJob Purpose:To participate in a program designed to provide students with work experience that is relevant to their major and complements their education.Primary Duties and Responsibilities:This individual will be responsible for performing a variety of tasks including:  Social media content development and implementation, with an emphasis on marketing communicationsWorking with regional support staff to identify and procure content for the company newsletter and websiteUpdating company website, social media sites, and intranet as appropriateThis position will afford real-world experience and offer exposure to the Corporate Communications environment.  BENEFITS & COMPENSATIONAt Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company‰Ûªs success and future growth. Lehigh Hanson‰Ûªs comprehensive package of compensation and benefit programs reflect this belief. We strive to develop competitive pay programs that will attract, motivate, retain and reward employees. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. title: Graphic Design Intern
description: Home JobsGraphic Design InternshipSEARCH JOBSLOGIN- MarketingIN, USA$10HourlyInternship‰Û¢ Employee discounts on wine and merchandise. ‰Û¢ Access to a comprehensive wellness program. ‰Û¢ Company sponsored social events.Email Me This JobOliver WineryGraphic Design Internship  DescriptionOliver Winery is looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic graphic design intern to join its marketing team. Oliver is a national, best-selling brand, and our marketing team produces innovative, strategic creative work. The design intern works alongside a full-time graphic designer in an intimate team environment while gaining experience in product design, advertising, and retail point-of-sale and display design. We value your talent, so this is a paid position aligned to the right candidate's schedule. The Intern will report to the Marketing Director with oversight from the Designer.  ResponsibilitiesWorks with full-time designer to produce and develop hands-on design work for Oliver Winery, including updates to point-of-sale materials and advertisements, menu and wine list design, retail display and signage, and creation of website and email design assets and digital graphics.  The design intern manages her or his own workflow as appropriate.  In addition, internship responsibilities include:Review and proof design conceptsPresent design concept boards and/or finished designs to team and clientsAssist marketing coordinator with asset management such as closing out finished projects and photography/stock asset inventories. Assist with Summer event guerilla marketing effortsPOS and retail element vendor sourcingAdditional duties, as assigned by Management.     Internship RequirementsA candidate who is a deadline-driven creative thinker will excel in this position.Successful candidate must have relevant course work and on-the-job experience in graphic design. Prefer candidates with on-the-job experience or students currently enrolled in graphic design or journalism with a design emphasis.Experience with the Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop, in a Mac environment is required.Must be organized and detail-oriented. Must have ability to work in a team-oriented, professional environment.  Members of our Marketing team will also possess the ability to:Execute assigned tasks at a high level, with attention to detail and thoughtful prioritization of effort.Actively collaborate with colleagues and departments across the company to meet the needs of key stakeholders and our audience. Clearly and effectively present information and ideas.Actively seek out knowledge in marketing and beverage industry, regularly sharing the best of the industry to inspire team members and clients.  In addition, all successful winery employees will be able to:Use your attitude and effort to contribute to a positive work environment. Be thoughtfully engaged and do your best work. Every day.Model the winery values: Respect People, Expect Quality, Think Differently, Get Stuff Done.   Typical Schedule: Anticipated timeline will be May 2017-August 2017, though an earlier start date may be arranged. 20 hours per week, flexible Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm.  Interns are paid at a rate of $10/hour. Employee discount on wine and merchandise and involvement in Oliver Winery staff outings will apply.  Due to the nature of our business, candidates must be over 21 years of age to apply.To apply please include a cover letter, resume, and three references who can substantiate your work ethic or design abilities. Materials must be received by Monday, March 20, 2017.  Applicants invited for interview will be asked to bring a portfolio of their design work. description: InternApply for this PositionEngageIQ is a marketing agency located out of Santa Clara, California that provides services to their clients in all parts of marketing with a focus on optimizing  online marketing efforts of the clients through the use of the latest technologies and advertising know-how. Billing millions of dollars in business per year, we help our clients make even more. EngageIQ is there to help them every step of the way. EngageIQ has the talent and the staff to help with all marketing and advertising projects that our clients need.EngageIQ is now looking to hire the ‰ÛÏperfect intern‰Û to join our team. If you have always wanted to get into the world of marketing, to put the knowledge learned in the classroom to use in the real world and to learn from the very best in the industry then you might be the ‰ÛÏperfect intern‰Û to join the EngageIQ team!This position will give the ‰ÛÏperfect intern‰Û the opportunity to work on so many things in marketing that all of your friends will be jealous Our ‰ÛÏperfect intern‰Û is:Tech SavvyProficient using computers, internet and web based toolsVERY strong written and verbal communication skillsSomeone who is a fast learnerAn added bonus if they have a degree in communications, liberal arts, and business and/or have worked in a fast paced environment in the past. title: Analytics Intern
description: Job DescriptionSign In|New UserPrevious JobNext Job  DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGSJob Posting NoticeJob DetailsJob ID:281582# of Positions:1Business Title:Analytics Intern, Development Hub Inspection ServicesCivil Service Title:Title Code No:Level:1023400SUMMER COLLEGE INTERNTitle Classification:Non-CompetitiveJob Category:Engineering, Architecture, & Planning, Policy, Research & Analysis, Public Safety, Inspections, & EnforcementProposed Salary Range:$     11.00 - $     13.67 (Hourly)  Career Level:StudentWork Location:1 Centre St., N.Y.Division/Work Unit:Development InspectionsJob DescriptionThe NYC Department of Buildings is responsible for ensuring the safe and lawful use of buildings and properties by enforcing the NYC Construction Codes, Energy Code and Zoning Resolution. We facilitate compliant development with integrity, efficiency and professionalism. We are committed to becoming a premier municipal building organization, dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for all New Yorkers and making our city safer. We are committed to improving our performance and developing procedures that are streamlined, understandable and transparent.Development Inspections is responsible for construction, electrical and plumbing Inspections across all five boroughs. The Development Hub is the central unit where the decisions, policies and overall management of citywide development inspections are made.Responsibilities:-Assist with monitoring service level activities for inspections-Assist Unit in preparing qualitative and quantitative analysis analytical reports-Assist in providing reports and statistics about Development Hub performance as requested-Assist in developing and managing data queries and data sets-Analyze, track, and report performance data-Support project efforts-Troubleshoot and support Inspection Ready efforts and projects-Prepare reports and recommendations on the approval of applications-Engage in research, investigations, studies and examinations-May be required to go out into the field with inspectors-Additional duties and projects as neededMinimum Qual RequirementsAs of June of the Program year the prospective interne must be a student matriculated in a college or be a recent college graduate (winter/spring term of the Program year).NOTE: Appointment to this title is only valid for the duration of the Program, June - August each year.Preferred SkillsPreferred Skills:Good judgment, Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPointAdditional InformationThis posting is for undergraduate students. Graduate students should refer to Job ID 281587.If selected, candidates must provide a transcript or enrollment verification statement from their school attesting that they are enrolled in an accredited degree program.Internships are available between May and September for a maximum duration of thirteen (13) weeks.To ApplyFor Non-City/External Candidates: Visit the External Applicant NYC Careers site (nyc.gov/jobs/search) and search for the specific Job ID #For Current City Employees: Visit Employee Self-Service (ESS) to view and apply for available positions.  Click on Recruiting Activities, Careers, and search for the specific Job ID #No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted.NOTE: ONLY THOSE CANDIDATES UNDER CONSIDERATION WILL BE CONTACTEDResidency RequirementNew York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. title: Graphic Design Intern
description: Laitram, L.L.C. Job AnnouncementDivision: IntraloxPosition: Graphic Design InternDate Posted: 02/15/2017Location: New Orleans, LADescription:Intralox, L.L.C. is currently seeking a Graphic Design Intern to work in their Marketing Department. This internship is a hands-on opportunity to learn the process of working on different B2B projects and campaigns in a global department that creates marketing collateral from landing pages to PowerPoint presentations and infographics to digital campaigns and interactive design, and more.About IntraloxIntralox produces over 50% of the world‰Ûªs modular conveyor belts, but our business is so much more than conveyors. We are working with some of the world‰Ûªs largest companies, helping them solve problems, create efficiencies, and grow the economy.Intralox is one of the five operating divisions of Laitram, LLC, which was selected by CityBusiness as the one of the 2014 Best Places to Work in New Orleans.Intralox CultureWe are smart, interesting, and sometimes quirky people solving problems big and small. We are seeking creative, curious, and intelligent people to join our ranks. Our company was founded on the power of a good idea. And we know that good ideas can only come from people. Because of this, we believe that self-managed people are our greatest resource and pride ourselves on our outstanding culture to support them. See us in action on YouTube!!!!!Responsibilities:åá Interacting with the global marketing team to define the requirements of various design projects, including creative briefs, deadlines, and measurable goalsåá Designing and/or editing a wide variety marketing collateralåá Assisting designers, copy writers, and other members of the marketing team with design projectsåá Working with business stakeholders on customer-facing presentationsRequirements:åá Completed at least 2 years in a degree-seeking program at an accredited institution of higher learning, focused on graphic designåá Well-developed skills in the fundamentals of design and the tools of the trade, including Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Microsoft Office Suiteåá The ability to help manage the production of work through the necessary approval processåá A deadline-driven focusåá Excellent communication skillsåá Ability to manage multiple projects and timelinesåá Passion for learning about B2B marketing, business challenges, project management, and designåá Ability to work independently with strict deadlinesåá Ability to take in, process and act upon feedbackåá Have great attention to detail and a streak of curiosityåá Awareness of current design trends for print and digital space, desktop and mobile platformsEOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled*LI-MD1

title: Summer Intern
description: Odyssey Reinsurance Company CareersSummer Intern - UnderwritingUnderwriting Stamford, ConnecticutApplyDescriptionOdysseyRe is a leading global property and casualty reinsurer with 30 offices in 11 countries. Reinsurers are part of the financial services industry, providing capital and risk management solutions for clients to efficiently manage economic risk in an ever-changing global business environment. OdysseyRe employs product specialists in virtually all lines of business in the insurance / reinsurance industry, across the globe.Our underwriters market, structure and price risk transfer products using sophisticated analytics and information gathered from frequent interactions with our clients and brokers. Therefore, an underwriting career at OdysseyRe incorporates a blend of analytical and sales activity and involves a mix of individual and team oriented work, in a highly collaborative environment. From the early stages of an underwriting career, you can expect to travel to a wide range of domestic (and occasionally international) locations to meet, and interact with, senior managers at client companies.We are committed to developing future underwriters and providing opportunities for young talent to explore the possibility of a career in underwriting.  Essential FunctionsWorking under the direction of a mentoring underwriter, an underwriting intern will be asked to perform tasks such as:Assist in the underwriting process for new and renewal business, including:Analyzing current and proposed program structuresReviewing program‰Ûªs quantitative model inputs /outputs from ActuarialOther information gathering / analysis to further understanding of program dynamicsAssist in documenting individual program underwriting process and conclusions, especially for bound businessAssist in marketing coordination and underwriting audit preparationWork on potential department projects, such as risk aggregation monitoring, specific line of business research and information analysis to support marketing plansSkills, Knowledge & AbilityStrong mathematical and analytical skillsStrong verbal and communication skillsStrong work ethic and ability to work collaborativelyFamiliarity with Microsoft OfficeEducation  Working towards Bachelor degree, preferably in economics, mathematics, or businessApply Apply Later‰  Back to Current OpeningsShareLinkedInFacebookTwitterEmailPowered by Jobvite

title: Summer Internship Logistics Sales, Operations, & Marketing
description: Privacy PolicyJob Openings2017 Summer Internship Logistics Sales, Operations, & MarketingSales/Brokerage ‰ÛÒ CHICAGO, Illinois2017 Summer Internship (with possibility to lead to full salary plus commission role)Candidates must be graduating in 2017 or 2018Chicago, IL, Goose IslandAt Circle Logistics, you are not just a number, you are an invaluable part of our company. We strive to maintain the open culture, in which everyone is a hands-on contributor. A culture where everyone feels comfortable sharing ideas and opinions in a growing, financially stable company. You will be part of a forward-thinking team that designs and implements the logistic operations that efficiently run shipments around the world for major well-known clients.Job Overview:The purpose of this internship is to learn our business at the direction of a mentor- in Operations, Sales, and Marketing.  Daily activities will include assisting in our day to day operations,  data entry, booking, dispatching and tracking truckloads across North America, email marketing, lead generation and sales appointment dialing.Pay is flexible -  based on experience with:Marketing, Sales, or operations experience Freight Brokerage or Driver Dispatching     Customer Service Experience in a call center environmentAdvanced Data management experience  Sales Experience in any industry, with ability to find decision makers and use CRM software   This is an entry-level role. Successful candidates will be eligible to move to a salary plus commission role specifically dedicated to Sales, Operations, or Marketing based on successful demonstration of each role throughout the internship.Job DescriptionProactive management and coordination of freight at the direction of a mentorAssist with company newsletters, social media, surveys, and email campaignsManage daily shipments to ensure timely pick-up and deliveryCommunicate internally and externally to ensure customers expectations are exceededResolve transportation problems with urgency and professionalismLead generation and sales appointment dialing Desired Skills & ExperienceAbove average  to expert computer skills, proficient in excel (lookup, pivot tables, reports) - Google Drive, Basic Graphic Design, and Email Marketing a plusExcellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to thrive is fast paced working environmentWilling to be available after hours and weekends if neededStrong work ethic - someone willing to work hard to learn the business and build a long-term career at CircleOutgoing - has the energy and personality to engage others in person and over the phoneAbility to multitask and work on multiple projects at onceExcellent problem-solving skillsTime management ability to balance new customer hunting with supporting existing accountsTeam Player that enjoys helping the team be successful as much as the individual success!Company DescriptionCircle Logistics Inc is a full-service asset-based logistics company committed to providing value-added transportation solutions to our customers. We leverage our technology, industry savvy employees, and management experience to develop transportation solutions for high profile clients. If there is one thing we have learned in this business over the years, it‰Ûªs that personalized service, along with communication, is the most important aspects of our industry. It‰Ûªs the combination of industry savvy and individual attention that separates us from our competition.Circle Logistics believe in providing recognition for employees, rewards their accomplishments, and honors ongoing professional development. Circle Logistics starts all employees with a training program that offers hands-on logistics experience and sales knowledge education. During training, you will connect with existing clients and a variety of internal business lines to help set you up for long-term success. If you are enthusiastic, driven, highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, accelerate your career with Circle Logistics!  What Circle offers:A lively work environmentPaid training internshipFlexible start datesFlexible timing around your summer schedulePotential to be offered full-time role upon completion or graduationFamily-centered culture you are not just a number here, you are part of our familyApply for this JobApply for this JobLink to this job00LocationCHICAGO, IllinoisDepartmentSales/BrokerageEmployment TypeInternMinimum ExperienceEntry-levelCompensation$12-15/hr+ based on expPowered by

title: Data Analyst Intern
description: Search for HomesBuy ‰Ð_Sell ‰Ð_Real Estate AgentsRedfin JobsENGINEERING & HQREAL ESTATEEARLY CAREERData Analyst Intern (Research)Communications | Seattle, WAApply NowRedfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in the consumers' favor, and we've built a world-class team to tell our story. Newspapers, websites and broadcast media cover the housing market every day, and Redfin has the goods to be the go-to, authoritative real estate source. Redfin is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to delve into its data and identify trends that are interesting and newsworthy for the real estate industry, economists and consumers. This position will work directly with Redfin's chief economist, director of analytics and a team of talented senior data scientists and analysts. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you.Who You AreSharp:  You should have strong analytical and quantitative skills. We're looking for a student working towards completing a B.S. in mathematics, statistics, operations research, engineering or one of the hard sciences. Students working towards Master's or PhD degrees are also encouraged to apply.Creative: You are able to build predictive data models and play with massive data set from various sources to find the best ways to turn data into research reports and insights. Your analysis will be used to write thought-provoking, compelling reports about the real estate industry, homebuyer and seller sentiment, Redfin business data and user behavior.Curious: Redfin is looking for an analytical juggernaut that doesn't stop at answering the "what" questions, we want someone who hungers for the "why" and "what if" questions.Concise: Communicating your ideas clearly to folks who don't share your passion for analytics is the mark of mastery.Inspiring: You are a brilliant writer and an influential conversationalist.  Take-charge:  You think like an owner and work to see your ideas put into practice.Technologies We Use & TeachExcel (required)Familiarity with SQL, R and Python is a plus and will be developed during the internshipInterns will receive exposure to machine learning, statistics, and big data: AWS (Redshift, S3, Spark), CassandraWe OfferAn amazing 12 week summer experience working on communications projects that matter to our businessAwesome start-up culture (snacks, lunches, office events, casual dress code)Smart and passionate co-workers and a manager invested in your growth and developmentLots of fun events with fellow interns and Redfin employeesSmall teams with great exposure to all levels of the companyCompetitive compensationRelocation stipend provided for eligible candidatesIND123Apply NowShare this job with your friends.Refer a CandidateRedfin is an equal opportunity employer.Individuals seeking employment at Redfin are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.Make a beautiful difference here.Redfin: About | Press | Research | Blog | Jobs | Referrals | Terms of Use | Privacy Policy | Feedback | Contact Us | Helpå© 2016 Redfin. All rights reserved. Patent pending.

title: Marketing Intern
description: Search for HomesBuy ‰Ð_Sell ‰Ð_Real Estate AgentsRedfin JobsENGINEERING & HQREAL ESTATEEARLY CAREERMarketing Intern - SeattleAnalytical Marketing | Seattle, WAApply NowRedfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in consumers' favor. At Redfin, you'll be able to unleash your brilliance to improve the end-to-end real estate experience and make one of the most important decisions of a person's life faster, easier, and more efficient. You'll be diving headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps and be a part of solving unique and challenging business problems in a customer-friendly way. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you. As a Marketing Intern, your job will be to help build and spread the word about the best home-buying and home-selling experience on the planet. You'll be working with a team sitting on the junction of marketing, analytics, technology, and real estate. You'll conceptualize, create, execute, analyze and optimize marketing campaigns that drive new business, re-engage dormant customers and stay in better touch with our happy clients who've already worked with Redfin.To be a marketing whiz, you must be able to:Be the customer and test relentlessly. What messages really resonate? How do we improve the home-buying or selling experience? How do we reach more people?  You'll be a testing fiend and figure out what works and what doesn't.Champion our agents. How do we help agents deliver great service to a huge and growing wave of customers?Work well across teams: You'll work with everyone from agents to product managers and analysts, designers to engineers to execs. Your mission? To run campaigns that increase awareness, improve customer satisfaction and drive new business. Who You Are:You're just starting a career in marketing and you're ready to roll up your sleeves and dive into this new work.You're creative. You get why customer service matters and you have a zeal for experimentation and building addictive, delightful user experiences and marketing campaigns.You take control. You start strong and you stay strong until the finish line is ten yards back.You love details. You get all the angles before you make a decision.You're a simplicity sensei, able to distill complicated info down to its essence, or give the full-bodied taste to those who crave every little detail. description: Sign InDeutsch (German)English UK (English UK)English US (English US)EspaÌ±ol (Spanish)FranÌ¤ais (French)Italiano (Italian)Nederlands (Dutch)’¥Ïµ_“Ð« (Korean)¨ÛŠ_ÒŠü_¾Ðà (Simplified Chinese)_ŽÇÓŠü_¾Ðà (Traditional Chinese)Career Opportunities: Sales Internship- Summer 2017 - Full Time (103243)Job Id 103243 - Posted 12/08/2016 - Sales - Americas - United States - Georgia - Alpharetta”âª  Job Description Print PreviewApplyApply using LinkedIn‰ã¢Save JobEmail Job to FriendReturn to List  Sales Internship ‰ÛÒ Full Time ‰ÛÒ Summer 2017Alpharetta,GAArrow Electronics - www.fiveyearsout.com  Who is Arrow Electronics?Globally headquartered in Denver, CO, Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services, and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions, with 2015 sales of $23.28 billion. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for over 100,000 original equipment manufacturers, contract manufacturers and commercial customers through a global network of more than 460 locations in over 85 countries.  A Fortune 120 company with 18,500 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial, and consumer electronics.  Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.  Why Be an Intern?Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degreeChance to network with 160+ interns across the U.S.Small forums with our Executives and past internsStretch your presentation skills in front of our VP‰Ûªs and Directors  ResponsibilitiesThe Inside Sales Representative Intern will assist in the day-to-day sales support and customer service activities for assigned accounts.  Perform sales support functions to provide the highest level of service and customer satisfaction while maintaining efficiencies in corporate operational processes and procedures.  Serve as a liaison between Arrow‰Ûªs internal resources (field sales, engineering, supplier marketing, manufacturing facilities, purchasing and other corporate departments), vendor resources and customers.  Demonstrates a proactive approach and sense of urgency on our customers‰Ûª behalf, anticipates our customers‰Ûª requirements and communicates efforts in a timely and effective manner.  Create influential customer, supplier and internal relationships.   Requirements & SkillsCurrently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs or Master‰Ûªs Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Operations or equivalent.Available to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the summer (May or June through Mid-August)3.0 GPA or HigherStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitaskProficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) suite with Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills (ex. Vlookups & Pivot Tables)Customer Service and detail oriented mind setEffective time management abilities  CompensationThis is a paid internship.  EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled  Arrow Electronics, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Open to all majors and class levels.Valid driver‰Ûªs license.  Reliable form of personal transportation.Auto insurance that satisfies the minimum requirement for the State of Ohio.Ability to work 11 am to 8 pm during the week and occasional Saturdays from 9 am to 12 pm.ApplyApply with LinkedInPosted 3 Days AgoFull timeR552About UsIGS is a leader in the energy industry advocating for an engaged society seeking positive change in the way customers manage and consume our energy resources. title: Field Sales Internship
description: Sitemap Contact Us WEloginAbout UsDivisionsPeople + PlanetNewsWorking at Wilbur-Ellis90 Yrs & BeyondHomeJob OpportunitiesField Sales Internship Opportunities! -- Summer 2017, Hart, TXJob OpportunitiesLibrariesCompany CultureJob OpportunitiesJob Opportunities Field Sales Internship Opportunities! -- Summer 2017, Hart, TXJob Title: Field Sales Internship Opportunities! -- Summer 2017, Hart, TXDate Posted: 2/27/2017Job Number: 4653Division: AgribusinessLocation: Hart, TXPosition Reports To: Branch ManagerPurpose of Job:  Are you a college student majoring in Agriculture, Plant Science or Horticulture? Do you have a desire to get hands-on, practical experience in Agriculture? Do you have the ability to work overtime when necessary?  Wilbur-Ellis is seeking interns in Texas for our field sales program. If you possess a high-level of ownership and accountability with a strong can-do attitude with a willingness to learn and strong communications skills, this may just be the opportunity for you!  For nearly a century, Wilbur-Ellis has experienced success and growth in marketing and distributing agricultural products and services. Join us and grow your career with a strong and profitable industry leader offering competitive compensation, tremendous growth and development opportunities, and a people-first work environment. Come grow with us!Responsibilities:  Wilbur-Ellis is currently accepting resumes for our field sales program in the following locations:‰Û¢        Rosebud, TX‰Û¢        Edinburg, TX‰Û¢        Rio Hondo, TX‰Û¢        Hereford, TX‰Û¢        Hart, TX‰Û¢        Farwell, TX  Please note on your resume, which geographical location(s) are of most interest to you!Required Skills, Experience and Competencies:  COMPANY CULTURE  Wilbur-Ellis is a company you can be proud to call your employerWilbur-Ellis markets and distributes agricultural products, animal feed and specialty chemicals and food ingredients. A privately held and consistently profitable company, we employ more than 4,000 people throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.  Wilbur-Ellis is for and about peopleWilbur-Ellis has enjoyed over ninety-three years of success and growth, all thanks to our people. Our employees are both leaders and team players who thrive on creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and a dedication to quality work, our customers and each other.  Wilbur-Ellis invests in the industry‰Ûªs best workforceWilbur-Ellis invests heavily in our employees by offering skill development and training, competitive compensation and benefits and a tradition of promoting from within for a broad range of career opportunities. And we foster a supportive, people-first work environment. The company offers custom solutions for the modern media landscape utilizing national cable networks, internet advertising and promotional events supported by marketing, research and award-winning creative services. Spectrum Reach applies insightful research to understand consumer behavior and build targeted, multi-screen media plans personalized for each customer.With offices in 41 states and 147 markets, Spectrum Reach covers over 27 million households throughout the country. title: Associate Analyst Intern
description: Skip NavigationOur BenefitsOur ValuesOur Hiring ProcessSocial MediaTwitterLinkedInYouTubeGlassdoorFacebookSearch Our JobsKeywordLocationRadiusSelect5 miles15 miles25 miles35 miles50 milesSearch Our JobsJob DescriptionAssociate Analyst InternApply nowJob ID 5316622Schedule Type FlexibleWork Hours 40Location Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin;Job DescriptionWells Capital Management (WellsCap) is a multi-boutique, asset management firm focused on institutional clients. Our diverse and autonomous teams provide a broad range of investment solutions across multiple asset classes and investment styles within three main categories: equity, fixed income, and quantitative.Why multi-boutique? We believe that: independent, focused investment teams generate alpha; investment teams should focus on investing for our clients without the distractions of operating a business; and risk management oversight should be independent from our teams to ensure we consistently meet client objectives. WellsCap has $356 billion in assets under management as of  September 30, 2016.Please note:   Successful candidate will intern with the Heritage Growth Equity Team based in Milwaukee, WI.  This is a full-time internship during the summer and it will continue part-time approximately 15 - 20 hours during the 2017- 2018 school year. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:Support senior analysts and portfolio managers with a combination of organizational, analytical, and research responsibilitiesCreate quarterly earnings reports and gather valuation models used in evaluating companies and industriesKeep abreast of company/industry news flow and market conditionsUtilized related Investment SoftwareAssist the team with any marketing responsibilities which includes preparing pitch books and marketing materialsManaging multiple tasks at one time, while remaining focused in fast paced environmentDemonstrate superior attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks in a fast paced environmentOther Desired QualificationsBackground in Finance or Accounting a plus, but not necessaryCandidate must show history of achievements, success and attention to detailAbility to work and communicate under pressureStrong oral, written and interpersonal communication skillsIntermediate experience in Microsoft OfficeWilling to commit to one full year with the teamWells Fargo will not sponsor visas for these positions and will not hire individuals whose work eligibility is based on their F-1 or other student visa status such as Optional Practical Training (OPT). Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis  DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.0012790WEALTH INV MGMT/WIM PSIApply nowShareLinkedInTwitterEmailAbout Our LocationMenomonee Falls OfficeView mapWorking at Wells Fargo ‰ÛÒ Our Hiring ProcessFind Jobs Near YouSign up for our Talent Community and receive Job AlertsSign upRelated JobsTeller - Milwaukee, WisconsinTrading Operations Speclst 2 - Menomonee Falls, WisconsinIntermediary Account Mgr 3 - Senior DCIO Relationship Manager - Wells Fargo Asset Management - Menomonee Falls, WisconsinWF StoriesBlogCorporate Social ResponsibilityWells Fargo is committed to hiring and retaining diverse team members including Military Veterans, Veterans with disabilities, and transitioning Military personnel. We are working to increase diverse representation throughout the company and create an inclusive environment for all team members. When recruiting, we work with talent resources that focus on diversity and Veterans. We attend Veteran-focused job fairs and identify Military Veteran job seekers through resources like Military.com, Recruit Military.com, Hire Vets First, our internal Veterans‰Ûª Team Member Network and others. To learn more about career opportunities with our company, please visit us at .Legal NoticesEEO is the LawSite MapRelevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.
