title: Summer Marketing Intern
description: Skip to contentLanguagesNYSE $37.11NewsroomLocationsOfficesAECOMPrimary MenuCareers  ?HOME > SEARCH OPENINGS > SEARCH RESULTS > JOB DETAILS  Job details  Job 1 of 1Apply to Job(s)   Send to friend   Save to cart   Requisition/Vacancy No. 147874BRPosition Title Tank Closure and Regulatory 2017 Student Summer Intern (LSE)Job Category Vacation Student / Internship / GraduateBusiness Line GovernmentCountry United States of AmericaState/Province/Region USA - South CarolinaCity AikenWhy Choose AECOM? AECOM is a premier, fully integrated professional and technical services firm positioned to design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets around the world for public- and private-sector clients. With nearly 100,000 employees ‰ÛÓ including architects, engineers, designers, planners, scientists and management and construction services professionals ‰ÛÓ serving clients in over 150 countries around the world, AECOM is ranked as the #1 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine‰Ûªs annual industry rankings, and has been recognized by Fortune magazine as a World‰Ûªs Most Admired Company. The firm is a leader in all of the key markets that it serves, including transportation, facilities, environmental, energy, oil and gas, water, high-rise buildings and government. AECOM provides a blend of global reach, local knowledge, innovation and technical excellence in delivering customized and creative solutions that meet the needs of clients‰Ûª projects. A Fortune 500 firm, AECOM companies, including URS Corporation and Hunt Construction Group, have annual revenue of approximately $19 billion. More information on AECOM and its services can be found at www.aecom.com.About the Business Line GovernmentAECOM works with national and local governments around the world to manage and support critical programs in the areas of defense, security and intelligence; energy and climate change; environmental cleanup and waste management; infrastructure development, protection and resilience; and international development. Our global operations and connected expertise enable us to provide cutting-edge, relevant and cost-effective solutions that help our clients safeguard and enrich society and the world we live in.Job Summary Provide support to Savannah River Remediation (SRR) as a Student Summer Intern Limited Service Employee (LSE) on the Savannah River Site (SRS), a US Department of Energy (DOE) facility in western South Carolina. This assignment is for the Tank Closure & Regulatory group.  The intern will work with project managers to learn the different aspects of project management. Several tank closure projects will be working during the summer of 2017. These projects will be in different phases of development so the intern can learn a project from inception, i.e. design, procurement, through the actual field work involving fabrication and installation. Some systems may be in the testing, start-up, and/or operational phases so the intern can also be involved in the actual testing and operations phases of a project. The intern should have basic computer skills, i.e. Microsoft Word and Excel. Microsoft Project and experience creating graphics using Microsoft products would be helpful.The intern will perform meaningful work in support of the organization.  Guidance will be provided using SRR processes and procedures.  Interns will prepare and present a final project to the SRR management team summarizing conclusions about the experience, impacts delivered and relevance for their future career.Additional Information:The internship will run for a 12 week period from May 15, 2017 until August 3, 2017. Housing is not provided but reasonable rentals are available through the University of South Carolina-Aiken student housing office. A 40 hour work week is set and scheduled by the individual departments.  SRS utilizes various work schedules including 5/8s (8 hours/day; five days per week), 4/10s (10 hours/day; four days per week), etc.  Each work day has a 30-minute lunch.  Interns will be paid a competitive hourly rate;  no summer interns will be assigned to shift work; overtime is not available;  Interns will be paid for site holidays (Memorial Day, July 4) as applicable. Assignments will be located in SRR facilities on the 300sq mile DOE site outside of Aiken SC.  Public transportation is not available and interns will be required to arrange their own transportation.   A valid Driver‰Ûªs License, Registration and proof of automobile insurance is required for driving on the Savannah River Site.If you are selected to participate in the SRR internship program, additional information will be requested such as:  SRR employment application, references and official transcripts.  You will be assigned to SRS General Employee Training and Drug and Alcohol test appointments before badging and commencement of assignment. Resumes should be submitted as early as possible and will be reviewed by the selection panel in January/February 2017.  All selected applicants will be contacted by March 1, 2017.  Please visit www.srremediation.com for more information. SRR is the Liquid Waste contractor at SRS and is comprised of a team of companies led by AECOM with partners Bechtel National, CH2M and Babcock & Wilcox. Critical subcontractors for the contract are AREVA, Energy Solutions and AECOM Professional Solutions.    Minimum RequirementsCandidate must be enrolled as a full-time student at:  an accredited four year university, and currently working towards a Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Project Management or Project Engineering OR  an accredited college or university, and currently working towards a Master‰Ûªs Degree in Project Management or Project EngineeringMust have a GPA of 2.5 or above.Due to the nature of work, candidate must be a US CitizenIn addition:Must pass General Employment Training (GET)Must pass Drug and Alcohol Testing (DAT)These two items will be scheduled before the intern starts work at Savannah River Site.Preferred Qualifications Although all qualified candidates will be considered, preference will be given to those who are enrolled at:  Auburn University  Clemson University  Coastal Carolina University  Georgia Tech  Howard University  Tuskegee University  University System of Alabama   University System of Florida  University System of Georgia   University System of North Carolina  University System of Tennessee   University System of South CarolinaWhat We Offer AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here to view the EEO Is The Law poster.Apply to Job(s)   Send to friend   Save to cart   CAREER OPPORTUNITIESCONTACT USOFFICESNEWSROOMCONTRACT VEHICLESSMALL BUSINESS/SUPPLIER DIVERSITYTERMS OF USEPRIVACY POLICYå© 2017 AECOM.All Rights Reserved.AECOMFollow UsTwitterFacebookLinkedInInstagramYouTube

title: Graphic Design Intern
description: StandardsRegistration & ReportingInspectionsEnforcementInternationalEconomic& Risk AnalysisCareersBrowse Open Jobs Search Open Jobs Submit Your Resume Edit Your Profile View Submitted ApplicationJob DetailsRequisition Number 17-0006Post Date 2/15/2017Title Graphic Design Intern - SummerDivision Office of Public AffairsPT/FT Full TimeCity WashingtonState DCDescriptionJob DescriptionThe PCAOB has a full-time position for a Graphic Design Intern in the Office of Public Affairs in its Washington headquarters office. This intern will provide design support to the Public Affairs team in preparing outreach and publications related to the oversight of auditors of public companies and broker-dealers. Intern will have exposure to all facets of public affairs work in a regulatory setting. Intern will support the presentation of consistent visual branding and style.ResponsibilitiesAssist in the design, layout, and preparation of key materials to support the PCAOB missionHelp to produce shareable content for print and digital useBrainstorm on how to visualize complex auditing concepts and issuesConduct research and analysis of design and style ideasDraft and update Board communication materials and databases, requiring strong organizational skills and attention to detailRequirementsQualificationsUndergraduate (junior or senior level) or graduate student, studying graphic arts  Proficient in social media platformsStrong written and oral communication skillsProficient in Microsoft Office suite, including PowerPoint and Word, Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign and Photoshop, and Microsoft OfficeProofreading and copyediting skills highly desirableMust be a person of unquestionable integrityMust be reliable and self-motivatedMust be energetic, bright, and enthusiasticMust be organized and meet deadlinesMust work as a team memberMust be flexible and solve problems independentlyOur ValuesThe PCAOB encourages a spirit of cooperation and teamwork, and fosters an environment of professional growth where employees can exercise their leadership ability, creativity, technical competence, and public interest focus in helping the PCAOB fulfill its mission.Our MissionThe PCAOB is a nonprofit corporation established by Congress to oversee the audits of public companies in order to protect the interests of investors and further the public interest in the preparation of informative, accurate and independent audit reports. The PCAOB also oversees the audits of broker-dealers, including compliance reports filed pursuant to federal securities laws, to promote investor protection.All PCAOB employees are entitled to equal opportunity and a professional work environment, free of discrimination and harassment. A workplace free of discrimination is fundamental to professional success and to the PCAOB's mission. The PCAOB will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.Send This Job to a FriendThis site is operated by UltiPro. http://www.ultimatesoftware.com. Use of this site is governed by Ultimate Software Group‰Ûªs policies and practices, including its Privacy Policy, which can be found at http://www.ultimatesoftware.com/Privacy-Policy.

We share motivational tips and stories of inspiring people and brands that are shaping the world. From one-on-one interviews, lifestyle hacks, blog features, business tips to breaking news we focus on delivering facts and positive stories! We are keeping thousand of monthly readers informed with What‰Ûªs Going On with the launch of the new website we are expecting that number to grow tremendously!This is an exciting opportunity for a college student with some social media and writing experience (outside of their own) to gain real world experience for a student to help him/her gain knowledge in writing, social media and the opportunity to experience working with the media (PR).Description: We are looking for a web-savvy and talented Social Media and Blogging Intern to join our team. People in the Corporate Function career track contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.  Finance professionals prepare and interpret financial plans and reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance with applicable financial rules and regulations, including internal financial controls, to mitigate risk for the company. May also shape and execute client deals to maximize the use of Accenture's capital and resources, manage cash and/or liaise with the investor community.Job DescriptionAccenture Investor Relations (IR) is responsible for developing and executing the strategy and programs to maintain relations with shareholders and the broader investment community. title: Product Analyst Intern
description: View All Open Jobs Search Open Jobs Edit Your Profile View Submitted ApplicationsJob DetailsCompany Trisept SolutionsRequisition Number 17-0024Post Date 1/31/2017Title Product Analyst InternCity MilwaukeeState WIDescriptionHave you ever wondered what it would feel like to be a part of an entrepreneurial company where your unique abilities are celebrated, you increase your creative energy and your role adds value every day? Sound impossible? It‰Ûªs not.La Macchia Enterprises (LME) has a unique story of being family-owned for over 40 years. We turn vacation dreams into long-lasting memories by focusing on our customers‰Ûª End-to-End Experience at every touch point. Our 1,000+ team members embody our core values, making us a global leader in leisure travel and technology. Our team is the reason we‰Ûªve earned a spot on the Top Workplaces list for multiple years.Trisept Solutions, a division of LME, was the first to process an online vacation booking. Trisept has continued its evolution working with the leading global airlines, hotels and theme parks to provide cutting-edge technology solutions. Visit www.triseptsolutions.com to continue the story.Now it‰Ûªs your turn to enhance your career with Trisept Solutions. Grow and learn with us as a Product Analyst Intern. You will bring a professional focus and consistency to Travel Agent Solutions‰Ûª product/engagement analytics and research. In this role, you will assist in targeting markets for revenue growth and provide a robust structure for tracking results and making decisions. You will collect and report site KPIs and also conduct primary competitive research scans. A successful Product Analyst Intern will:Conduct ongoing competitive research and analysis of travel technology and emerging competitorsReview and analyze website performance metricsCreate weekly Excel report on key website and marketing metrics to share with company leadership.Assist with creating monthly Delivery Reports for suppliersDevelop a way to turn our voluminous data into business intelligence (revenue opportunity)Assist with ROI analysis for RFPsUndertake other duties and responsibilities as assignedRequirementsApply today to be considered for this internship!$15 per hour.15-20 hours per week with a first shift schedule Monday through Friday.Flexible hours to accommodate class schedule.Working towards a Bachelor's degree in Business or Marketing (BA) from four-year College or university with focus on business management, statistics or related coursework.Must be at a junior or senior standing at the start of the internship and a 3.0 or higher grade point average is preferred.Expertise using Microsoft Office SuiteExcellent interpersonal, consultative, and communication skills (written and verbal)Excellent organizational, planning, facilitation, and prioritization skillsAbility to solve problems under time constraintsKnowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services and evaluation of customer satisfactionConsiders the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate oneConceptual knowledge of the marketing analyst disciplineWe are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free and tobacco-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.Apply On-lineSend This Job to a Friend

Expect the best for your career ‰ÛÓ come discover a workplace that can meet your high ideals and your desire to make a difference.Search Our JobsKeywordLocationRadiusRadius5 miles15 miles25 miles35 miles50 milesSearchMarketing ‰ÛÒ Creative Services Intern- LakelandApply NowAre you a college student looking for an internship this summer? Are you looking to gain valuable hands-on experience? Do you want to work on challenging projects? Do you want to network with professionals to develop skills beyond what you can learn in a classroom? If yes, then an internship at Publix may be the perfect fit for you.Our Summer Internships will occur from May 22nd through August 4th at our company facilities in Lakeland, Florida. Interns are offered competitive pay and are generally expected to work 40 hours per week, although this varies by department. We partner with Florida Southern College to provide housing for our out-of-town interns. As an intern, you will attend luncheons with Publix executives, participate in a local community service event, enjoy after-work socials, receive performance evaluations twice during the summer to evaluate your progress, and give an end-of-summer presentation to a large group of Publix leaders. Interns leave Publix at the end of the summer knowing they have made a valuable contribution to the organization with an experience that helps them grow professionally and personally.The primary responsibilities for this position include:designing the execution of projects, maintaining creative standards set forth by the Creative teamsrepurposing established design solutions, resizing existing art or pulling existing files and preparing for reprintphoto retouching and compositing of files provided by Creative Teamspreparing mechanicals and supporting art files for printing, delivery and archivingreviewing printer‰Ûªs proofsmanaging workloadworking on special Creative Services related assignmentsRequired Qualifications:be at least 21 years oldbe a rising Senior majoring in Graphic Designintermediate knowledge of MS Word, PowerPoint, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, and AcrobatKnowledge of the design processKnowledge of 4-color process, pre-press, image retouching and print industry technologyKnowledge of design execution of static graphic images to be repurposed for the webSamples of completed Design course projects or current portfolio in PDF formatPotential Annual Base Pay: NAAddress Line: 3300 Publix Corporate ParkwayCity: Lakeland, FL between Orlando and TampaAdditional Information: Please be sure to monitor your email including your spam folder, daily for communications you may receive during the recruiting and selection process for this position. title: Intern - Inside Sales/Marketing/Proposal Support
description: Join UsLearn About UsSee Our ResultsInvestorsLocationsSuppliersHome/Join us/Apply for a jobReady to join us? Search for positions worldwideWelcome. You are not signed in.|My Account OptionsMy Job Cart|Sign InJob SearchMy JobpageBasic Search|Return to the home pagePrintable Format  Job Description Intern - Inside Sales/Marketing/Proposal Support - (BI 000139)Description The CompanyWith 2015 revenues of approximately $12.1 billion and net income of $302 million, Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs) is one of the largest publicly traded (NYSE: JEC) and diverse providers of professional technical services in the world. Founded in 1947, the company has a market capitalization of $4.35 billion and over 63,000 employees worldwide.  The company‰Ûªs service portfolio consists of a comprehensive range of business solutions related to engineering, architecture, construction, operations and maintenance and scientific and specialty consulting.  Position Summary Working closely with the Inside Sales Manager and Inside Sales Coordinator, the Intern provides marketing and administrative support services to Jacob‰Ûªs Inside Sales Organization within the Global Building and Infrastructure Line of Business.Assists with developing sales documents using applicable tools, guidelines and templates.Implements opportunity response plans i.e. activities, deliverables, owners, milestones etc.Collects company data or conducts internal/external research as appropriate for opportunity response documents and/or strategy development.Maintains sales qualification materials and supporting information in designated information management or filing systems.Develops appropriate network within the company to facilitate identification and sharing of relevant information, best practices etc. between offices.Conducts client, competitor and market research as required in support of client and/or opportunity strategy development.Collaborates with the designated core client sponsorship team to establish and populate dedicated core client information repositories (e.g. eRooms), and supports the development of documented client strategies and related information.Assists in the preparation of written and graphical elements of sales opportunity response documents such as proposals, qualifications and presentations.Interacts with operations and outside sales personnel to support development of sales material.Proofs and edits technical and non-technical documents for consistency.Works with designated response team members to develop opportunity response plans in alignment with our Relationship Based Sales (RBS) process.Organizes and participates in response-related meetings (internal and/or client), as appropriate.Assists in the production of response documents (printing, copying, binding, shipping)  Qualifications  Anticipated Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Marketing or comparable discipline from a four-year college or university in the next 2 years is required Advanced skills and experience working with Microsoft Office suite and with proficiency in database applications requiredEffective verbal and written communication skills in English requiredAbility to work after hours and on weekends, and sometimes on short notice requiredAble to travel as needed requiredMust be attending a local university and class schedule should allow at least 20 hours of work a week.At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Jacobs does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of: race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.  Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Jacobs does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of: race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by country, regional, or local law. To view the DOL's Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster, please click here. We serve a broad range of companies and organizations, including industrial, commercial, and government clients across multiple markets and geographies. Our global network includes approximately 66,000 employees in more than 250 offices in more than 30 countries, with operations in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, India, Australia, Africa, and Asia. title: Marketing Intern
description: search againJob AttributesJOB ID1144REQ. NUMBER2016-1144CATEGORYInternshipDEPARTMENTNorth Texas Chapter [11265]LOCATIONDallas, TXUSSTATUSNon-ExemptJOB TYPEInternSHIFTNot DefinedCAREER LEVELNot DefinedEDUCATION LEVELNot DefinedTRAVELNot DefinedSALARYNot DefinedCAMPAIGNN/AAPPLY NOWSHARE THIS ONSHARE THIS ON:HOMEABOUT USWORKING HERECAREER AREASNEW SEARCHPREVIOUS SEARCHMarketing InternDallas, TXJob DescriptionWhy LLS:How many people can answer the question, "What do you do for a living?" with the answer, "I help find cures for cancer." At LLS, employees take our mission seriously. Whether you work in one of our chapters, are an accountant at the national office or a specialist in our Information Resource Center, you work each day on making our mission a reality: Cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families.Join us and give new meaning to the word, "job."Overview:LLS is seeking an energetic individual to provide marketing support for the chapter office, working with our special events department. The intern will assist in recruiting new event participants, maintaining databases, performing community outreach, assisting volunteers and providing administrative support. This is a great opportunity to experience working in a nonprofit environment with potential for advancement.Responsibilities:Develops and maintains ongoing communication with campaign prospects, participants and alumniAssists in generating and executing grassroots marketing initiativesAssists in monitoring and maintaining chapter Web sites for consistency, accuracy and overall effectivenessAssists in the creation and distribution of press lists, media advisories, calendar listings, pitch letters and press releasesAssists in the collection of media clips and the creation of a media binder to archive clipsMaintains a working knowledge of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's missionQualifications:Must be enrolled in a four year institutionDetail-oriented and strong organizational skillsProfessional demeanorExcellent written and verbal communication skillsWorking knowledge of MS Office and database managementStrong interpersonal skillsAbility to work in a team environment while also able to work independentlyMust be able to dedicate 15-20 hours per week. Work hours are flexible in order to work around class schedules.Disclaimer:The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. title: Creative Marketing Internship
description: Creative Marketing InternshipSan Diego, CAInternCompany DescriptionWho We Are...Based in sunny San Diego, Perfect Bar, LLC is a family-owned natural foods company and maker of Perfect Bar, a line of organic and handmade whole food nutrition bars that are gluten-free, non-GMO, high in protein and contain no chemical preservatives, artificial ingredients, or refined sugars. Our products are sold nationwide at retailers including Whole Foods Market, Sprouts Farmers Market, Costco and many more. Our success is built on a deep commitment to producing the highest quality products made by real people, all in the pursuit of a healthy mind, body, spirit. Job DescriptionA Bit About the Role...Perfect Bar is seeking an eager and stellar candidate for its Creative Marketing Intern role, to assist and support the marketing team in a fast-pace, agency-style environment. Candidates should have a thirst for creativity, knack for writing, interest in health and nutrition, and love for thinking outside of the box. In this role, you can expect to be hands-on during content production, flex your writing and social media muscles, and thrive in helping with creative development for print, digital and social media assets.Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities...åá Assist Marketing Communications Coordinator with creative campaign concepts for influencers and fans, alikeåá Research and share trends in the health, nutrition, fitness and wellness industry with marketing team, to feed into content calendaråá Manage and update the content and programming for all digital production calendars, social media content calendar, and marketing project list with weekly status updates.åá Contribute to any and all production needs, including: recipe composition, co-branded photos, short-branded videos, etc.åá Communicate with ambassadors and fans to aggregate content and ensure transparency with the brandåá Assist with day-to-day social media messaging across all social channels (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube, Instagram, Wordpress Blog).åá Manage, organize and inventory marketing assets including images, video, media kits and print items and coordinate distribution of each to sales team and management team members.åá Work with team to carry out public relations campaigns to gain awareness for the brand and productsåá Ensure brand consistency and alignment for all published content (updated photos, videos and copy) across all outlets including various websites and print publications.åá Assist and manage event planning and logistics with internal and third-party stakeholdersåá Any other ad-hoc projects assigned by marketing teamQualificationsWho We Want...åá 2-4 years of college coursework in communications, marketing, journalism, public relations or title: Marketing Intern
description: Marketing Intern Austin, TXPart-Time Apply To Position Apply Using LinkedIn About Square Root We are Square Root, an Austin-based tech startup, and a leading enterprise SaaS provider. CoEFFICIENT, our flagship product, is a cloud-based platform that leverages data to help large retail networks improve performance. Today, some of the biggest players in automotive and retail use our product to optimize their daily operations. Since 2013, we've received a number of awards for our business growth and unique culture, including being named an Inc. 5000 company, a best small company to work for in Texas by Texas Monthly, and a top local startup by the Austin A-List. Most recently, we were named one of the best small companies to work for in the U.S. by Fortune magazine. Role Description We‰Ûªre looking for a part-time marketing intern with a genuine interest in startup culture, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a strong desire to learn. Our intern will tackle all things marketing, including the fun stuff like external events and social media. At the end of the internship, this person should have a good snapshot of the sales and marketing functions plus have a sense for the day to day life at a startup. Each day here presents its own challenges, so, we need a go-getter, willing to jump into any task. Sound like you? If so let‰Ûªs chat! Role Responsibilities Manage digital marketing programs, including PPC, display, and retargeting advertising Track and report monthly marketing activities across all programs Assist in the coordination of tradeshows and events Handle sales research and list development + CRM management and reporting Produce, edit, publish and measure content for the Square Root blog, ads, and social channels Assist as needed with additional marketing programs and activities Role Requirements Currently enrolled in a 4-year undergraduate degree program graduate-level program Interest in future career in sales, marketing, or advertising Enthusiasm and eagerness to learn Superb verbal and written communication skills Self-motivation, maniacal attention to detail, and desire to produce the highest quality work Relocation will not be covered for this position Please apply with a cover letter The start date is flexible for either Spring or Summer Apply To Position Powered byBreezy HR Share to Gmail Share to LinkedIn Share to Twitter Share to Facebook

Marketing Internship, Summer 2017 White Marsh Location TIC Gums is consistently ranked as America‰Ûªs #1 preferred supplier of hydrocolloids to the food industry. We are seeking students who are currently pursuing a business or marketing related degree for an upcoming intern opportunity for this summer. This position will work directly with our Associate Marketing Manager and Marketing team and will be located at our Texture and Innovation Center in our White Marsh, MD location. In this role, the intern will support tradeshows including preparation and post show follow-up, complete documentation and literature requests, update sales presentations, materials, and documentation, website updates, create a library of blog posts, data cleanup in our CRM software, and develop a marketing campaign list. Students should possess the following skills and experience: strong writing skills, strong computer skills, specifically MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word; ability to work independently and ability to multitask; must be detail oriented; ability to learn quickly; experience with Photoshop preferred; InDesign experience not required but a plus; pursuing a degree in marketing or business with a minor in marketing. Students will be assigned a department supervisor who will provide guidance on day-to-day tasks, as well as expose the student to the working environment of TIC Gums. title: Marketing Intern
description: VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS Marketing Intern San Francisco, CA Internship Marketing Entry Level Doximity is changing how doctors communicate. We‰Ûªve built the largest network of physicians, with over 70% of US doctors as members, and we‰Ûªre just getting started. After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. We believe that when doctors are connected, patients benefit and the healthcare system improves. As the eyes and ears of our users, the marketing team‰Ûªs responsibility is to deeply understand our clinicians‰Ûª challenges and strategically build marketing campaigns to meet their needs.  There are also opportunities to work with our BD and product teams with the goal of assisting with partnerships and integrations that will enhance product, grow membership and meet our strategic goals for 2017.  What you‰Ûªll do Build and track cross channel marketing strategies that reach every single clinician in the U.S. Drive and optimize our offline and online marketing initiatives. Support the company‰Ûªs market research and competitive positioning analysis to identify key competitors and potential partners with business development and product teams. Identify unique ways to drive member growth and expansion through product enhancements and business partnerships Characteristics that will help you succeed Passionate about improving the state of healthcare. Pre-med or currently in medical school is a plus. Articulate: Whether you‰Ûªre on the phone, or writing an email or crafting a product guide, you are eloquent and reflect the voice of the company (and adjust when needed). You have strong writing and editing skills. Your mantra is: Data or it didn‰Ûªt happen SQL knowledge is a plus. Healthcare or hospital experience preferred, but not required. MacGyver attitude: When something needs to get done, you are creative, persistent and resourceful. You do what it takes to GSD (get stuff done). Personable: Whether you‰Ûªre talking to businesses, colleagues or our beloved doctors (our users), you can hold your own. Perks Fully stocked kitchen, breakfast and catered lunch daily. CalTrain/Muni pass. All-company retreat in fun places like Beverly Hills and Lake Tahoe. Rooftop game room with a beautiful view of SF skyline. About Doximity Doximity is the leading online medical network with over 70% of U.S. doctors as members. Putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system. VC-backed startup located in SoMa San Francisco. Strong revenues, real market traction. Launched by Jeff Tangney in 2011; Jeff previously founded healthcare pioneer Epocrates (NASDAQ: EPOC). After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. title: Marketing & Strategy and Innovation Summer Intern
description: Welcome. You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Advanced Search | All Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Marketing ‰ÛÒ Strategy and Innovation Summer Intern - 17001HT  Description  Opportunity:  Our 10-week Summer Internship Program is an ideal way for both undergrad and graduate students to gain real-life work experience while learning what a career at Blue Shield of California can offer. Interns work on real-world projects and initiatives while being immersed in all aspects of our business. From interacting with senior leadership to visiting a neighborhood health clinic, interns will build a better understanding of the diversity and complexities of working in the dynamic world of health insurance. Our goal is to build a talent pipeline that will help us grow our company into the future.  Below is some information on the project this intern will be working on:  This particular BSC intern will receive detailed healthcare industry experience including strategy and innovation, product knowledge, competitive insights and regulatory agency exposure. Hands on experience will be geared towards Market Share and Market Analysis that supports BSC‰Ûªs ACO Growth Strategy, Self-Funded market expansion, and target market segment initiatives. In addition, the candidate will have opportunities to manage smaller projects including competitor scorecards while also being introduced to a variety of cross-functional team members and leaders within the Markets organization.  Exposure to a variety of tools and resources will be offered including but not limited to advanced development of Excel skills, introduction to Tableau, an understanding and usage of BSC Databases that drives inputs into formal business presentations that offer context and a means for actionable decision making by BSC leaders. Also, this particular intern will be provided an overview of the California regulatory filings [CDI and DMHC] both financial and product to gauge a broader understanding of the National and California market place along with the importance of Accountable Care Organizations and relevance of the Consumer to the future state of healthcare. Additional exposure will include understanding of the BSC Market Segments and how they are and will be used to support our Brand Strategy.  Primary deliverables will be a Market Share analysis and competitive scorecards including quantitative and qualitative analysis for Markets and Senior Leadership. The output will be suitable for presentation to quarterly executive strategy sessions including the Operating Committee and BSC Board Meetings.  This position directly supports BSC‰Ûªs growth and Brand strategy with an emphasis on expanding our ACO and Self-Funded membership while effectively differentiating Blue Shield from our competitors.     Qualifications  Candidate Profile and Requirements:  ‰Û¢ Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Healthcare Management, or a related field from an accredited college/university ‰Û¢ Minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA ‰Û¢ Proficiency in MS Excel - Pivot tables, VLookUp and IF statements knowledge required ‰Û¢ Experience with databases ‰Û¢ Proficiency with Tableau required ‰Û¢ Self-directed and highly curious ‰Û¢ Qualitative and quantitative analysis capabilities  Compensation:    Blue Shield of California offers Summer Interns a competitive compensation package. Housing and relocation assistance is not available.   External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws. title: Intern - Marketing
description: Find Opportunities U.S. English Sign In Summer Intern - Marketing Marketing Apply with LinkedIn Apply now Posted: February 21, 2017 Full-Time Rate: $15 USD per hour Minneapolis, MN, United States TITLE Develop a Life Science Blog Strategy and Facilitate Content Development (IN/372) POSITION SUMMARY The world of Life Science marketing is evolving very rapidly. How researchers like to get information and how they use that information to make purchasing decisions is constantly changing and companies involved in this industry need to adapt quickly to increase awareness and relevance of the products and services they offer. One of the ways that companies stay at the forefront (and on the first page of Google search results) is to have high quality, meaningful content that is refreshed on a regular basis. A key component of marketing strategies is to have a Blog that features timely and focused information that customers want to read. There are multiple benefits to having an attractive, high traffic blog including that it provides a conduit to other portions of the company website and (usually) helps to improve search results. Our summer intern program is looking for a student that has a life science background, strong writing skills, and some experience with digital marketing strategies. Their project will be to put together a blog strategy including the creation of content along with a schedule of important topics for the months to follow the internship. Qualified candidates will need to be self-starters with the ability to work independently, be comfortable working in a highly matrixed environment, and be willing to thrive and grow in a positive, team oriented environment. DEADLINES The application deadline is March 10th, 2017. Finalists will be interviewed and notified of internship selections no later than May 12th, 2017. SCHEDULE This program will run eleven weeks starting Monday, June 5th, 2017 and ending Friday, August 18th, 2017. All positions are full-time, with the 40 hours generally worked between 8:00 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Students must be able to work full-time for the entire length of the program. WAGES $15.00/hour WHO YOU ARE All internship positions are designed to give Junior level college students an opportunity to apply techniques learned in an academic setting while obtaining new skills. All interns will be required to conclude the program by giving a formal presentation on their work. Eligible students must: Be a junior-level college student, as determined by the number of college credits completed by the application deadline. Must have a major in a field related to the internship for which they are applying. Hold a GPA of 3.0 or better in science courses. Successful applicants must have completed introductory courses and made progress in their required upper-division level of coursework. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel are as well as computer entry and/or typing skills are desirable. Must be able to work in a fast pace environment, multi task, and have good communication skills, both verbally and in writing. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.   HOW TO APPLY Required application materials include: 1)      Internship selections (can chose up to four selections, list via Job Code) 2)      Cover letter 3)      RÌ©sumÌ© 4)      Official transcript(s) from all colleges attended 5)      Two professional or academic references, including names and contact information. A letter of recommendation is also preferred but not required. To apply, applicants should submit their selections, cover letter, rÌ©sumÌ© and references online on the Career Opportunities page of our company website. Official transcripts should be sent by standard mail directly to the company.   To complete the online portion of the internship application, student applicants should: ‰ÛÏSubmit Your Applications‰Û and include your selections, cover letter, rÌ©sumÌ© and references. Official transcript(s) and all other application materials should be postmarked no later than March 10th, 2017, and mailed directly to the company at the following address: Bio-Techne Attn: Internship Program 614 McKinley Place NE Minneapolis, MN 55413-2610   Questions can be directed to 612-379-2956 or hr@bio-techne.com Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor‰Ûªs legal duty to furnish information. Bio-Techne is an EEO/AA employer

title: Marketing Intern
description: Summer Internship Opportunities Location: NJ - Mahwah Department: Jaguar Land Rover Marketing & Sales Description Jaguar Land Rover North America‰Ûªs summer internship program is a great opportunity for college students entering their junior or senior year, or who are currently in a graduate school program, to gain hands-on experience in the exciting world of the automotive industry!  This is a great opportunity for personal growth and development from a business and learning perspective.   Details of the program:         The program is open only to students at a Junior or Senior level in their Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree program, or who are enrolled in a Graduate School program.         This is a summer internship (running form June through August 2017), and the successful intern must be able and willing to commit to the full length of the program.         Intern is asked to work for 40 hours per week in the Mahwah, NJ office (Business hours are Monday through Friday 8:30 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:30 PM).     Outline of Role: We are currently have three summer openings, one in each of the following departments: Customer Relationships & Insights Finance Commercial Aftersales/Business Analytics   The successful interns will gain hands-on experience and exposure to how our business runs.  Supporting our teams on special projects and initiatives that impact customer experience, customer retention, business strategy.  Interns will perform analysis of data, and prepare reports and make recommendations.  Interns will assist with monthly national and regional reporting, and verification of data, and work with his/her respective team on how to improve processes and performance.   These internships will provide an opportunity to develop business acumen, leadership, and project management skills, as well as develop analytical and reporting skills.   Key Criteria for Role: Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in progress (Junior or Senior), or pursuing a graduate studies degree (in Business, Marketing, Finance, or related discipline); 3.0 GPA or higher; Intermediate to advanced Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills, and previous data manipulation experience is a plus; Strong communication and presentation skills; High level of professionalism; Detail-oriented, self-starter, strong work ethic, team player,  ability to build rapport and communicate confidently; Self-starter and ability to work independently or with teams as required; Ability to leverage insights to draw sound conclusions and translate them into actionable recommendations.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. title: eCommerce Brand Marketing/Content Intern
description: Skip Navigation Home Search Jobs Locations Associate Benefits Internships How to Apply & FAQs About Us Social Responsibility SEARCH JOBS Keyword Location Radius miles 5 miles 15 miles 25 miles 35 miles 50 miles Search For Canada jobs click here eCommerce Brand Marketing/Content Intern Apply Job ID ECCI0217-999INT Date posted 02/27/2017 Job Description Crate and Barrel is America‰Ûªs most exciting housewares specialty retailer with over 100 locations with more than 7,000 associates nationwide.  Be a part of our Northbrook, Illinois corporate office‰Ûªs team that supports crateandbarrel.com,cb2.com and landofnod.com. If you are committed to creating great customer experiences and have a passion for eCommerce, see what's in store for you!  This role supports the eCommerce Brand Merchants and is responsible for day to day execution of content on the site, online merchandising, and promotional messaging. This is an ideal role for someone looking to gain experience in eCommerce and marketing. Execute merchandising/shipping promotions, marketing content and brand initiatives using web CMS, in house tools, as well as outside tools to support site, app and additional channels as needed.  Execute content across site and run quality control processes to ensure flawless execution.  Update seasonal/specialty content areas of the site. Contribute to strategy and development of creative executions of marketing campaigns and initiatives.  Maintain internal promotions calendar and cards in internal workflow system.  Partner with design team to create assets to support execution needs.  Participate in team creative brainstorms and process optimizations.  Ensure marketing assets are always up to date  Help with product merchandising on eCommerce site and other miscellaneous marketing tasks as required Promote strong sense of teamwork by working together effectively, respectfully and efficiently with all associates. Provide and support excellent service by exhibiting a positive attitude and enthusiasm toward the job and company to both internal and external customers in all forms of communication. Required Skills College Senior, recent graduate, or graduate student pursuing degree in related field Efficiently meet deadlines, be detail oriented, able to self organize and strong communication skills High attention to detail, process oriented, fast learner, self starter Tech Savvy Communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you Self-motivated, quick learner, and able to prioritize and multi-task effectively Ability to collaborate and work on a busy and dynamic team Solid written and verbal communication skills Desire to learn and implement principles of E-commerce and marketing Positive, enthusiastic attitude and a natural problem solver Knowledge of HTML and CSS helpful, but not required The job description and other aspects of the job listed on this job posting should not be construed to contain every function/responsibility that may be required to be performed by an associate in this job. Associates are required to perform other related functions as assigned. title: Copywriter Summer Internship
description: Go to our website åÈ åÇ Go back to job listings Copywriter Summer Internship Location: Austin, TX Department: Creative Department Type: Internship Min. Experience: Student (College) Copywriter Summer Intern Austin, TX $14.00 per hour Springbox offers a fun, stimulating, technology-focused work environment that is fast-paced and rewarding. We are committed to fostering an environment where highly talented, challenge-hungry people thrive. You will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skill-set, while making a real contribution to a rapidly expanding agency. Our Austin office is looking for a Copy Intern to work alongside our teams and aid in various tasks including, drafting and editing copy for web pages, Facebook posts, tweets, editorial calendars, digital ads, marketing campaigns, style guides, presentation decks and more all the while adhering to established writing styles and brand/voice guidelines. This candidate will possess the ability to sort and parse information into smaller pieces, tag/filter information and input content into an online content management system, like Word Press. A successful intern will be able to adapt to new processes, tools and techniques with a willingness to experiment, sometimes fail, and inevitably succeed. This position provides the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects on both an internal and client-facing basis.  Creativity, the ability to collaborate, independence, flexibility and accountability are a must. This is an amazing opportunity to learn and grow your skill set, and could also turn into a full-time job upon graduation.  Responsibilities: Participating in Creative Team brainstorming sessions Drafting and editing copy for web pages, Facebook posts, tweets, editorial calendars, digital ads, marketing campaigns, style guides, presentation decks and more Tagging content for search or SEO keyword optimization Auditing websites to inform content strategy and decisions Concepting on potential ideas for both internal projects and current clients/campaigns Supporting internal marketing initiatives with the same level of enthusiasm as client opportunities Building client and internal facing presentations Completing additional duties/tasks as assigned Requirements/Qualifications: Junior or Senior status at an accredited university, or recently graduated Pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in English, writing, marketing/advertising, journalism, communications or related field  A good understanding of digital copywriting techniques and best practices Demonstrated creativity and experience with social media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Vimeo, Pinterest) Confidence with Google Apps and Microsoft Office tools (Google Slides, PowerPoint, Word, Excel) Familiarity with or willingness to learn content management platforms (WordPress) Attention to detail with an inquisitive and creative mindset Able to thrive in both isolated and team environments A high degree of professionalism and a commitment to excellence Bonus Skills: HTML/CSS and Javascript skills Efficient in Photoshop and/or Illustrator Perks (because it matters, right?): Wear what you want to work, up to a point. No speedos. Fully stocked ‰ÛÏbeverage‰Û refrigerators. Located downtown at 8th and Colorado Ave. (Plenty of coffee shops close by) Modern, comfortable workplace, with areas to chill when you need it. Ping Pong Table Flexible hours. Some of us aren‰Ûªt morning people! Bring your best friend to work (Dogs allowed) Ego-free environment   Application Process and Deadline: Please apply by March 31, 2017; Applicants who have been selected for an interview will be contacted 1-2 weeks after the application deadline. Program Dates: 10-week program beginning approximately Monday, June 5th, and ending on Friday, August 11th.  Full time 40-hour work week.  åÇ Go back to job listings Apply for this Position * Required fields First name* Last name* Email address* Location * Phone number* Resume* Attach resume or Paste resume Cover Letter* College or University* profile URL: Website, blog or portfolio:* Earliest start date?* In 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. Try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!*

title: Marketing Intern Summer Interns
description: Marketing Intern Summer Interns Austin, Texas Apply Q2 Software is focused on empowering returns on relationships for community-centered financial institutions and their retail and commercial account holders. We do this with the most comprehensive, secure and adaptable smart banking platform of its kind, designed to deliver a compelling, consistent user experience on any device and enable customers to deliver secure, innovative services and increasingly, to generate new sources of revenue.  Named as one of Austin‰Ûªs fastest growing companies and one of the best places to work, Q2 offers our employees a culture fueled by engaged, motivated and dedicated team members.  We have been named as Austin‰Ûªs Best Places to Work six years in a row.  Q2 offers an oftentimes hard to find dynamic work environment that welcomes innovative ideas, rewards hard work and commitment, exposes its members to growth opportunities, and encourages evolution of individuals, methodologies, processes, and systems.  Q2 is seeking a Marketing Intern to join our fast paced marketing team.  The Summer Internship Program is 10 weeks long and all positions are paid hourly, with an average work week of 40 hours. We are looking for energetic, innovative, ‰ÛÏout of the box‰Û thinkers who want to learn and grow with a successful and passionate Austin-based software company.  Read more about us at www.q2ebanking.com.  In order to be considered for the Intern Program, you must be currently pursuing a degree.    RESPONSIBILITIES:  Execute components of integrated marketing campaigns as required (email, social media, web) Support marketing programs to help banks and credit unions market to their account holders Manage Q2 online user group membership, working with our online forum vendor Support webcasts and programs to drive demand for Q2 products and services Support Q2 Culture efforts, serving on a team of employees to drive employee engagement and fun Responsible for ensuring that all security, availability, confidentiality and privacy policies and controls are adhered to  EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE:  Pursuing Degree in Marketing Interest in marketing Interest in online research Exceptional work ethic, highly efficient and accurate Excellent attention to detail Ability to operate independently and proactively with minimal up front instruction and take ownership of work product; driven, diligent, and self-motivated Excellent time management and organizational skills Ability to work independently or as part of a team Excellent communication skills with a customer service focus Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Trustworthy and discreet with confidential financial and employee data  Apply Apply Later ‰  Back to Current Openings Share LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Email Similar Jobs Marketing Intern Powered by Jobvite

title: Social Media Intern
description: SOCIAL MEDIA INTERN All Internship Opportunities | Austin, TX, United States Send Jobvite T3 is looking for a Social Media Intern to join our Connections team. In this position, you will work on a variety of social media-related projects across several accounts spanning different industries. The ideal candidate will have strong strategic, organizational and executional skills, be well versed in how brands use social media and paid media to connect with their customers and a working understanding of social engagement best practices.  The Social Media Intern at T3 will work with cross-functional teams under tight deadlines, so being proactive with a keen sense of detail, organization and time management will be required. Having the ability to take direction and work independently to develop appropriate materials is key. Please include links to your own social media presence as well as a portfolio of social media-related projects you have been involved in.  The ideal candidate should have a background in advertising, communications, marketing, media, PR or social media, preferably with relevant digital coursework. A basic understanding of digital, mobile, media and social media technologies is a plus. A bachelor's degree in Advertising, Marketing or Public Relations is ideal, along with previous agency experience. Copywriting skills and/or a background in paid media would be a plus. This position is open to current students as well as graduates.  This is a paid internship.  About T3: T3 is one of the fastest growing independent agencies in the country, with a proven record of producing smart, innovative work. Our collaborative environment inspires great work, and has attracted great minds from some of the country's leading agencies and corporations. Maybe you'll be another?  T3 is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. APPLY åÇ Back to Current Openings

title: Advertising & Sales Intern
description: Advertising & Sales Intern Sales | Austin, TX | Internship JOB DESCRIPTION Wide Open Media Group is recruiting an Advertising and Sales Intern to learn about and assist with the full life-cycle of the digital advertising and sales process which directly supports the growth of Wide Open Spaces, Wide Open Country, Wide Open Pets, and Wide Open Eats. This individual will be working hand-in-hand with our Account Executive to learn the full cycle of the digital advertising and sales process in our media network environment. This is a very hands-on internship for someone interested in sales and advertising as it relates to digital media. The position will be located at our offices in Downtown Austin at 801 Congress, and the expected workload is around 25-30 hours a week, with more hours potentially being available over time. Requirements: An individual with a sales mindset, who is looking to build experience toward a sales career post-graduation An individual who is self-motivated to work without limited supervision An individual who is very comfortable talking on the phone pitching new clients on our advertising products and with existing advertisers An individual who is highly organized and can manage multiple contacts / outreach activities Communication and good writing skills are a must given this position will require extensive email outreach and phone call communication Scope of Internship: 20% - Prospecting perspective clients for the network 20% - Research and development on innovative digital advertising solutions 20% - Outreach to perspective clients to kick-start conversations 20% - Template and playbook building - Optimizing and documenting success of sales outreach/success for future team members 20% - Execution - Working with existing and new clients on advertising campaigns and delivery of innovative placements Perks of working with Wide Open Media as an intern: Ability to earn credit in your university program for an internship (if an undergraduate or graduate student) Work in a Downtown Austin office at 8th and Congress Located on major bus lines including the 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 20, 30, 37, 801 and 803 to reduce need to park Fast-paced and dynamic, but casual, startup environment Unlimited snacks and beverages Quarterly company outings Apply to learn more! title: Marketing Intern
description: EXPLORE CAREERS NOT FINDING A JOB? Share this Job Email similar jobs to me  MARKETING INTERN JOB Apply now  Date: Mar 3, 2017 Location: MN - St Paul, US, 55117 Location(s): MN - St Paul   Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow?  A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you‰Ûªre looking for.     Position Summary This intern will support HomeSmart marketing initiatives. HomeSmart is an appliance service plan billed on the Xcel Energy utility bill. Provide support to Managers in implementing product marketing plans and operational processes required to deliver products to market. Support product sales through providing information directly to customer. Manage social media presence, including Facebook, company website, email marketing, customer satisfaction surveys, etc.   Minimum Requirements Junior status as of Fall 2017. Preference will be given to students who are able to work part-time during the academic year and full-time during the summer. title: Internships - Product Planning & Marketing
description: Internships - Product Planning & Marketing Location: NJ - Mahwah Department: Jaguar Land Rover Marketing & Sales Description Jaguar Land Rover North America‰Ûªs internship program is a great opportunity for college students entering their junior or senior year, or who are currently in a graduate school program, to gain hands-on experience in the exciting world of the automotive industry!  This is a great opportunity for personal growth and development from a business and learning perspective.   Details of the program:         The program is open only to students at a Junior or Senior level in their Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree program, or who are enrolled in a Graduate School program.         The Internship is for a full year, June 2017 to May 2018, and the successful intern must be able and willing to commit to the full length of the program.         Intern is asked to work for 25-29 hours per week during business hours in the Mahwah, NJ office (Business hours are Monday through Friday 8:30 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:30 PM, and the intern‰Ûªs actual daily schedule will work around their class schedule).   Departments:  Product Planning and Marketing/Brand Strategy Departments Location:   Mahwah, New Jersey We currently have two internships available - one in our Product Planning area, the other concentrating on Brand Strategy & Launch within our Marketing Department. Outline of Roles: These internships will provide an opportunity to develop business acumen, leadership, and project management skills, as well as develop analytical and reporting skills.   Intern will be responsible for supporting team members in a variety of tasks and project areas, including: Pulling data sets, investigating competitive offerings, and project support for strategic decision making.   Assisting in the development and execution of go-to-market plans, by conducting cross-functional analysis and  reporting. Supporting the team on various project for the expanding product line Key Criteria for Role: Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in progress (Junior or Senior), or pursuing a graduate studies degree (Marketing, Business, or related discipline preferred); 3.0 GPA or higher; Intermediate to advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, and previous data manipulation experience; Previous marketing and analytics experience or coursework; Strong communication and presentation skills; High level of professionalism; Detail-oriented, self-starter, strong work ethic, team player,  ability to build rapport and communicate confidently; Ability to leverage insights to draw sound conclusions and translate them into actionable recommendations. Share | | Email this job PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER   About Futureforce: Futureforce is for college students or new grads wanting to experience life at Salesforce, one of the World‰Ûªs Most Innovative Companies 5å_-years-å_running and one of Fortune‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏ100 Best Companies to Work For‰Û 8-years-running. Futureforce interns work on live projects, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact that they can show to friends, family, and future employers å_å_if we don‰Ûªt hire them first (and, we hire 80% of our eligible interns)!   They have the chance to collaborate and connect with the Salesforce interns from all over the world. And, like all Salesforce employees, interns also have many possibilities to volunteer, making a lasting impact in the community.   Futureforce offers a collaborative work environment, which fosters innovation, provides flexibility and most importantly is fun!   About the PMM role: As a PMM sitting at the center of the business you will work to coordinate all facets of the business. You will craft the messaging and positioning for products and will conceive and execute innovative marketing programs that drive demand. You will become the expert on the buyers, how they buy and their buying criteria, and will create customer facing assets to meet your buyer at every point in the decision journey. This role requires creativity, strategic thinking, and leadership skills as you will be working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, creative, and product teams. In this role you will work on challenging projects that utilize your education and critical thinking abilities to have an impact on business initiatives.   The PMM MBA intern will own or have an impact on various projects that could include:   Defining buying personas and purchase paths to inform and create new content meeting buyers at every step in the decision journey Working with Product Management to build our pipeline of new features Working with partners to figure out how to help their GTM efforts scale Leading focus groups and market research on buyer needs Working with sales and customers to develop new customer case studies Creating and executing campaign and social media strategies Playing a key role in preparing for Dreamforce 2017 (October 2017)   Requirements: Pursuing an MBA degree Bachelor‰Ûªs degree from top undergrad 3-4 years of experience in marketing, technology or management consulting Proven ability to juggle multiple projects quickly Ability to be a self-starter, pick up projects and go Strong mastery of written English Passion for technology Good presentation skills Demonstrated interest in enterprise technology Would you like to apply to this job? title: Marketing Coordinator Intern
description: ABOUT BLACKBOARD NEWS & EVENTS COMMUNITY SUPPORT Select Language‰Ð_ | Careers Search Careers About Us Communities Sign In Submit your information for this opportunity Apply Now            Marketing Coordinator Intern Marketing Coordinator Intern Doylestown, PA   With nearly 20,000 organizational customers and millions of student users, Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company. Blackboard is shaping the future of education with big ideas that challenge conventional thinking and advance new models of learning. Every day we‰Ûªre inspiring people to find new ways to learn, connect and drive change in the way education is delivered and experienced. Through technology and services we bring people closer to the knowledge they seek and to ways they can change their own education and the world for the better.   Blackboard Transact‰ã¢ is an integrated technology platform that helps improve the student experience and campus safety, while helping streamline business operations and increasing revenue.  The Blackboard Transact platform includes capabilities across three aspects of an institution‰Ûªs business operations:   Transaction Management: facilitates campus ID credential issuance, cashless payment processing, account management and reporting on-campus, off-campus, and online. Security Management: monitors all campus activity using integrated door access control, video surveillance and mass notification capabilities.  Financial Services: offers innovative options for tuition presentment and payment, financial aid disbursement, revenue enhancement or cost savings through innovative technologies that further enhance the student experience.    Position Responsibilities  The Financial Services Group manages hundreds off-campus programs across our On-Prem and SaaS higher education clients.  Working collectively with the schools and their local merchants, we create dynamic marketing and promotional campaigns to drive usage and deposits for the schools‰Ûª stored value/declining balance accounts.   The Marketing Coordinator will play an integral role in the success of the group.  Specifically, s/he will be responsible for: Recruit existing program merchants to participate in Quinnipiac‰Ûªs digital coupon booklet Recruit existing program merchants to participate in other promotional programs, which may include Campus Cash Jacksonville, University of Pittsburgh and other off-campus programs preparing for BTS. Design online digital coupons supporting the Quinnipiac program and own approval process with the merchants of said coupons Provide secondary design support to the CampusImpact designer in the development of promotional signage and collateral in support of these promotions and other back to school initiatives Assist in the development of social media campaigns to support promotional efforts at these and other schools Develop spreadsheet that identifies Facebook/social media contacts at our schools Assist with off-campus signage and brochure inventories to ensure we have accurate supplies for upcoming semester Provide merchant recruitment support by helping PM collect necessary paperwork to move forward with the process Merchant inactivity project-Work with SaaS marketing and customer solutions team to identify non-active merchants and help PM identify solutions Learning & Development Development of marketing & promotions programs to drive results Project management, specifically for the Quinnipiac coupon book and back to school initiatives Practical experience in designing collateral that both meets clients‰Ûª and merchants‰Ûª needs, and communicates affectively to students to drive usage Sharpen decision making skills by providing recommendations to PMs on how to handle and resolve merchant issues Cross-team and cross-program experience, working with both the On-prem PMs, the SaaS CRMS, and the CampusImpact teams Professional Qualifications  Required Skills: Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master‰Ûªs degree in Marketing, Communications, or related     business field, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience Demonstrated strengths in multi-tasking, organization, responsibility, and follow up Demonstrated project management skills; budgeting experience a plus Proficient in Adobe Suite (for design work) and Microsoft Office Ability to work independently, exercise discretion, prioritize, and multi-task in a highly dynamic environment Preferred Skills: Solid business understanding - or ability and willingness to learn quickly Comfortable on the phone/some negotiating skills a plus This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time. title: INTERNSHIP - MARKET RESEARCH ANALYST
description: Search for: Call us: 1-800-304-8125 The LCS Story Blog Contact Careers INTERNSHIP - MARKET RESEARCH ANALYST Job Site Location: Iowa Department: National Sales DESCRIPTION Market Research Analyst Internship National Marketing Department ONE YOU: ONE LCS Passion to Serve Join a team that provides you the opportunity to use your talents in a progressive, growing organization that makes a positive difference in the lives of the seniors we serve.   LCS, the company LCS creates living experiences that enhance the lives of seniors. You‰Ûªll see this commitment in our people. They‰Ûªre talented, dedicated professionals who truly care about residents, with each conducting his or her work with integrity, honesty and transparency according to the principles of LCS. We strive to help every community succeed‰ÛÓstrengthening available resources, establishing proven practices that lead to long-term growth and creating lasting value for those living in, working for and affiliated with the community.   Market Research Intern - The Opportunity The secondary market research analyst will gather secondary research, assess the findings and report the results. Specifically, verify and update statistics within Continuing Care Retirement Communities (CCRC) Excel database. The deliverable is to accurately complete the work with sufficient detail to allow identification of specific targets for direct contact. This is a 12-week internship. Organizational Relationship This position reports to the national marketing director at LCS. This person will also work closely with executives in the senior living research and development department of a national investment banking firm. Duties and Responsibilities: Heavy Microsoft Excel work: data validation, merge, purge Research information available on Internet to fill in data gaps. Communicate with LCS stakeholders and employees to complete data gaps. First complete information for the nine target states: California, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Florida, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and Texas Deliverable for final presentation to LCS executives Segment list By geography to identify target states to focus sales effort, and to determine where there are unmet needs for underserved markets By operator to identify self-managed communities, and communities whose management contracts are about to expire with other third-party management companies By age to determine which communities may be ready for renovation/repositioning PowerPoint presentation to LCS executives describing your process and findings. The final Excel database will be delivered to LCS and Ziegler. Knowledge and Skills: Working on a degree in market research or business Secondary market research experience Proficient in: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word Programming language: Excel Excellent analytical skills; interpreting the results and communicating the findings Organized and detail-oriented Working knowledge of mapping results, a plus Strong collaboration, communication and interpersonal skills Experience working in CRM systems; preferably Microsoft Dynamics CRM, a plus Authorities Travel Frequency - None Job Type Full-Time/Regular   LCS is always seeking talented individuals to join our growing organization and we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefit package including.  LCS team members can also expect continuous learning and career growth opportunities, open and direct communication, and a fulfilling work environment.
