title: Marketing Intern
description: HOME WHO WE ARE GROW WITH US WHAT WE DO VIEW ALL JOBS Language Sign in Search by Keyword More Options Search by Location   Clear Email similar jobs to me  Share this Job Marketing Intern- Part Time Job Apply now  Date: Feb 25, 2017 Location: Jackson, MN, US Company: AGCO The AGCO Marketing Internship is for highly talented undergraduate students who have a desire to work in a marketing role at a Fortune 500 corporation. The program consists of the intern completing high level projects that drive growth within a business and also receive world class training.   The program accelerates growth in an intern by: Providing a role on one of the following marketing teams: Product & Sales Training Communication Tactical Marketing Market Research Product Marketing Participation in a variety of functional and leadership activities to enhance personal and professional capabilities Work on critical projects and gain exposure to management   Target Undergraduate Intern Profile General agricultural knowledge Excitement about the prospect of working at a large international business Aspirations for a fulltime marketing position at AGCO, a Fortune 500 corporation Demonstrated leadership in school, extra-curricular activities, internships, and other events Strong academic performance Analytical skills including how to use MS Excel, summarize data, and present information to management The ability to deliver quality work on time, ask the right questions, and seek clarification when need   About AGCO AGCO, Your Agriculture Company, (AGCO), is a global leader focused on the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery. AGCO supports more productive farming through a full line of tractors, combines, hay tools, sprayers, forage equipment, tillage, implements, grain storage and protein production systems, as well as related replacement parts. AGCO products are sold through five core machinery brands, Challengerå¨, Fendtå¨, GSIå¨, Massey Fergusonå¨ and Valtraå¨ and are distributed globally through 3,150 independent dealers and distributors in more than 140 countries worldwide. Founded in 1990, AGCO is headquartered in Duluth, GA, USA. This position will be located at our Galesburg, MI facility.   The Marketing Intern role will provide support for activities such as coordinating collateral for various events, coordinating travel itineraries and schedules for events, coordinating customer testimonial schedules, basic administrative work, creating/delivering presentations and assisting with content development and management. Does Reddit get you revved up? Yes!? Then you‰Ûªre in luck! Coed Media Group, a leading online publisher, is looking to hire a social media and marketing intern this spring semester. title: Consumer Intern
description: Home About us What we do News & recognition Insights & ideas Global reach Join us Our people Professional development Open positions Intern, Consumer - Austin 27th Feb 2017 Reference: JOB6001 Location: Austin, United States Application deadline: 3 weeks 5 days 3 hours 55 minutes Cohn & Wolfe Internship Program   Why Cohn & Wolfe? Cohn & Wolfe is an award-winning, integrated brand communications agency within WPP, the world‰Ûªs largest media and communications services conglomerate. Guided by an internal mantra to "Dig Deeper, Imagine More," we work hard to deliver creative campaigns that are deeply grounded in consumer and marketplace insights, backed by a full-suite of strategic services to meet the needs of our clients. At Cohn & Wolfe Austin our roster of clients includes Twentieth Century Fox Home Entertainment, Applebee‰Ûªs, Alcon and SONIC Drive-In. The semester-long internship enables interns to support a variety of public relations and digital media activities while developing real-world skills for a future career in marketing communications.   Internship Responsibilities: The typical day for an intern will include any of the following: Conducting online research and analysis Researching companies and their industries Writing press materials Researching and compiling client coverage reports Building media lists and pitch plans Researching editorial opportunities Participating in company brainstorms Pitching to the media Assisting with media trainings and event preparation Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills as well as working knowledge of digital media practices Interest in public relations, communications, business/marketing, digital/social media, research, analytics, sociology and/or cultural trends Undergraduates at the sophomore level and above or graduate students in a related field Availability to work between 20 and 32 hours per week for the semester. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Pay Rate: Paid internship   How to apply: The following information is required in order to be considered for an internship at Cohn & Wolfe: A cover letter expressing your interest and goals for the internship. Please limit to one page. Your resume. A one-page news release writing sample announcing your new position as a Cohn & Wolfe intern. This writing sample will enable us to learn more about your writing skills and creativity. There is no right or wrong answer. This is simply an opportunity for you to demonstrate your understanding of what a news release is and to showcase your writing ability. Please email all documents as attachments to Matthew Young at Matthew.Young@cohnwolfe.com Cohn & Wolfe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: Laitram, L.L.C. Job Announcement   Division: Intralox Position: Marketing Analytics Intern Date Posted: 02/15/2017 Location: New Orleans, LA  Description: Intralox, L.L.C. is currently seeking a Marketing Analytics Intern to work in their Marketing Department. This individual will assist in the development of marketing plans, and analysis on Intralox belting.  About Intralox Intralox produces over 50% of the world‰Ûªs modular conveyor belts, but our business is so much more than conveyors. We are working with some of the world‰Ûªs largest companies, helping them solve problems, create efficiencies, and grow the economy. Intralox is one of the five operating divisions of Laitram, LLC, which was selected by CityBusiness as the one of the 2014 Best Places to Work in New Orleans. Intralox Culture We are smart, interesting, and sometimes quirky people solving problems big and small. We are seeking creative, curious, and intelligent people to join our ranks. title: Marketing Internship, Summer
description: FOLLOW US CONNECT WITH US BECOME A FAN SUBSCRIBE TO BLOG JOIN US Go APPLICATIONS PRODUCTS NEWS ABOUT US CONTACT SUPPORT CAREERS Home ‰Û¢ Careers ‰Û¢ Current Openings ‰Û¢ ... Marketing Internship, Summer 2017 White Marsh Location TIC Gums is consistently ranked as America‰Ûªs #1 preferred supplier of hydrocolloids to the food industry. We are seeking students who are currently pursuing a business or marketing related degree for an upcoming intern opportunity for this summer. This position will work directly with our Associate Marketing Manager and Marketing team and will be located at our Texture and Innovation Center in our White Marsh, MD location. In this role, the intern will support tradeshows including preparation and post show follow-up, complete documentation and literature requests, update sales presentations, materials, and documentation, website updates, create a library of blog posts, data cleanup in our CRM software, and develop a marketing campaign list. Students should possess the following skills and experience: strong writing skills, strong computer skills, specifically MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word; ability to work independently and ability to multitask; must be detail oriented; ability to learn quickly; experience with Photoshop preferred; InDesign experience not required but a plus; pursuing a degree in marketing or business with a minor in marketing. This internship position will have specific goals and project objectives that the student will be responsible for accomplishing during the internship. Students will be assigned a department supervisor who will provide guidance on day-to-day tasks, as well as expose the student to the working environment of TIC Gums. Throughout the summer, HR will sponsor several seminars on resume writing, interviewing techniques and transitioning to the job world after school. Our internship program runs during the summer months ‰ÛÒ approximately the end of May through August. Students must have a minimum of 3.0 GPA in order to apply and be pursuing a degree in a related field of study to the position. Each internship is a paid position that offers a challenging opportunity. Positions are limited. Interested candidates should submit their resume to Michelle Magliocchetti @ internships@ticgums.com. title: Corporate Communications Intern
description: Corporate Communications Intern (REQ7329) Westlake, Ohio The Corporate Communications Intern position is an opportunity for a recent college graduate or a college senior who wants exposure to the corporate communications function in a $1.8 billion global industrial technologies company. This internship will expose the candidate to a versatile communications role supporting all aspects of the Corporate Communications function, with a particular focus on employee communications.    ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES  ‰Û¢ Creates engaging multimedia content for Nordson‰Ûªs global team of more than 6,000 employees.  ‰Û¢ Looks for opportunities to re-purpose content for Nordson‰Ûªs social media.  ‰Û¢ Uses established measurement tools to measure efficacy of communications.  ‰Û¢ Supports internal customers, especially human resources to develop content and serve as a liaison with the design team for employee materials  ‰Û¢ Manages special projects as assigned, for example, developing content for month-long Founders‰Ûª Day celebration to recognize Nordson‰Ûªs commitment to our history, values and innovation.  ‰Û¢ Supports financial and marketing communication efforts and community relations efforts as directed.  ‰Û¢ Provide support to marketing and communication managers in Nordson business units around the world.  ‰Û¢ Other duties as assigned.    EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE  ‰Û¢ Recent graduate or currently enrolled at an accredited institution, having earned or working toward a bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, English or similar.    SKILLS & ABILITIES  ‰Û¢ Superior writing skills.  ‰Û¢ Superior verbal and presentation skills.  ‰Û¢ Superior project management skills.  ‰Û¢ Collaborative and customer service oriented.  ‰Û¢ Confidence and professionalism to work with employees and leaders at all levels of the organization.  ‰Û¢ Fluency in social media.  ‰Û¢ Eagerness to learn  ‰Û¢ Ability to multitask and switch gears quickly  ‰Û¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products  ‰Û¢ High energy  ‰Û¢ Culturally sensitive  ‰Û¢ Video editing skills a plus  ‰Û¢ Business and financial acumen a plus  ‰Û¢ Basic skills in Adobe Photoshop and other multi-media programs a plus  ‰Û¢ SharePoint experience and other web design skills a plus    WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL DEMANDS  Office environment. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.    TRAVEL REQUIRED  None    Nordson Corporation provides equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees. No person is to be discriminated against in any aspect of the employment relationship due to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.    All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening and background/criminal check, consistent with applicable laws.

title: Sales and Marketing Intern
description: Sales and Marketing Intern US-TX-Austin Apply View All Jobs Share This Job Job Description Who We Are: Mission focused and results oriented!  Social Solutions‰Ûª main purpose and software solution (SaaS) helps some of the most vulnerable human beings in our society.  Our software for Nonprofits allows them to spend less time on compliance and funder reporting and more time on ensuring the effectiveness of their service programs for the people who rely on them.  Since our software was designed by direct service workers for direct service providers, it also helps them to demonstrate impact to stakeholders.  Our team is comprised of super talented people who want to be a part of an exciting high growth company and help transform lives.  Who You Are: Someone who loves researching until the problem has been solved. You have awesome communication skills, and really thrive in a fast-paced environment. The Business Development Intern plays a key role in ensuring our database records are up to date and we have the most accurate information available for our prospects.  Job Responsibilities: Help prepare collateral case studies Assist in establishing our geographic presence, including listing our contracts out by location Research our competitors and compile information pertaining to pricing Other duties as assigned Skills & Requirements Preferred Qualifications: Pursuing a college degree in public service, public administration, public policy, business administration, marketing, business, or related field Looking to pursue a career in sales or marketing Passionate about volunteering or one of our sales sectors (Justice, Health & Human Services, Workforce Development, Education or Housing/Urban Development) Internship Benefits: Paid part-time, Summer (May 22nd - August) AND/OR Fall (August - December), up to 20/hrs per week. title: Marketing Intern
description: Home Jobs About Us Sprint Join Our Talent Community Careers Home >  Job Details 1 Marketing Intern Apply Now >>     Date : 2-7-2017 Location : Rocky Hill, CT US Req # : 214436BR Job Summary  Are you ready to put your education to work? Yes? Let's talk.  You're ready to join ground-breaking projects, bring fresh ideas and meet top executives. Our interns do real work, volunteer together and compete in team activities. Oh yeah, and they invent stuff. True story. Sprint interns have applied for patents. They're just that good. At Sprint, our progress is monumental, our acceleration is inspiring, and now is the time to put big ideas into practice.  As a Sprint intern you'll have the opportunity to gain practical experience in our 10-12 week internship program in a challenging, fun and fast-paced work environment. This includes entry level professional duties and project work in various capacities. And you'll get to work with our awesome technology solutions, systems, and processes. In addition to your manager, you'll also have a mentor to provide guidance and coaching along the way. In between solving real business problems and getting hands on experience, the Sprint internship program hosts networking events, development opportunities and community involvement activities.  Are you ready to Move Forward with us?  This internship will help you acquire marketing skills as well as learn various marketing strategies, while gaining an understanding of the wireless technology industry. Your responsibilities will include: event planning, coordination, staffing, and post event recaps & evaluations; support the marketing team in daily administrative tasks; assist in marketing & media promotional activities such as social media, radio, out-of-home, and direct mail campaigns; help with facilitating store POP projects; distributing marketing materials; perform market analysis & research, including secret shopping competitors & distribution; assist with preparing promotional presentations. Driving marketing vehicle to events as needed.  This position is not eligible for relocation. A passion for the marketing industry & interest in the telecommunications technology field. A solid understanding of marketing practices & techniques. Excellent verbal & written communication skills is a must. Must be proficient in MS Office (specifically Excel & PowerPoint), as well as social media platforms. Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator or other graphic design programs preferred. A take charge & great personality who can interact at events & represent the Sprint brand. Need to be willing to travel & flexible to work evenings & weekends when needed. Basic Qualifications Enrolled in college or college graduate within the last twenty-four months  Preferred Qualifications 3.0 GPA or above preferred  If you want to get your career started, Sprint's internship program is a great way to gain experience in a fun and innovative environment.  We know that technology is essential to our customers' lives. We're obsessed with creating awesome solutions that deliver amazing experiences. We believe mobile connectivity is the most powerful enabler of progress in the world. Connectivity helps bring families and friends more closely together, children to get a better education, and businesses to be more productive.  As a Sprint intern, you'll not only gain real world experience, but have an opportunity to drive real results that impact the lives of others. Are you ready to Move Forward?  Sprint is a background screening, drug screening, and E-Verify participating employer. Sprint will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances. Equal opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet  Metro Area  US-CT-Hartford  Sprint is an Equal Opportunity Employer and has been recognized for its commitment to diversity and creating an inclusive workplace where all employees‰Ûª backgrounds, talents and contributions are valued. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nation origin, disability or protected veteran status. Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Protected Vet  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled protected veteran and need an accommodation or accessibility assistance to apply for one of our positions, you may submit a request by sending an email to careers@sprint.com or by faxing your request to 913-523-9980.  ‰ÛÏApplicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws‰Û Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Poster; Supplemental Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) is the Law Poster; Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster; Pay Transparency Notice Poster; and the Philadelphia‰Ûªs Fair Change Hiring Law Poster. This position will support proposition strategy, support the execution and measurement of marketing programs, campaigns, and incentives, and collaborate across the organization to define strategies to meet the needs of law firm customers. The Marketing & Strategy Intern also assists the team in developing new programs, and refining existing programs, to maintain the current customer base, and drive new business growth.  Key Responsibilities: Assist with analytical projects by completing data comparisons, account analysis and revenue metrics to formalize assumptions for model changes and recommendations on growth strategies Understand and share market knowledge and industry direction internally to help inform decisions around pricing design and development of tools to aide in revenue retention and growth Analyze the financial results to develop an understanding of product segment revenue and subscriber/customer trends Support process improvement in all pricing and sales processes; fully utilizing the segment and finance resources wherever possible Create ad-hoc analysis and special projects as defined by the needs of the business Understand corporate goals and practices and apply them when resolving a variety of problems Focus on priority product lines specifically for bundling, tool development and success metrics Qualifications Experience & Qualifications Bachelor‰Ûªs degree or currently enrolled in four-year college degree curriculum in marketing, finance, economics, statistics or business related field with strong academic performance required 0-2 years‰Ûª experience in strategy, marketing, market/business development, data analysis or related field Strong analytical skills Strong business acumen: understands the key financial drivers and dynamics related to growth and revenue goals of an organization Proven ability to drive projects and plans with minimal supervision Strong communication and presentation skills Expertise with PowerPoint and Excel Creative thinking, critical analysis, and problem-solving skills Ability to adapt well to change in a fast paced environment Aptitude for project management As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. title: Marketing Intern
description: Marketing Internships Internships | Kirkland, WA, United States Apply Send Jobvite INRIX is hiring four exceptional Marketing interns interested in obtaining practical work experience for the summer of 2017. Marketing internships will take place in our Kirkland office. You will work closely with mentors from the team and have exposure to many areas of the business. You‰Ûªll gain a hands-on education and develop your marketing skills. Available Marketing Internships 1. Sales and customer marketing: You‰Ûªll work across various teams and verticals to develop go-to-market campaigns with a focus on updating the collateral and decks Must be a PowerPoint guru, with expert level ability to develop compelling presentations  2. Develop and execute a social media plan You‰Ûªll identify relevant social communities for each of the industries we sell to and research areas of interest. You will develop and execute a plan to insert INRIX themes, messages and benefits in a way that positively contributes to the community and builds INRIX‰Ûªs thought leadership position Must have extensive knowledge of social media platforms including LinkedIn, blogs, digital communities Strong writing and communications skills are essential   3. Integrated marketing campaigns Research the audience for each of our product offerings and identify how to reach them (what do they read, associations they belong to, where are they online, etc.) Compile the ways to reach them (association lists, websites they frequent, keywords, etc.) Must have strong research skills and a willingness to find groups, build lists, etc. Knowledge of how to interact with salesforce.com is a plus   4. Competitive Benchmarking You will conduct a competitive assessment of our key competitors by researching and benchmarking their value propositions, key metrics and more Experience with competitive assessment, benchmarking and value propositions Strategic marketing knowledge and skills   INRIX is the global leader in connected car services and movement analytics, a new approach that leverages big data and the cloud to help manage urban mobility. By aggregating a variety of sources and applying intelligence, INRIX delivers comprehensive data and solutions to help move people, cities and businesses forward. Our partners are automakers, governments, mobile operators, developers, advertisers, as well as enterprises large and small. We are literally everywhere with over 450 customers across 60 countries.  INRIX is a privately held company headquartered in Kirkland with offices around the globe. If the student is seeking college credit for the internship, it is the responsibility of the intern to ensure that college internship requirements are met by the program.  All internships are based in our Kirkland, WA office. INRIX does not offer housing or relocation assistance for interns. Pay is dependent on year in school and experience. title: Product Analyst Intern
description: View All Open Jobs Search Open Jobs Edit Your Profile View Submitted Applications  Job Details   Company Trisept Solutions Requisition Number 17-0024 Post Date 1/31/2017 Title Product Analyst Intern City Milwaukee State WI Description Have you ever wondered what it would feel like to be a part of an entrepreneurial company where your unique abilities are celebrated, you increase your creative energy and your role adds value every day? Sound impossible? It‰Ûªs not. La Macchia Enterprises (LME) has a unique story of being family-owned for over 40 years. We turn vacation dreams into long-lasting memories by focusing on our customers‰Ûª End-to-End Experience at every touch point. Our 1,000+ team members embody our core values, making us a global leader in leisure travel and technology. Our team is the reason we‰Ûªve earned a spot on the Top Workplaces list for multiple years. Trisept Solutions, a division of LME, was the first to process an online vacation booking. Trisept has continued its evolution working with the leading global airlines, hotels and theme parks to provide cutting-edge technology solutions. Visit www.triseptsolutions.com to continue the story. Now it‰Ûªs your turn to enhance your career with Trisept Solutions. Grow and learn with us as a Product Analyst Intern. You will bring a professional focus and consistency to Travel Agent Solutions‰Ûª product/engagement analytics and research. In this role, you will assist in targeting markets for revenue growth and provide a robust structure for tracking results and making decisions. You will collect and report site KPIs and also conduct primary competitive research scans.  A successful Product Analyst Intern will: Conduct ongoing competitive research and analysis of travel technology and emerging competitors Review and analyze website performance metrics Create weekly Excel report on key website and marketing metrics to share with company leadership. Assist with creating monthly Delivery Reports for suppliers Develop a way to turn our voluminous data into business intelligence (revenue opportunity) Assist with ROI analysis for RFPs Undertake other duties and responsibilities as assigned Requirements Apply today to be considered for this internship! $15 per hour. 15-20 hours per week with a first shift schedule Monday through Friday. Flexible hours to accommodate class schedule. Working towards a Bachelor's degree in Business or Marketing (BA) from four-year College or university with focus on business management, statistics or related coursework. Must be at a junior or senior standing at the start of the internship and a 3.0 or higher grade point average is preferred. Expertise using Microsoft Office Suite Excellent interpersonal, consultative, and communication skills (written and verbal) Excellent organizational, planning, facilitation, and prioritization skills Ability to solve problems under time constraints Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services and evaluation of customer satisfaction Considers the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one Conceptual knowledge of the marketing analyst discipline We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. title: Event Marketing Internship
description: Job search Kodak Home PageAbout KodakKodak Careers Main Page Sign in/Register in Share Event Marketing Intern 18818BR Marketing / Branding USA - NY - Rochester Position Description Summer Intern - Event Marketing Internship   Kodak is looking for an Event Marketing Intern with sales, marketing and organizational skill; the Ideal candidate is a current student pursuing a Bachelor's in Marketing.  The scope of the project you will be working on is:  Eastman Business Park is one of the largest industrial parks in the world encompassing 1,200 acres.  That‰Ûªs 50% bigger than New York City‰Ûªs Central Park.  In terms of building space, the Park is home to 16 million square feet of manufacturing, distribution, office, laboratory, clean room, recreational and conference space.  That‰Ûªs 2.5 times more space under roof than the Pentagon. Ninety-five companies call Eastman Business Park home today.  That‰Ûªs up from 85 a year ago, and our goal is to attract ten more in 2017.  Over 6,000 people work in the Park and over $4 billion in manufacturing revenue is generated by companies like Kodak, Carestream, Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, Harris, LiDestri Food and Drink, Kodak Alaris and Columbia Care.   As big as we are, we have a lot of room to grow.  From our 2,000 seat theater where we will have a new venue manager, a new marquee and renovations to the lobby to the new energy storage center where eight companies are building batteries that will help reduce our dependence on fossil fuels we are in growth mode.   We are adding new tenants and expanding the footprints of existing tenants.  One of the most important things any employer looks for when choosing a location for a manufacturing operation is talent.  They want to know that as soon as they set up shop, they will be able to hire top quality talent at a competitive wage.  And beyond that, they want to know that as they grow they will be able to obtain the skills they need.  This means we need to work with local schools and colleges, companies and business associations to build a pipeline of talent.  One of the ways Eastman Business Park supports this is by hosting the annual MFG DAY event.  In 2016 over 400 high school students attended a half day program at the Park to learn about TODAY‰Ûªs manufacturing careers.  We had a presentation with high impact video, a panel of recent graduates who are embarking on a manufacturing career, a panel of managers from employers and an interview with a very successful business man who now owns his own manufacturing company.  The event also had exhibitors from 10 different organizations, including employers, educators and associations. We plan to do it again in 2017 and need a skilled organizer and marketer to develop the plans, coordinate among the entities, and make sure the event comes off smoothly.  That‰Ûªs why, for this role, we would like to hire an intern with sales, marketing and organizational skills.   Management of this single, large project will give the candidate a great experience and great resume material.      Position Type Coop - Intern Experience Level Coop / Intern Minimum Education Level High School Diploma or GED Date Posted 28-Feb-2017 Apply to job Save Share EEO/Privacy Policy

title: Sales and Channel Marketing Intern - Summer 2017
description: Apply Now Sales and Channel Marketing Intern - Summer 2017 at Anki (View all jobs) San Francisco, CA Engineered to think. In a world‰Û_ where science fiction is constantly making promises that actual science can‰Ûªt deliver. Where phone booths don‰Ûªt teleport themselves, and zero calorie beer has yet to exist. One company had the courage to stand up and say, ‰ÛÏHey! Science! Where‰Ûªs my jetpack?‰Û Hi. We‰Ûªre Anki. When our Co-Founders Boris, Mark and Hanns met in the Ph.D program at Carnegie Mellon‰Ûªs Robotics Institute, they didn‰Ûªt dream about artificial intelligence that sends you speeding tickets in the mail, or shrink wraps shrink-wrap. They were united by a shared habit of saying ‰ÛÏHey, wouldn‰Ûªt it be cool if...?‰Û then actually making that cool thing happen.  Now, we know what you‰Ûªre thinking: we‰Ûªre just another all black-wearing, white cat-stroking bunch of weirdos designing laser-powered panini machines in an underground lair somewhere. Nope. Anki is made up of non-crazy people building crazy-cool AI and robotics that are reinventing physical entertainment. Sound crazy? Maybe. But crazy-in-a-good-way. Maybe that‰Ûªs why Apple CEO Tim Cook introduced our first product, Anki Drive, in his keynote at WWDC in June 2013. And why top-tier VC‰Ûªs including Andreessen Horowitz, Index Ventures, and Two Sigma trust us with their money. Anki is taking years of fancy research and incomprehensible 1‰Ûªs and 0‰Ûªs and turning them into exciting things that people actually want. Things they want real bad. Things they didn‰Ûªt even think could exist. Imagine impossible interactive experiences. Imagine video games in real life. Imagine jetpacks. And we‰Ûªre just getting started.  Excited? Us too. Visit the Anki website and find us on Facebook and YouTube to find out more about Anki - the future of consumer robotics and entertainment.  Job Description We are seeking a Sales & Channel Marketing Intern to support our team on a variety of strategic projects as we gear up for our peak Holiday season. This candidate will become an essential part of our team, with a unique opportunity to make a real, meaningful impact on our business. They will also gain invaluable experience in working with some of the largest retailers in the United States, including Amazon, Toys R Us, Target, Best Buy, and Apple. Duties and Responsibilities Conduct assortment planning and competitive analysis Conduct store categorization analysis for all brick & mortar retailers Inventory and purchase order management Product forecasting Assist in the execution of all channel marketing activities for holiday (retail website refresh, banner creation, email/print graphics, in-store signage, etc.) Must-Have Qualifications Strengths: Manages execution; detail-oriented Analytical; problem solver Driven; self-starter Excellent verbal and written communication skills Collaborative; can effectively work with varying teams/people Flexibility and prioritization, we are a start-up and tasks fly in faster than the Nerf darts in our office, you‰Ûªll need to use strong judgement to navigate the incoming and prioritize appropriately Skills: Microsoft Excel, Key Note, and Word (need to have) Adobe Photoshop (nice to have) Currently a Junior pursuing a degree in Sales, Marketing, Communications, Finance and/or Business Benefits Great San Francisco office with lots of light and great views, convenient to every mode of mass transit ‰ÛÒ on wheels, on rails and on water Innovative start-up where you‰Ûªll help shape the culture and have a huge impact Free daily catered lunches, snacks and drinks You get to work on innovative products and challenging problems with some amazingly talented (and fun) people! title: Marketing & Communications Intern
description: Job Description Sign In|New User Previous Job Next Job   Job Details Job Title Marketing Communications Intern Job ID 113134 Location US - Wisconsin Full/Part Time Full-Time Favorite Job Regular/Temporary Temporary Pentair Overview  Pentair is an S&P 500 diversified industrial company with $7 billion in revenue and 30,000 employees worldwide. A global leader, Pentair provides solutions to help its customers manage water use, deliver safe and sustainable energy, meet the world's increasing demand for food, and support, maintain and protect critical processes. Organized as four global businesses which include Valves & Controls, Flow & Filtration Solutions, Water Quality Systems and Technical Solutions, the company operates as One Pentair, driven by purpose, led by vision, guided by process, and united by its Win Right Values.  Business Unit Overview  Pentair Water Quality Systems is a leader in water solutions which improve the quality of life for people around the world.  Our equipment and solutions are found in swimming pools and spas, aquaculture farms, laboratories, water purification and sanitation systems, foodservice operations, and in other applications. We offer design and consulting services and our advanced water technologies are used across a wide number of industries including industrial, residential, commercial, municipal,  aquaponics, aquatic life support systems, irrigation and flood control, wastewater, and more.   Job Summary  POSITION PURPOSE The Marketing Communications Intern is responsible for entry level marketing support to designated members of the Marketing and Sales Teams within the Pentair Water Purification group. The intern will support marketing and sales projects that involve: planning, developing, producing, delivering and maintaining products, programs, promotional and other marketing literature, training materials, catalogs and price lists.   ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Support marketing projects that involve: planning, developing, producing and delivering of both print- and electronic-based internal and external communications. Support marketing services projects including, but not limited to: trade shows, photography, graphics, dealer programs, trade advertising, public relations, and newsletters. Manage and maintain website content. Prepare written materials including some marketing copy, business communications, reports and presentation scripts. Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Marketing, Sales and Customer Service teams, customer/dealer and vendor contacts.  Job Requirements & Skills  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Pursuing a 4 year degree in Marketing or other business related field. JOB REQUIREMENTS Skill in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook Basic knowledge of  sales and marketing principles Detail oriented and accurate Must have demonstrated the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and complete projects on schedule and on budget Analyze, organize, and problem solve frequently and efficiently Ability to communicate status and actions effectively PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS SPECIFIC TO THIS POSITION: Walking, standing, bending, lifting up to 50lbs, use of a computer, typing and ability to speak English.  EEO Statement  Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Return to Previous Page

title: Channel Marketing Intern
description: Job Search About UsOur Companies Sign in/Register in Share Masco Cabinetry Channel Marketing Intern 29673BR Ann Arbor Township Michigan Description Job Summary: Exciting Marketing summer internship working with a top consumer goods company in the kitchen and bath industry.  The purpose of the internship is to provide meaningful, professional hands-on experience to students with proven academic performance and leadership potential.  This internship offers the opportunity for meaningful contribution to the marketing department‰Ûªs business objectives while experiencing personal professional development.  The Marketing internship will be based in Ann Arbor, MI at Masco Cabinetry‰Ûªs Headquarters.  The candidate will assist the channel marketing department on a variety of tasks.   Principal Functional Responsibilities: Create, coordinate and execute channel programs and promotions in support of established channel strategy to increase balance of share, balance of floor and return on investment for channel customers.  Write, edit, review and execute channel specific communications to support programs and promotions. Liaise with internal team and vendors to support marketing and advertising needs for Masco Cabinetry products. Support public relations opportunities for national exposure for our products in partnership with customers, including TV, magazine and on-line opportunities. Liaise with channel customer and internal teams to develop and execute training plans and programs. Assist internal and external customers with day-to-day marketing needs within channel. Essential Qualifications and Skills: Currently pursuing Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in marketing, finance, business or related field Major GPA of 3.0 or higher Strong interpersonal skills Ability to effectively express thoughts/ideas through written and verbal communication Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills; able to manage priorities and workflow Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm Ability to exercise independent judgment Proficient on basic computer programs: Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines Preferred Qualifications and Skills: Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher Leadership experience Previous related work experience If you want to be part of a high-performance organization that‰Ûªs committed to expanding your career as we expand our business, apply to Masco Cabinetry today. title: Marketing Intern
description: Marketing Specialist Intern Burnsville, MNIntern Company Description Bosch Security Systems, Inc. is a division of the Bosch Group, a global supplier of technology and services in the areas of automotive and industrial technology, consumer goods, and building technology. Bosch Security Systems, Inc. is a supplier of equipment for the global electronic protection and communications systems industries. The internship for the Marketing Specialist position is part of the global Marketing Communications team in the Business Unit Communications Systems. The Marketing Communications department is a strong and dynamic in-house creative services team responsible for global marketing communications and brand management for the Bosch Communications, Sound and Audio portfolio covering the brands Bosch, Dynacord, Electro-Voice, RTS and Telex. The diverse product portfolio includes loudspeakers, audio electronics, intercom, public address systems and more ‰ÛÒ and targets an equally broad audience from musicians to governments to stadiums. Team members are based in Germany (Straubing), the Netherlands (Eindhoven) and the US (Burnsville, Minnesota). Job Description Support regional communications strategy (online / offline advertising plans) Assist regional marketing teams with tradeshow events, sales promotions, advertising, social media, etc. Support timely and quality delivery of marcom materials to other global teams Maintain and protect Business Unit Communications Systems brands and co-brands (Bosch, Dynacord, Electro-Voice, RTS, Telex) in the region Project & resource allocation with In-House Creative Team and external partners Manage internal approval requirements and feedback for marketing deliverables Manage online promotional goods & online literature with agency Qualifications Strong time management and planning skills Strong budget and finance skills Ability to prioritize and execute projects against time and resource constraints Aptitude for influencing and effective decision making Strong written and verbal communication skills for internal and external presentations, team discussions and workshops Ability to work with global cross-functional teams Expert proficiency in Microsoft Office Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. title: Social Media Intern
description: VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS     Social Media Intern San Francisco, CA Internship Student (College) Come intern with us!   At TechSoup you'll find the raw energy of a start-up, an extraordinary vision, and a group of brilliant, talented, quirky people who believe fiercely that the benefits of technology should be available to everyone!  We are a nonprofit organization that believes that technology is a powerful enabler for social change. If you think changing the world sounds like a fulfilling way to spend your day, if you want to use your technical and organizational skills to help low-income and disadvantaged people, if you want to work in a fun, challenging, and creative environment, come work with us!   The role This internship supports the Social Media team for TechSoup. Intern will be mentored on social media, with a focus on how social is critical in meeting department community engagement goals and learn how to get important messages out to the masses. The intern will help grow our social media channels, support our targeted Community Broadcast outreach efforts and our goal to increase registrations from targeted verticals over internship period. The intern will build out our influencer lists, utilize our social listening tool to discover high-value organization and engage with these verticals using social media tools while supervised.   Duties Assist with creating and designing engaging social content on various channels: Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram and Youtube. Help curate content of top trending articles around Technology for Nonprofits, Museums, Religious Organizations, Libraries, and Foundations. Help brainstorm fun ideas to implement in social. Help engage online communities through our social platforms. Assist with identifying influencers. Assist with Facebook Lives, podcasts and other live experiences on social.   Qualifications   Education and Experience Must be actively and presently enrolled an accredited college or university at an undergraduate or graduate level. Preferred Degrees: Marketing, Communications, and Social Media Management, Nonprofit Management or related field. At least 1 year of experience in social media to meet organization or business goals. Knowledge Social networking and nonprofit knowledge preferred User of social media channels. Understanding of social trends and general marketing concepts. Skills Microsoft Office / Google Docs Diplomacy and teamwork. Technical/functional skills needed: Design (Adobe CC, Canva, or interest to learn) Tech-savvy - ability to learn new platforms. Video Photography Abilities Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Interact in a professional manner with a wide variety of people. Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and meet requirements for timeliness and accuracy   This is a full time, paid summer internship. Apply for this position REQUIRED* APPLY WITH LINKEDIN Apply with Indeed APPLY WITH INDEED First Name* Last Name* Email Address* Address Phone* Resume* Attach resume or Paste resume Cover Letter* College or University Are you 18 years of age or older? title: Corporate Strategy Intern
description: Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in CheggÕs Strategy group.   Organization: Strategy  The Strategy team is central to Chegg Ð We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the companyÕs overall strategy. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders and deal makers. We help drive decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore manage CheggÕs M&A activities. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity. Most recently, our team led the acquisition of Imagine Easy Solutions, whose products include EasyBib, Citation Machine, and BibMe, among others.  Role:  Corporate Strategy Intern  WeÕre looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team and work on strategic projects in concert with the companyÕs business and product leaders.  On our Strategy team, you will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Career Services, Required Materials, and Learning Services.   Responsibilities:  Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases Present key findings and recommendations to executives Requirements:  A rising senior currently pursuing a bachelorÕs degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017). Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder). Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California. Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer. Have the ability to work 40 hours per week. Strong analytical and communication skills Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in CheggÕs mission Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments Nice to have:  Experience with market research and business analysis Demonstrated passion for education and technology Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting Project or internship experience in the education industry Chegg out our intern program!  http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university  See what itÕs like to be a Chegg intern!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4  Learn more about Chegg!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo  About Chegg  Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

title: UX Research Intern
description: 2017 SUMMER INTERNSHIP  Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in User Experience (UX) Design.   Organization:  Product > UX Design The User Experience team lives within CheggÕs Product organization. The UX Research Team is part of the larger UX Group. We partner with CheggÕs Product Management, Engineering and Marketing organizations to do research that informs great user experiences.  Role:  UX Research Internship We do UX Research differently at Chegg! Instead of working by yourself or jumping from project to project, youÕll be an embedded member of one of our product groups. Working directly with your Research leader and using a variety of methodologies, youÕll plan, execute, evaluate and share insights from your UX Research. YouÕll work to optimize our customerÕs experience and turn insights into engaging, actionable recommendations that make a difference for our customers. You definitely wonÕt be writing reports and filing them away on a wiki!  Responsibilities:  Test mockups and prototypes of our products in our on-site research lab and in the Field Partner with UX Designers to create design solutions for our products based on customer data Use remote tools like UserTesting.com to get feedback on designs Compile and review research results and report key findings; make recommendations to Design, Product and Marketing based on those findings Conduct surveys of current and canceled customers; identify and explore product-related opportunities for improvement Engage with CheggÕs Summer College Interns frequently to gain insight into product design, user experience(s) as well as Student attitudes towards things like Tutoring. Requirements:        Currently pursuing a graduate level degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, HCI, Education, Cognitive Science or other relevant fields (with a graduation date of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week Ability to prioritize and manage work to adhere to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment Familiarity with user-centered design principles, careful attention to detail, as well as ability to grasp multiple product requirements Familiarity with analytics tools like Google Analytics Adept at user-centered research methodologies Curious and creative; enjoy complex issues and problem solving Ability to facilitate the rapid iterative design process Ability to blend both quantitative metrics and qualitative feedback into the product design process

title: Marketing Design Intern
description: Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in Consumer Insights. Organization: Marketing Marketing teams are central to Chegg Ð communicating the value of our amazing products or services to customers.  Role:  Marketing Design Internship WeÕre looking for a highly motivated intern to work on the Marketing Design team. Responsibilities: Provide support to Marketing Design team & all marketing channels with ongoing creative needs Effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale Concept & create artwork for social media, emails, banner advertising, and landing pages Organize and update creative assets, style guides and presentations Assist with design research, keeping up to date on latest design trends & best practices Participate in campaign planning, gathering student insights, testing concepts and exploring design solutions to market Chegg and drive customers to our products Requirements: Currently pursuing a BA, BFA, HCI, or other design-related degree (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week Have an online portfolio Prior experience with visual design, creating graphics and a solid grasp of design concepts Comfortable working with Adobe Creative Suite (including Photoshop and Illustrator), Microsoft PowerPoint, Mac OS X platform Understand and can incorporate best practices & current trends in design and layout, and adapt designs for mobile formats Knowledge of student culture & current student lifestyle trends Motivated self-starter who takes initiative and is a quick learner Be willing to jump in & help out with all phases of the design process Ability to work autonomously and use critical thinking Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, organized Bonus if you have photography or have video editing skills (but not required!).

title: Business Analytics Intern
description: Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in Chegg Study.  Organization: Learning Services - Chegg Study  Chegg is an ed-tech company that helps students get into the right college, save money on their books, ace their classes and enter the workforce. Chegg Study, a leading product of the Chegg family, is a homework-help and learning solution that helps students get homework done, understand and deepen their knowledge, get better grades, and succeed in college. Role: Business Analytics Ð Intern  We are looking for an analytical, creative, and highly motivated intern with a passion for education to join our team. An intern on our team will investigate and derive insights from analyzing the customer funnel, engagement and retention. The intern will develop business cases for product or operations improvements that directly impact students. At the end of the internship, the intern will present to the team and other key stakeholders.   Responsibilities:   Work closely with the cross-functional team to understand business KPIs Provide recommendations for new features / changes to existing product Build detailed financial models to support business cases Conduct qualitative and quantitative research Present and interpret analytics findings and participate actively in discussions of results Must be persistent, creative and have strong team skills   Requirements: Currently pursuing a BS or advanced degree in a quantitative field (statistics, economics, business, or a related field) from an accredited four-year college or university (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week   Strong analytics / SQL skills and attention to detail Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills  Ability to communicate ideas clearly Self-motivated; organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in CheggÕs mission Ability to think critically and work autonomously Strong desire to learn!

Video or film creation experience a plus. Ability to work autonomously and use critical thinking Proven track record with high standards of professionalism Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationships inside and outside Chegg Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, organized Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to meet multiple objectives in an entrepreneurial environment with little supervision Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week

Okay to Continue More Information DISCOVER THOMSON REUTERS DIRECTORY OF SITES LOGIN CONTACT SUPPORT Thomson Reuters Navigation Search JOBS AND CAREERS AT THOMSON REUTERS Careers Home Our Jobs What We Do Where We Are Recent Graduates & Interns Connect With Us Careers > Product Marketing Intern-Westlaw - Eagan, MN Bring Your Passion Product Marketing Intern-Westlaw Job Description   We are seeking talented students for consideration in our Summer Internship Program at Thomson Reuters. We have designed an 11-week program that offers a full-time experience, where the intern is assimilated into a group to learn about and work under the guidance of an experienced manager. You will have the chance to attend senior management speaking events, participate in business networking, receive opportunities through scheduled events dedicated to the Intern population and gain invaluable professional experience through project-based work.  It is an amazing experience to explore a career in one of the leading global financial information organizations.     The Product Marketing Intern supports initiatives for the Westlaw product marketing team, including execution and measurement of marketing programs, campaigns, and incentives. The Intern also assists the team in developing new programs, and refining existing programs, to maintain the current customer base, and drive new business growth.    Key Responsibilities  Initiation and management of the production of marketing and collateral pieces, including the routing of approvals to business partners and communication of progress Manage content and organization of internal-facing web pages  Manage tactical responsibilities to effectively meet project deadlines Monitor, collect, and report results of customer surveys Manage media title: Content Marketing Intern
description: Privacy Policy Job Openings Content Marketing Intern Marketing ‰ÛÒ Saint Charles, Missouri DSquared International LLC is a family owned ecommerce startup company based in the St. Louis area. The company was created to bring the finest consumer brands to customers by leveraging the power of the internet. At DSquared International, we decided to create a company based on the idea that there‰Ûªs more to life than punching a clock and collecting a paycheck. True fulfillment comes from achieving big goals and being a part of something bigger than yourself. Our people and our customers are our top priority. Without them, we would be nothing. We pride ourselves on our innovation, creativity, and willingness to try and possibly fail. All success comes on the other side of failure. We are committed to our fundamental core values: Fun, Passion, Integrity, Personal Growth, and Hard Work, which all center around Excellence ‰ÛÒ the true definition of our company‰Ûªs success. We are on a mission to create the best damn consumer products brands on the internet and ensure that our customers receive the best experience possible. Because of that vision, we are experiencing 3X year-over-year growth and focused on taking the company to $20M annual revenue in the next 5 years. Job Description We are looking for a qualified intern to join our marketing team. As a Content Marketing Intern at DSquared International, you will work directly with the marketing team to create social media and blog content strategies to drive traffic to our products on Amazon and our brand website. This intern should be prepared to work in a team environment where self initiative and an entrepreneurial spirit is both encouraged and highly expected. This internship will provide you with experience in various social media channels including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Pinterest. Who are you? DSquared International is looking for ambitious, adaptable, A-level players that are excited to work hard and create their definition of success. Everyone has different goals and dreams, and while we need your help to us reach ours, we‰Ûªre passionate about helping you reach yours. If you‰Ûªre boring‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. We like to work with fun people that want to do something creative and BIG. Social media and content marketing require fresh new ideas that grab ATTENTION. If you‰Ûªre lazy‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. Work should be a BLAST, but it‰Ûªs still work, and we expect a lot out of our people. We work HARD so we can play HARD. If you don‰Ûªt like to think for yourself and want everything handed to you on a silver platter‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. In a startup environment, our primary marketing focus can change from one day to the next. You need to be a self-starter and be excited and hungry to learn more about digital marketing. If you‰Ûªre willing to invest time into your learning, you will become a kick ass marketer.  If you‰Ûªre a dreamer, that‰Ûªs looking for more than a traditional 9-to-5 and likes to get outside the box and do things a little bit differently than what is ‰ÛÏnormal‰Û or ‰ÛÏexpected‰Û, then DSquared International might be the right fit for you! The task at hand Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to: Creating, implementing, and measuring Facebook, Instagram, Google, and Pinterest content campaigns to drive sales and generate leads Creating content marketing strategies designed to grow our social media following and increase traffic to our blog and website Improving Search Engine Optimization (SEO) for high value keywords by performing keyword research, creating blogs and content, and building links Assisting in the launch of new products on Amazon and our website The ideal candidate Strong communication and writing skills with attention to detail and ability to write concisely with a strong voice Strong technological savvy ‰ÛÒ 99% of what we do involves the computer. It‰Ûªs okay if you‰Ûªve never created a video, website, or blog before, but if you‰Ûªre intimidated by the idea of having to learn how, this probably isn‰Ûªt for you Experience using Facebook/Pinterest/Twitter/Instagram Experience using Photoshop or Canva to create digital content is a huge plus but not a requirement Demonstrated success in managing personal brand on social media Pursuing a degree in marketing, visual communications, art, or graphic design An appetite to eat challenges for breakfast and see opportunities and solutions in the face of those challenges An ability to carry out a concept from start to finish solo and as a part of a team A hunger to learn all things content marketing and take the risk to try something new without fear of ‰ÛÏfailing‰Û A smile and a sparking personality that will mesh well with the DSquared family  To apply, please submit a resume and cover letter. In your cover letter tell us why you think you'd be a good fit for DSquared International, your favorite social media platform and why, and the 3 things you are most passionate about. description: Home Jobs Marketing and Writing Intern Jobs Login 03-Mar-2017 to 02-May-2017 (CET) Merriam, KS, USA Seasonal We offer our employees a competitive salary and benefits package including a comprehensive Medical and Dental Plan, company paid Life Insurance, 401(k) Plan, Education Assistance, and EAP. Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job United Excel has been executing successful healthcare design/build projects since 1994. We strive to uphold our standard of excellence in delivering complex healthcare projects on schedule, on budget and with complete customer satisfaction, and we demonstrate our commitment to these goals by submitting to third party performance reviews on every completed project. In 2014, more than 18 years later, we continue to expand our client centric, performance driven, healthcare design/build efficiency model. The measured steps in our growth have presented many new exciting opportunities as our clients engage us on larger, more constrained healthcare projects. We are seeking a full-time summer intern to support its marketing department. This exciting opportunity will provide exposure to a wide range of marketing activities, including, but not limited to, proposal coordination, social media, and marketing communications. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual with strong writing skills and exceptional attention to detail. RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS: Assist with proposal coordination (setting up meetings, downloading & distributing RFP documents, managing email communication, proofreading, formatting, compiling all proposal information, printing and/or submitting proposal) Assist with creation and writing of newsletter content, press releases, project descriptions, blog content, personnel experience descriptions, social media, and other company marketing materials Assist with corporate presentation coordination (developing PowerPoints, etc.) Assist with trade show coordination Assist with management and growth of company social media Assistance with formatting and proofreading proposals and other company marketing materials Coordinate and collaborate with other departments of the corporation in establishing and carrying out responsibilities Miscellaneous other support tasks (g., server organization, management of company databases)   SKILLS, ABILITIES, EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Coursework in Technical Writing, Marketing, Journalism, English, or a related field Superior writing skills, in particular very comfortable with grammar and proofreading Possess strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with extreme attention to detail Exceptional Microsoft Office skills, particularly with formatting Word documents Experience with Adobe Suite a plus, but not required Must be deadline oriented and meet all deadlines Travel could be expected, up to 10% Ability to manage changing priorities and adapt to a changing business environment Demonstrates a strong work ethic and a professional attitude towards colleagues Demonstrate industry knowledge while performing job duties Highly proficient in time management, organization, planning and prioritization   PHYSICAL & ENVIRONMENTAL REQUIREMENTS: Ability to communicate in person, by phone and electronically Ability to work on the computer for extended hours Light physical work; This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.   Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.   Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, the global market leader in aggregates with leading positions in cement, concrete and other downstream activities. Following the acquisition of Italcementi, the company employs some 63,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in around 60 countries. title: Marketing Communications Intern
description: Login | New Search Apply Job Title: Marketing Communications Intern Job Description: The Marketing Communications Intern will help drive the day to day operations of the Global Marketing team. The selected candidate will assist with critical support in 3 practice-areas: Public relations, content marketing and social media. For PR, an intern would help alleviate the tactical workload and project management tasks, so the Global PR Director can focus on more strategic PR activities. The candidate will help review and distribute press releases, and gain practical experience working with media outlets, regional marketing teams and PR agencies. For social media and content marketing, assistance is needed with indexing the library of content that's currently available within the company, and helping project manage the creation of new content. Assistance with these functions will help maximize our investment in global content by giving it regional exposure, while simplifying the set of messages we bring to customers. In turn, the candidate will learn how to manage projects within a matrix organization, become familiarized with translation and localization across regions, and get exposure to the latest social media publishing and advertising tools.  Qualifications: ‰Û¢ Current enrollment in an accredited college or university obtaining a degree in marketing, communication, English, or a related area of study ‰Û¢ 3.0 GPA or higher ‰Û¢ A portfolio is needed in order to be considered for this opportunity (Please submit work in either a PDF document or provide a link to your Web site or blog. An online portfolio is strongly recommended.)  Kodak Alaris is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or veteran status. title: Personal Care Marketing Intern
description: ? Home Search openings Search results Current page Job details     Job details   Job 1 of 1 Submit to Job   Save to cart   View similar jobs   Position Title Personal Care Marketing Intern Auto req ID 7986BR Company Momentive Performance Materials Inc. Location US NY Tarrytown Country USA Function Marketing Company Overview Based in Waterford, New York, Momentive Performance Materials Inc. is a global leader in silicones, quartz and advanced materials, with a 70-year heritage of innovation and being first to market with performance applications that improve everyday life. Our solutions are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living and we work closely with some of the biggest brands in B2B and consumer worlds, covering a broad range of markets - from aerospace and automotive, to building and construction, personal care, and electronics. Momentive materials are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living. At Momentive, we believe that leadership begins with integrity, ethics and environmentally sound operations. When you work for Momentive, you are partnering with a company that is not only focused on delivering value but on doing it in a safe, ethical and environmentally responsible manner. Company Distinction This exciting opportunity is part of Momentive Performance Materials Inc. Position Overview Momentive Performance Materials is currently accepting applications for our 2017 Summer Internship Program! The 2017 Summer Internship Program is designed to expose students to the many facets of business and culture within Momentive. Interns will have the opportunity to work on project-based, real work assignments that directly align with their educational experiences. If you are seeking an internship in an innovative, challenging, and growing environment this opportunity may be for you!     The Personal Care Marketing Intern position will support the Specialty Fluids segment of Momentive Performance Materials‰Ûª Silicones business. This position requires laboratory support in the area of Personal and Home Care applications. The intern will work under the direction of an Application Development Engineer.   Job Responsibilities The Marketing Intern will be responsible for making laboratory scale personal and home care formulations containing Momentive products. The formulations will be assigned to the Intern by the supervising Application Development Engineer‰Ûªs or a person in personal care technical support team. The intern is expected to keep a laboratory notebook, which will include records of experimental procedures, observations, etc.  The Intern is also expected to comply with Momentive‰Ûªs Safety and EHS policies, which include attendance at the site Safety Meetings and Information meetings and participation in monthly lab safety walkthroughs.  In addition, the Intern will begin compiling a database of competitive materials for future formulation work within OSHA‰Ûªs GHS guidelines. A market research project related to a home care discipline may be asked of the summer intern, those details will be outlined but the supervising Application Development Engineer.   Minimum Qualifications Degree necessary or relevant: Undergraduate student studying chemistry or cosmetic chemistry.   Other We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, minority status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any characteristic protected by law. In order to be considered for this position candidates are required to submit an application for employment through our career site, be at least 18 years of age, willing to take a drug test and submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process. Candidates are required to have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States. If currently an employee of the Company, you must have current satisfactory work performance and in most cases, have been in your current role 18 months. Disclaimer: We are not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms/employment agencies for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee about this position. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee of the Company via email, the Internet or in any other form and/or method without a valid written search firm agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of the Company; no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by the Company as a result of the unsolicited referral or through other means. title: Digital Media Intern
description: Home Jobs Digital Media Intern ‰ÛÒ Nonprofit Marketing Search Jobs Login - Development Indianapolis, IN, USA Internship Email Me This Job Are you visually creative but analytical too? Do you thrive on the fast pace of social media marketing? Do you care about the reason behind your work? If so, check out this opportunity at Children's Bureau, Inc., one of Indiana's most progressive nonprofits, working to protect children and preserve families.  We're looking for a motivated designer/wordsmith to produce content for four social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn). This intern works with the Children's Bureau's communications content strategist to educate and engage multiple audiences. "Interning with Children's Bureau was a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience working for a nonprofit while simultaneously giving back to my community. Collaborating in a fun, team atmosphere enhanced my knowledge of social media, event planning, corporate relations, and ultimately provided me with the skills necessary to start my career." ‰ÛÒ Jessica Almon, 2015 Children's Bureau Intern   WHAT YOU'LL DO Plan/implement weekly social media content Create graphics for use in social media, website and more Track/report social media metrics Updates and SEO for childrensbureau.org Assist with creating/scheduling email campaigns Collaborate with other interns WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  The successful candidate will: Be an excellent writer, detail oriented, efficient and willing to learn Be able to think creatively and strategically at a fast pace Have good organizational skills, integrity and great follow through Minimum of intermediate design skills with a knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (emphasis on Photoshop/InDesign/Illustrator) Basic HTML, CSS, or experience with WordPress a plus Knowledge of video editing software a plus  THE FINE PRINT 40 hours per week Must have access to reliable transportation Language requirements: Fluent written and spoken English This is a paid internship with a stipend awarded at the end of 12 weeks.   Children's Bureau is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status. title: Marketing Intern
description: Sign In Career Opportunities: Marketing Intern (13363) RAF ID 13363 - Posted 02/23/2017 - United States - United States - PA - Exton - Marketing - Not Defined ”âª  Job Description Print Preview Apply Apply using LinkedIn‰ã¢ Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List    Bentley Systems is a global leader in providing architects, engineers, geospatial professionals, constructors, and owner-operators with comprehensive software solutions for advancing the design, construction, and operations of infrastructure. Bentley users leverage information mobility across disciplines and throughout the infrastructure lifecycle to deliver better-performing projects and assets. Bentley solutions encompass MicroStation applications for information modeling, ProjectWise collaboration services to deliver integrated projects, and AssetWise operations services to achieve intelligent infrastructure ‰ÛÒ complemented by worldwide professional services and comprehensive managed services.   Founded in 1984, Bentley has more than 3,000 colleagues in over 50 countries, more than $600 million in annual revenues, and since 2008 has invested more than $1 billion in research, development, and acquisitions.
