title: Content and Marketing Intern
description: Apply Now Content and Marketing Intern at Trilogy Ed (View all jobs) Boca Raton, FL About Trilogy: Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers. And although we‰Ûªve successfully graduated hundreds of students, this is truly Day 1 for us. Driven by a one-team mentality, we‰Ûªre looking for those with the hunger, talent, and passion to ride this wave with us. Trilogy is the first of its kind to bring the successful web development boot camp model in house to academic institutions while supporting the entire student academic journey. Our platform combines coding curriculum, student recruitment, and career placement services to elevate graduates for increased job market success. We are in high-growth mode and rapidly expanding our family of partners. We are looking for a content and marketing intern who is comfortable in fast-paced working conditions and thrives in an environment where performance is paramount. This internship is for 15 hours per week. Duties & Responsibilities: Build and execute on a social and blog content roadmap Pull and analyze data from reporting tools and Google Analytics Write and edit short and long-form content assets from start to finish Research, write and edit blog posts on an array of tech topics Manage customer service and feedback via social media platforms and review websites Partner with internal designers and project managers on content production Use Facebook, Instagram and other social platforms to drive traffic Monitor social media best practices and engage in proactive recommendations Build reports and show how you are measuring and optimizing your performance Utilize social media listening tools What makes you a great fit for this role (Requirements): Desire to get hands-on marketing and social media experience in a fast-growing company while making an impact in the lives of others Experience with major social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat, etc.) Excellent writing capabilities, with the ability to write for different mediums (e.g. email, advertising, social media) and audiences Strong attention to detail and time management skills Familiarity with Google Drive applications and Microsoft Office Ability to come up with design concepts for social media and blog graphics What makes you stand out: Experience writing content tailored to each social media platform and knowledge of best practices a plus Familiarity with web development and/or data analytics a plus Knowledge of social tools (Hootsuite, Brand24, Buffer, etc.) and WordPress a plus Apply for this Job * Required (Optional) First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone * Resume/CV * Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste Cover Letter Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste LinkedIn Profile Website How did you hear about this job? U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary) Individuals seeking employment at Trilogy Ed are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file. Gender Please select Male Female Decline To Self Identify Are you Hispanic/Latino? Please select Yes No Decline To Self Identify Race & Ethnicity Definitions If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities1. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way. If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier. How do I know if I have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: Blindness Deafness Cancer Diabetes Epilepsy Autism Cerebral palsy HIV/AIDS Schizophrenia Muscular dystrophy Bipolar disorder Major depression Multiple sclerosis (MS) Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) Obsessive compulsive disorder Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation) Disability Status Please select Yes, I have a disability (or previously had a disability) No, I don't have a disability I don't wish to answer Reasonable Accommodation Notice Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. title: Consumer Insights Intern
description: Consumer Insights Intern ROAD CREW SUMMER INTERNSHIP | NEW YORK, NY, UNITED STATES   At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. People‰ÛÓthe listeners, the artists, and our employees‰ÛÓare at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we‰Ûªre looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora. The Intern will support the Pandora advertising sales team by providing analysis on behavioral and attitudinal trends; not just in the music industry, but also in the major advertising categories we play in. They should have a firm understanding of survey techniques and be comfortable reading and manipulating data.  They should be gifted at interpreting information into digestible insights for audiences of various data-comprehension levels, and communicating findings clearly and concisely.   What‰Ûªs in it for you: Get to know new research methodologies and their applications to business Experience managing an in-house research panel of 50,000 listeners, and speak to them on a weekly basis Training in a myriad of 3rd party data sources, including Nielsen, comScore, eMarketer, U.S. Census data, and other data resources Design and project manage primary research from start to finish (stakeholder kick-off, survey design, distribution, data extraction and analysis, debrief and presentation) Work with various departments (Marketing, Strategy, Sales, Business Development) and understand their functions Get exposure to other research and data functions, including ‰ÛÏbig data‰Û Analytics, Advertising Effectiveness, Measurement and Reporting Understand how research can be an effective tool in business cases and pitches, both internally and externally  To land this gig, you will need: Currently enrolled student majoring in Business, Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Sociology, or Psychology Strong Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint) Experience with syndicated research tools (Nielsen, comScore) a plus Experience with data analysis software (SPSS, Q) or experience with querying languages a plus The ability to craft a story with data Must love music! NYC or LA (Santa Monica) based  Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply. Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com.

title: Digital Experience Intern
description: Buffalo Wild Wings Wings Beer Sports Our Menu Promos Find a B-Dubs              BROWSE OPEN JOBS    SEARCH OPEN JOBS    EDIT YOUR PROFILE    VIEW APPLICATION STATUS  Job Details Apply On-line    Requisition Number 17-0212 Title Digital Experience Intern City Minneapolis State or Province MN Country United States Description Know what it‰Ûªs like to be in the stadium on game day? Then you know what it‰Ûªs like to work at Buffalo Wild Wings. It‰Ûªs fun. It‰Ûªs fast-paced. We‰Ûªre at the top of our game ‰ÛÒ and we want to keep it that way. So we‰Ûªre constantly upping the ante, providing the ultimate experience for our fans in our restaurants and in our Home Office. And, of course, it‰Ûªs our people that bring that experience to life.  GAME DAY  It's time to put all of your late night studying, tests and projects into play. From day one, you‰Ûªre charged with driving innovation and implementing ideas that will take the Buffalo Wild Wings Guest Experience to the next level. You will be responsible for creating and/or managing unique programs specific to the various segments of the Buffalo Wild Wings business: lunch, takeout, Happy Hour, late night and Single Day Events (such as National Chicken Wing Day). If that weren‰Ûªt cool enough, you‰Ûªll even have the opportunity to work on digital projects including web and mobile.    Requirements WE'LL PROVIDE THE PLAYBOOK, HERE'S WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE  ‰Û¢ You know the business. You are currently in your junior or senior year studying toward a bachelor's degree in Marketing, Management Information Systems, Business or similar. ‰Û¢ You're a team player. You're ready to jump in and help with projects in order to help meet the needs of the business. Even if it means eating the very last chicken wing. ‰Û¢ You show passion & commitment. You strive in a fast paced environment and are in it to win the game. If it were possible, you'd bleed black and yellow.  BRAG FACTOR  You'll be working for the hottest brand around and have tons of fun doing it. During our 12 week (June 5 ‰ÛÒ August 25), full-time intern program you'll be working straight out of our Home Office in Minneapolis, MN. What else is in it for you? You'll be working on projects that have an impact on business and learn what it takes to be one of the fastest growing restaurant companies in the country. With Fun being one of our core values, there's plenty to look forward to. Whether it's bowling with your fellow interns or cooler scooter races around the office, we can promise that there won't ever be a dull moment.  Complete job description can be requested from your Talent Advisor. Buffalo Wild Wings, Inc. is a NASDAQ-traded (BWLD) restaurant company and an equal opportunity employer.  Connect with us: @BWWCareers on Twitter, Buffalo Wild Wings Careers on Facebook   Send This Job to a Friend Copyright 2017 Buffalo Wild Wings, Inc. Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions

title: Marketing Intern
description: Talent Attraction is a big part of what we do here at DISHER, because passionate people are a central piece of the puzzle in making any organization work and perform well. It is our goal for you to obtain a rewarding career whether it‰Ûªs at DISHER or with one of our partnering companies. Take a look at our complete list of job openings here at DISHER and with other appealing companies we work with.   DISHER AND PARTNER POSITIONS Marketing Intern EMAIL IN SHARE Location: Zeeland, Michigan Date Posted: 01-30-2017 We are currently searching for a Marketing Intern to join our Discovery / Marketing Team for the summer of 2017.  About DISHER:  DISHER is a nationally-recognized product development and business consulting firm with offices in Zeeland and Ann Arbor, Michigan and Indianapolis, Indiana. Our team is highly technical and diversified, serving in a variety of markets including automotive, office furniture, alternative energy, and medical. Our capabilities span from napkin sketch through launch, providing numerous opportunities for us to partner with clients in product and process development. DISHER also assists clients with business solutions and Talent identification and attraction. Check out more about what we do at HTTP://WWW.DISHER.COM/ABOUT-US/     Responsibilities: Maintain and update the DISHER website and social media sites Assist in developing digital marketing assets including presentations and electronic marketing materials Assist our marketing and business development team in developing marketing strategies Help advance website content and functionality, including microsites and landing pages Help manage marketing key word campaigns Develop and distribute e-marketing including blogs, e-newsletters, and Linked In articles Manage and grow digital marketing mailing lists Review SEO analysis, conduct market research, and develop case studies Create monthly company email newsletters If experienced in graphic design, create internal materials as needed (name tags, invitations, business cards, etc.) Develop presentation materials and maintain product portfolio Organize files, samples, and display area Support events & other on-the-fly tasks Instigate nerf gun battles Coordinate and publish posts to DISHER‰Ûªs blog Need to be ready to jump in to assist your teammates  Requirements for this role:   Must currently be enrolled in a College or University as an upper-classmen in a communications or marketing program 6 months or more of experience in areas of Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field required Able to work on web content development and social media Graphic design skills a plus Adobe Creative Suite experience (Illustrator & InDesign in particular) preferred but not required Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PPT required Ability to work independently and as part of our Discovery/Marketing team on a variety of projects as needed Marketing research experience desired Assist in creating design solutions that are aesthetically strong, thoughtful, and brand appropriate Knowledge of statistical analysis, ethnography, demographics, anthropology, and psychology a plus Able to conceptualize and design marketing print media, presentations, and additional visual communication designs Able to design files for review and printing Knowledge of Digital Marketing, including experience with E-Newsletters, Blogs, Key Word Campaigns, Microsites and Landing Pages preferred Experience with Google Analytics and Word Press preferred Must have a keen sense of urgency Must be effective in reloading a Nerf gun in the midst of an ambush Must have current and continuing right to work in the United States without sponsorship   To apply, click the following link, search job # 8038870, and attach resume with your application: HTTP://DISHERDESIGN.CATSONE.COM/CAREERS  The Culture: DISHER is truly and simply a cool place to work.  The teams are supportive, skilled, and passionate. Our culture is rooted in innovation and our mission is to make a positive difference for our teammates, our customers, and our community.  The work motto at DISHER tends to be, ‰ÛÏWork Hard - Play Hard.‰Û  The teams at DISHER are diligent with their projects and truly enjoy the company of their peers.  Hear more from DISHER team members at HTTP://DISHER.COM/ABOUT-US/CULTURE/         APPLY NOW DISHER HEADQUARTERS 201 West Washington Ave. Suite 230 Zeeland, MI 49464 DISHER EAST MICHIGAN OFFICE 3940 Ranchero Dr. Suite 150 Ann Arbor, MI 48108 JOB OPENINGS BLOG CONTACT MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE Subscribe to our monthly newsletter! å© 2016 DISHER | DEVELOPED BY SHINEFORTH

title: Inbound Marketing Intern
description: ABOUT US SOLUTIONS CASE STUDIES RESOURCES BLOG Free Consultation Join the New Breed Team Inbound Marketing Intern We‰Ûªre in search of a college student or recent college grad to join our team as an Inbound Marketing Intern. We want someone with a strong drive to GSD and contribute to our growth. Our best interns don‰Ûªt consider themselves interns at all - they‰Ûªre members of our team. We‰Ûªre looking for someone who is prepared to take on serious responsibilities and get hands-on experience learning the ins-and-outs of a high-growth company.   In this role, you will be responsible for learning how to deliver high quality inbound deliverables (KPIs, website and blog analytics, reporting, campaigns) to address our customers‰Ûª business challenges and marketing objectives. In this role, you will: Aid in the coordination of inbound campaigns and strategies Learn inbound best practices, with the strategic intent of delivering high quality inbound assets Help to identify customer‰Ûªs business objectives, challenges, and key success metrics Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to provide recommendations based on marketing analytics and inbound assessment to address key business and marketing challenges Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to develop inbound performance reports to analyze and monitor inbound strategy effectiveness Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to perform portal audits to identify areas of opportunity Work company wide to provide continuing assistance with inbound marketing activities Project coordinate to ensure scope and budget are met Be responsible for creating project schedules, coordinating deliverables, and facilitating resources for your portfolio of B2B technology companies. Learn how to develop lasting relationships with retainer customers to ensure ongoing service Serve as a brand enthusiast for New Breed suite of products and solutions  You need to: Have quantitative skills and ability to communicate digestible user stories Have the interest in learning current inbound marketing and sales strategies, best practices, and associated resources Have an innate, scrappy and entrepreneurial drive to GSD in a fast moving startup environment where things can change quickly Have self motivation, self awareness, self discipline, self improvement, use good judgment, positive energy, willingness to help others Have the ability to adapt and create proactive change Identify optimal process efficiencies Align with New Breed‰Ûªs Culture Code Have a 3.0 GPA and above Have the availability to work for a minimum of 20 hours a week. Full-time availability is desired. Please specify availability within your cover letter You should have: A love for Marketing and a drive to learn more The interest to write and blog Researched inbound marketing on your own, and you get it An analytical mind and have a thing for numbers Ambition and the desire to work hard Street smarts Emotional intelligence Thrive in a fast paced, cross functional environment Strong listening skills Tons of energy, passion, humor, compassion, and enthusiasm Superior communication skills and presentation skills Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills Pluses: Experience in Marketing Software Your own blog First Name Last Name Email* Phone Number Sample Work Upload Cover Letter (PDF) Upload Your Resume (PDF) Other Thoughts You'd Like to Share Other comments such as expertise /past client work, or really anything else you would like us to know! ‰ÛÏ To see this group of people who are insanely driven and thriving in a company where they can have autonomy to solve for the customer, is an inspiration.‰Û VIEW OUR CULTURE CODE >> Browse All of Our Open Positions If this role isn't for you, take a look at our other open positions to find one that better suits your skillset. The intern will work closely with brand, sales, and product management teams to develop & help execute a comprehensive product launch plan.   Key responsibilities include: Support developing & executing strategic GTM & Marketing Programs tied to corporate initiatives for product launch and channel partners Develop and maintain GTM & marketing calendars Owning and managing projects aligned to the development of customer specific commercial and marketing programs that integrate the brand and customers‰Ûª goals in support of the brand commercial plan.  Basic Qualifications MBA student with an emphasis in Marketing. 2-3 years previous experience in commercial organization. Ability to manage multiple projects Strong collaboration skills    About Emerson Imagine being surrounded by more than 110,000 intelligent, driven and passionate innovators all working toward the same goal‰ÛÓto create groundbreaking solutions that leave our world in a better place than we found it. Our diverse and inclusive team combines technology and engineering in a wide range of industrial, commercial, and consumer markets.  This exciting environment is what you‰Ûªll discover at Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $22.3 billion in sales and facilities in 141 countries. Together, we‰Ûªre changing the world, and we have all the resources to help you achieve your professional goals.  Whether you‰Ûªre an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring options or recently received your MBA degree, you‰Ûªll find a variety of opportunities at Emerson. Explore them now and join us in doing what‰Ûªs never been done before.  White-Rodgers, a business unit of Emerson Commercial & Residential Solutions, is headquartered in St. Louis, MO and is an industry leader in home energy management and comfort control. Our products monitor and control appliances that account for approximately 60% of the energy consumed in the average US household. By networking our products to the cloud, we are discovering new ways to help our customers reduce energy consumption, save money, and maintain comfort. And because our technology touches so much of the residential energy profile, our solutions are positioned to make a significant impact on our nation‰Ûªs carbon footprint. If you want to be part of a collaborative, high energy, fast paced team, where your contributions can make a real impact on the world ‰ÛÒ you have just found the place!  Work Authorization No calls or agencies please. Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. We provide merchandising support and assistance for teams and events within the buildings we own or manage. Our goal as a department is to be the one source for creative development, sourcing, production, distribution and retail of all merchandise opportunities.  Our internship program is designed to promote the professional growth of student interns with an interest in a career of Sports/ Entertainment Merchandise, Finance, Human Resources, Buying, and Marketing. The main goal of our internship program is to assist you in a hands-on environment within the fast paced sports and entertainment world.  JOB DESCRIPTION: AEG Merchandise is seeking a Merchandise Marketing and Ecommerce Intern. This person will be responsible for effectively marketing and promoting our web sites and team stores, as well as helping brand our department to outside sources. The ideal candidate must be able to work in a diverse, high volume, and fast-paced environment. Keyword campaigns, etc. ‰Û¢ Implement the functionalities and operations of the Ecommerce business. ‰Û¢ Help create internal and external web/email producers to effectively promote sales and marketing content on AEG Merchandise outlets and email as well as print ads ‰Û¢ Assist AEG Merchandise teams to fulfill all obligations involving media/promotional activation in the market place ‰Û¢ Creatively find ways to boost AEG Merchandise site traffic and increase user activity ‰Û¢ Assist in the execution of media schedules with blogging, Print ads, and other media ‰Û¢ Responsible for trafficking of media spots/ads ‰Û¢ Assist in the online process of posting Merchandise on line ‰Û¢ Create content and images for all social media sites we manage ‰Û¢ Learn how the process of fulfilling online orders is handled  The minimum qualifications for this internship include:  ‰Û¢ Enrollment as a full-time student at an accredited college or university ‰Û¢ Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher ‰Û¢ Be able to work up to 20-24 hours per week (minimum 10 weeks) ‰Û¢ Ability to build strong relationships with our team and customers ‰Û¢ Strong computer skills, as well as be internet savvy ‰Û¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‰Û¢ Passion for marketing/promoting sports teams and entertainment strongly preferred ‰Û¢ Must be able to assist individuals of various levels with needs and react to difficult situations appropriately ‰Û¢ Able to work certain special events and sporting games when needed ‰Û¢ Self-motivated with the ability work in fast-paced environment ‰Û¢ Fluent computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office, Mac/PC design software ‰Û¢ Photoshop, Flash, HTML, web/media technology is favorable from candidate   AEG is committed to developing a diverse workforce title: Intern - Sales and Marketing
description: Find Opportunities U.S. English Sign In Summer Intern - Sales/Marketing - MPP (2 positions) Operations Apply now Posted: March 2, 2017 Full-Time Pittsburgh, PA, United States Who we are: LANXESS is a leading specialty chemicals company with sales of EUR 7.9 billion in 2015 and roughly 16,200 employees in 29 countries. The company is currently represented at 52 production sites worldwide. The core business of LANXESS is the development, manufacturing and marketing of plastics, rubber, intermediates and specialty chemicals. LANXESS is a member of the leading sustainability indices Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI World and DJSI Europe) and FTSE4Good. LANXESS Corporation offers an extensive internship program where undergraduate and graduate level talent work across various company functions to gain valuable hands-on experience in a fast-paced corporate environment.   As a Summer Intern Sales/Marketing in our MPP (Materials Protection Products) Business unit you will be one of two interns - one sales oriented  and one technical, chemical engineer desirable, to complete market studies and applications analysis for market areas like Water treatment and Plastics applications. You will perform the following tasks: Conduct market research and data analysis for relevant application fields (e.g polymer emulsions, paints & coatings); Present an executive summary related to market research Prepare competition analysis and benchmarking information Research company profile of potential customers Maintain key account profile management Conduct cold calling of prospect customers In order to accomplish this you must have:  Completed your sophomore year or higher in Business Administration with a major in marketing; Engineering or Chemistry with a minimum of a 3.0 GPA Experience in data analysis and presentation Excel data managing, pivot tables and graph design Powerpoint presentations Communications skills both written and phone Sales and/or marketing background or training Technical understanding in marketing and market data trends    Must include a resume.   LANXESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status or disability. description: Home Jobs Social and Digital Media Intern Jobs Login 01-Feb-2017 to 02-Apr-2017 (CST) Sales Bastrop, TX, USA 7.25 Hourly Part Time Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job The Social and Digital Media Intern will play an active role in the development of Lost Pines Toyota's online community. He/she will regularly analyze and report on the activity on social media networks as well as the Lost Pines Toyota website.  He/she will also assist in maintaining Lost Pines Toyota's archive of digital images, videos, and other content. The intern will learn how to reach communities, and promote events or programs through the internet and gain experience in social media platforms and the tools used to assess their performance.  RESPONSIBILITIES    SOCIAL MEDIA  Performs research to find articles, stories, resources, or other content that is relevant to our customer base and posts it to our Facebook and Twitter page in a manner that invites conversation and interaction. Completes other social media projects as assigned.    DIGITAL MEDIA Takes pictures and videos of training events to be developed into content for the Lost Pines Toyota website, Facebook and Twitter pages. Uploads Lost Pines Toyota photos and videos to the appropriate server or DropBox account. Organizes and archives digital images and videos. Completes other digital media projects as assigned.  Research  Regularly observes the online activity of model organizations researches and reports on "social media best practices".  Completes other research projects as assigned. ANALYTICS & REPORTING Uses Google Analytics to assess trends and activity on the Lost Pines Toyota website.  Uses Facebook Insights to assess trends and activity on the Lost Pines Toyota Facebook page.  Uses Twitter Analytics to assess trends and activity on the Lost Pines Toyota Twitter page.  Reviews data on the performance of social media platforms and adjusts plans or strategies to optimize reach. REQUIREMENTS Creative self-starter who is comfortable with both taking initiative and working in collaboration.  Detail oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills.  Experience with Microsoft applications, basic photo-editing and video-editing software, and internet browsers. Experience with Photoshop and InDesign a plus.  Familiarity and facility with mainstream social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and LinkedIn.  Available to work 15 hours per week between the hours of 9:00am and 5:00pm. ELIGIBILITY  This is a part-time internship.  Candidates should maintain a positive attitude under pressure, exhibit a strong work ethic, and enjoy working with a wide range of personalities. Most importantly, the candidate should be flexible and willing to take on multiple tasks in a start-up environment. This internship will benefit someone who is interested in marketing, education, community relations, and audience development. Apply Now * Fields Are Required What is your full name? title: Communications Intern - Corporate Communications
description: About Us Benefits Choose an Organization Home > HealthPartners > Job Posting Job Posting  Share this Job Communications Intern - Corporate Communications Department Job Apply now  Job Description:  Looking for an excellent opportunity to hone your public relations and communications skills? HealthPartners Communications is seeking a Communications Intern with awesome writing skills, and a strong interest in public relations, internal communications, and/or social media.  At HealthPartners, you‰Ûªll find a culture where we live our values of excellence, compassion, integrity and most importantly, partnership. By working together, we will improve health, create exceptional experiences for those we serve and make care and coverage more affordable.  RESPONSIBILITIES: ‰Û¢ Create and edit content for channels that are both for internal and external audiences. This could include writing blogs, social media content, internal newsletter articles, internal memos, and other types of content; and creating videos and digital content that can be shared internally and externally. ‰Û¢ Contribute to communications planning for internal partners to help them reach their goals. ‰Û¢ Write and distribute news releases, media pitches, follow-up with reporters and media contacts, prepare background information for interviews, maintain media lists and editorial calendars, and assist with interview processes. ‰Û¢ Support the management of organization-owned social channels, including Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. This would include posting blog posts, posting organic content, creating paid Facebook and Instagram ads, monitoring and responding to comments, and compiling results to show the impact and reach of those channels.  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: ‰Û¢ Strong writing skills ‰Û¢ A recent graduate of a communications, journalism, public relations, or related program ‰Û¢ Previous internship experience ‰Û¢ Interest in health care field a plus  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: ‰Û¢ Previous experience managing social media channels, including monitoring and responding to comments, using Facebook Ad Manger and Facebook analytics tools ‰Û¢ Previous media relations experience, including writing press releases, pitching reporters and assisting with interview processes.  OTHER DETAILS: ‰Û¢ 40 hours per week; six month commitment is requested ‰Û¢ Individual will work at the HealthPartners office building in Bloomington, but may travel to other locations in the organization as appropriate ‰Û¢ $12/hour wage  HealthPartners is recognized nationally for providing outstanding care and experience for patients and members. For more information and to apply go to www.healthpartners.com/careers and search for job ID #42756.  Additional Information:  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  Nearest Major Market: Minneapolis Job Segment: Communications, Corporate Communications, Intern, Social Media, PR, Marketing, Entry Level Apply now  Find similar jobs: HealthPartners Home Privacy Policy

title: Marketing Intern
description: ENG SIGN IN Home Corporate Careers Contact Go To Job Search SHARE APPLY Posted On03/01/2017 Marketing Intern Atlanta Office, Smyrna, GA, US  Worker Category :Intern  Job ClassMarketing Services Company Overview: Summit Group provides innovative solutions through its three lines of business: Branded Solutions, Recognition Solutions and Marketing Solutions - all that support specific customer objectives and goals. Summit Group achieves approximately $80 million in sales annually. Clients include UPS, Allstate, Barilla, Jack Daniels, Sun Trust, Geico, American Diabetes Association, and many others. Internship Description: Summit Group‰Ûªs internship program provides students with hands-on experience at a national marketing firm. Throughout the internship program, students will have the opportunity to work with various departments within Summit Group and engage in a variety of assignments and projects to develop marketing and business skills. Summit Group is currently looking for a full-time intern within the Marketing Solutions (SMS) division. The Marketing Solutions team develops and manages integrated marketing campaigns, which include advertising, merchandising, promotions and events, for consumer and business-to-business brands. The internship will last 10-12 weeks.  Responsibilities may include:  Client services: Attend client meetings, handle various requests from sales managers, general admin and organization duties Client communication: Prepare status call recap communication documents, share update and reports as needed Online media: Web site analysis and management, contribute to e-mail marketing communications Business development: Conduct new business research and competitor analysis, participate in the creation of RFP responses on behalf of SMS team Social media: manage client social media accounts, contribute to monthly reporting process, help manage online advertising such as Facebook ads and Promoted Pins on Pinterest Creative services management and event planning: Coordinate creative development of event program Market research: Create trends research, including presentation of results Media buying/placement: Monitor print and online media placements Financial management: File invoices, proposals and PO‰Ûªs from client Throughout the internship program students will meet with a throughout the company, have opportunities to work on special projects of their choosing, and be given professional coaching.  Qualifications: - Must be currently enrolled in college (sophomore or above)  - Commitment to at least 30 hours work per week - Excellent verbal and written communication skills - Ability to work effectively with others and manage multiple deliverables at once - Strong organizational skills and attention to detail - Proficient in MS Office programs - Understanding of social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and YouTube) - Motivated self-starter - Minimum GPA of 3.0 - Letter of Credit (for credit-earning positions) Preferred Majors: Business, Marketing, Communications, Public Relations and related degrees Requisition ID1017 å© 2017, ADP LLC USA PRIVACYLEGALREQUIREMENTS Powered By

title: Marketing Research Intern
description: Intern, Marketing Research Location: San Francisco Job Code: 867 # of openings: 1 Description Intern, Marketing Research   Silicon Valley-based PR and influencer marketing firm Voce Communications (Vo-chay), a Porter Novelli company, is currently seeking an Intern to join the Strategic Planning, Analytics, and Research team. The ideal candidate will have a background in quantitative analysis, be able to effectively communicate strategic insights and collaborate on multiple projects simultaneously.   Tasks & Responsibilities:   Executes quantitative and qualitative research projects to support brand marketing goals Collect, manipulate, and analyze raw data from a variety of sources including social media, digital platforms, conversion data, or other first-party client data. Create easy-to-understand presentations and data visualizations in PowerPoint and dashboards. Generate weekly and monthly reports that synthesize data across multiple platforms. Maintain and document consistent data analysis methodology. Keep current on cultural trends and appropriate measurement techniques.    Skills & Experience: Demonstrated ability to think strategically and objectively. Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret a variety of types of data. Ability to clearly communicate insights from raw data internally and to external clients. Advanced Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint proficiency. Strong writing and presentation skills.   Education: BA/BS degree with quantitative experience or equivalent work experience.  Porter Novelli is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment against any person on account of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, disabled veteran, veteran of the Vietnam era or other eligible veteran, age, marital status, veteran status, or physical or mental handicap unrelated in nature and extent to an individual's ability to perform a job or any other characteristic protected by the employment discrimination laws in any state or political subdivision in which Porter Novelli does business. title: Summer Internship - PR
description: Job Opportunity Job title : Summer Internship - PR Function : Communication Requisition Type : Internship Professional experience : Entry level Parent Brand : MSLGROUP Global Brand : MSLGROUP Agency : MSL Boston Country : United States Location : Boston Job Description: MSLGROUP Boston is currently seeking smart, innovative and passionate interns to participate in our summer 2017 internship program (Waltham, MA office)! You‰Ûªll receive extensive experience in the world of communications, and will be involved in executing integrated campaigns across multiple communications channels. Our interns have the opportunity to work in a variety of practice areas and represent some of the world's most powerful brands within healthcare, technology, healthcare IT, security and financial technology industries.  MSLGROUP is a leading global communications organization. We are trusted advisors to some of the world‰Ûªs biggest brands, helping them creatively engage with their audiences 24/7.  We have a rich heritage: Parisian traditions on the one hand, American culture on the other and a dynamic and rapidly growing Asian voice. That means versatility and flexibility are core markers in our DNA. Our multicultural heritage means we're comfortable in our skin in a communications world where old structures are collapsing, boundaries are blurring and innovative thinking reigns supreme.  Our people are innovators. If you can look at problems in new ways and come up with the solutions nobody had considered before, we will offer you the environment, the space and the inspiration to do so. You‰Ûªll be working alongside leading thinkers, with colleagues from around the globe. If you want to be part of the conversations that are shaping the world we live and work in, you‰Ûªll want to be here.  Duration: 8-12 weeks (June 2017 ‰ÛÒ August 2017) Pay: This is a full-time, paid internship. Assignment: You will be assigned to work a variety of account teams and projects. You will also work with your fellow Insiders on a competitive project (completing a PR/integrated marketing program for one of our clients). Mentor: A mentor will be appointed to guide you throughout the summer.  Sample of Daily Responsibilities: ‰Û¢ Daily monitoring of media for news and information about our clients. ‰Û¢ Development of media lists. ‰Û¢ Writing press releases, blogs, plans, fact sheets, pitch letters, case studies. ‰Û¢ Participating in brainstorming, office activities, staff meetings and client meetings as well as ensuring overall client satisfaction. ‰Û¢ Researching and assisting with program and presentation development for existing clients and new prospects. ‰Û¢ Participating in social networking for clients and follow influential bloggers/writers. ‰Û¢ Executing tactical elements of client programs from start to finish. ‰Û¢ Executing PR plans and tactical digital elements from start to finish. ‰Û¢ Social media community management, content creation, scheduling and strategy. ‰Û¢ Creation and execution of digital advertising plans across multiple platforms. ‰Û¢ Analysis and reporting from Google Analytics, Google AdWords and social media monitoring tools.  Additional Information:  Criteria for Applicants: ‰Û¢ Completed their junior year (rising seniors) or a recent graduate (December 2016 ‰ÛÒ May 2017) of undergraduate college. ‰Û¢ Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher. ‰Û¢ Solid media relations and excellent writing skills. ‰Û¢ Great attention to detail, enthusiasm, organization, and desire to be a team player. ‰Û¢ Creative thinker that is paying attention to what other brands and industries are doing. ‰Û¢ Creative storytelling capabilities. ‰Û¢ Proactive in following through with deadlines for media and clients. ‰Û¢ Works well in a team environment. ‰Û¢ A strong understanding of the relationship between traditional public relations and the use of current online/digital technology and social media. ‰Û¢ Baseline understanding of SEO, social media strategy and digital advertising; Excellent writing skills  About Us: MSLGROUP is Publicis Groupe‰Ûªs strategic communications and engagement group, advisors in all aspects of communication strategy: from consumer PR to financial communications, from public affairs to reputation management and from crisis communications to experiential marketing and events. With more than 3,500 people across close to 100 offices worldwide, MSLGROUP is also the largest PR network in Europe, fast-growing China and India. The group offers strategic planning and counsel, insight-guided thinking and big, compelling ideas ‰ÛÒ followed by thorough execution. www.mslgroup.com | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn | YouTube | Slideshare | Pinterest   MSLGROUP is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.  APPLY Apply with LinkedInå¨

title: Intern, Home Appliance Brand Marketing
description: Undergraduate Intern, Home Appliance Brand Marketing Location: Englewood Cliffs Department: HA Consumer Marketing Team - 120096 Job Code: 20088 Company: LGEUS Job Function: Marketing Description At LG we make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make ‰ÛÏLife Good‰Û ‰ÛÒ from home appliances, consumer electronics, vehicle components and mobile communications to business innovations in digital signage, air conditioning, solar and LED lighting. As a global leader, we strive for greatness in product leadership, market leadership and people leadership to realize our growth strategies. Talk about a mantra. Life‰Ûªs Good with LG! We offer an environment that enables colleagues to demonstrate their capabilities, focus on their work and create value.  At LG, you're encouraged to take a creative and individual approach to challenges with strong emphasis placed on performance and skill‰ÛÓand equal, merit-based opportunities across the board. We want our colleagues to grow with our global business. That's why we deliver sure rewards for exceptional performance and offer industry-leading benefits. Come join the team! We are currently seeking Undergraduate Intern to join our dynamic team in Englewood Cliffs, NJ as part of the Home Appliance Brand Marketing Team. POSITION DESCRIPTION: This role will assist Home Appliances brand marketing team in the development of communications strategies and marketing programs to drive key business segment (s) and execution of integrated marketing communication plans. A successful internship will accomplish the following: Develop claims and messaging for new product introductions. Assist in providing competitive reports and analysis. Ensure legal sign-off and obtain aproval of communication assets and materials. Secure product samples for Marketing Events. Facilitate brainstorm sessions with cross functional partners. Assist in managing in-store displays and point of purchase JOB REQUIREMENTS: Enrollment in an accredited University is required Business, Communications, Psychology or Marketing major is required Rising Junior or Senior is preferred Corporate experience as an intern or similar is preferred Must be Social Media Savvy Must be proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Powerpoint), MS Outlook LG Electronics, USA Inc.; LG Mobilecomm USA, Inc., LG Mobile Research USA LLC, and Zenith Electronics LLC provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. title: Product Marketing Intern
description: JOBS AT MICRON FEATURED JOBS LOCATION NOT FINDING A JOB? MICRON GLOBAL Search by Keyword Email similar jobs to me Share this Job Product Marketing Intern Job Apply now  Date: Feb 17, 2017 Location: Milpitas, CA, US Req Id: 63702  Micron Technology, Inc., a world leader in memory technology, is hiring for marketing internships in the areas of Product Marketing, Segment/Ecosystem Marketing and Distribution Marketing for our Storage Business Unit (SBU). Depending on the length of the internship (~ 3-9 months) and a students‰Ûª experience, they may work in one or many of these areas.  The Storage Business Unit develops and markets a diverse product line of memory products for a variety of segments including Networking, Consumer and Industrial.  This position will work closely with product marketing, sales, and other organizations across Micron. description: Have you visited us before? This is a paid internship (June - Aug 2017) based at Alamo Group's Gibson City, IL manufacturing location (RhinoAg).  The Marketing Intern will assist Alamo Group Inc.'s Agricultural Division, and RhinoAg in Gibson City in performing customer data analysis and marketing support projects.  Reporting to the RhinoAg Director of Sales & Marketing, and in collaboration with Alamo Group's North American Agricultural Division VP of Sales & Marketing, this intership is an excellent opportunity to gain valuable exposure to current practices and initiatives in marketing and customer support, and how effective marketing programs contribute to success in today's business environment.     The selected intern will also: Assist with the development of dealer and end-customer profiles for the Alamo Group Agricultural Division Interface directly with RhinoAg in Gibson City, IL as well as virtually with business unites in Iowa, Alabama and Saskatchewan Canada, to assist with development of dealer and customer profiles and maps Participate in web-based market research projects to support Ag Division business units Assist RhinoAg in planning, preparing and presentation of the 2017 Rhino Sales Meeting Assist RhinoAg sales representative or sales manager on one or more customer visits in presenting product marketing information or material Assist with routine monthly Ag Division reports as assigned Assist with other routine Ag Division marketing tasks as needs arise   The selected intern will have/be: Proficient with MS Office desktop computer applications; to include MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint Strong verbal and written communication skills Sound analytical skills with the ability to research and analyze material and formulate well supported conclusions and recommendations Able to multi-task, organize and prioritize work Able to reason and use good judgement Intern must reside within a reasonable commute to Gibson City, IL during the duration of the internship (relocation assistance is not provided)   Education and Experience: Intern must be enrolled as a full-time student in an accredited undergraduate program pursuing a bachelor's degree in business, marketing, agriculture or similar program; preferrably, the intern will have completed at least two (2) years of undergraduate study. Working Conditions: Work will primarily be performed in an office environment indoors with frequent sitting for extended periods of time; occassional lifting of up to 10 pounds may be required in the performance of administrative duties and marketing/sales tasks. title: Marketing Intern
description: Edible Oils Marketing Intern Apply for this Position  CFM Management is the hiring arm of foodguys. We are seeking a talented, versatile and down-to-earth marketing intern for the summer of 2017. In this position you will be supporting a Senior Sales Rep that specifically works with edible oils. When we say Edible you may not think what we mean. We mean Avocado Oil, Coconut Oil, Olive Oil, GMO free Canola Oil, etc, you know, all the stuff you cook with. It‰Ûªs okay if you thought something different. Be sure to check out our website to understand our branding, http://foodguys.com and http://cfm-management.com. We‰Ûªve got a couple videos on youtube (you can click through from CFM), and an Instagram page at https://www.instagram.com/foodguyspdx/. So let your marketing skills go to work, and then apply. This would be a great position for someone specifically studying the graphic arts side of marketing, who has completed their junior year, or has recently walked, but is receiving their diploma in the fall. What will you be doing? The stuff listed here, maybe not in this order, but you will touch all these processes: Create marketing material specific to edible oils Start the conversation, and keep it going via Social Media Basic Point of Sale (POS) layout and design Design labels using existing templates, and in keeping with food label guidelines Write blogs, record vlogs Update, make minor changes to a WordPress site Keep records of social media successes Develop basic marketing campaigns Handle marketing related paperwork; copy, scan, etc. Perform basic administrative support to Sr. Sales Rep Represent company at social functions, as needed Take professional level pictures of products What are we looking for? Recently completed third year of Marketing with a concentration in visual arts and/or graphic design Previous marketing internship helpful, but not required Experience running social media for another entity highly preferred (local bands and other types of grass roots experience is welcome) Experience writing web based content Experience writing print based content What are the knowledge, skills and abilities you need? Mostly things listed below, but don‰Ûªt be dissuaded if you are missing one or two. Unless it‰Ûªs Adobe Creative Suite, we really need you to have a solid understanding of Illustrator, with 80-90% of the following: Excellent MS Office Suite skills Ability to learn the technical side of foods, with a special interest in edible oils Knowledge of food industry helpful Ability to attend events that may happen outside the scope of normal business hours Ability to use a DSLR, and set up professional looking photo shoots Ability to work Monday through Friday 7:30 to 4:30 Ability to travel to customer sites with Sr. Sales Representative Ability to act as professional representative of company, sometimes outside of regular business hours All offers contingent upon the successful completion of a drug test and background check. title: Analytics Intern
description: Search for Homes Buy ‰Ð_ Sell ‰Ð_ Real Estate Agents Redfin Jobs ENGINEERING & HQ REAL ESTATE EARLY CAREER Analytics Intern (Operations or Web Analytics) Analytics | Seattle, WA Apply Now Redfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in consumers' favor. At Redfin, you?ll be able to unleash your brilliance to help us make sure the world knows there's a better way to buy and sell homes. As a part of Redfin's Analytics team, you'll query, filter, and group your way to the truth, crushing biases and side-stepping anomalies to guide the organization on decisions large and small. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst Intern to join us this summer to delve into our data and find opportunities to grow our business and improve customer experience. The Data Analyst Intern will be responsible for providing actionable insights that help us tune-up our marketing strategies or real estate service to drive increased customer satisfaction and faster growth.  Who You Are Successful: These problems are tough!  You should have strong analytical and quantitative skills. We're looking for a student working towards completing a M.S. or PhD in analytics, statistics, operations research, mathematics, engineering or one of the hard sciences.  Sharp: These problems are tough! You should have outstanding analytical and quantitative skills and the confidence to stand behind your results under pressure Practical: We're moving quickly and we need rapid answers to business questions. You must be able to build models and design experiments that produce actionable results on the double Curious: Redfin is looking for an analytical juggernaut that doesn't stop at answering the "what" questions. We want someone who hungers for the "why" and "what if" questions Concise: Communicating your ideas clearly to folks who don't share your passion for analytics is the mark of mastery Take-charge: You think like an owner and work to see your ideas put into practice Qualifications: History of success: We're looking for a current student with an excellent academic record Technical chops: Very strong SQL and Excel skills are required; expertise in Tableau is preferred; comfort in either R or Python is a plus Passion: This internship is not for the faint of heart. This is a high-visibility position with the opportunity to figure out what drives success in an enormous industry We Offer An amazing full-time 12 week summer experience working on data projects that matter to our business Start-up culture (snacks, office events, casual dress code) Smart and passionate co-workers and a manager invested in your growth and development Small teams with great exposure to all levels of the company Competitive compensation Relocation stipend provided for eligible candidates Amazingly smart and fun teammates, and a management team invested in your growth and success  IND123 Apply Now Share this job with your friends. Refer a Candidate Redfin is an equal opportunity employer. title: Marketing Intern
description: Home Jobs Marketing Internship Jobs Login 05-Dec-2016 to 03-Apr-2017 (PST) Sales & Marketing Minneapolis, MN, USA Internship Email Me This Job Are you driven?  Do you have a competitive fire? Do you believe in working hard and continually doing your best? Are you committed to exceeding customer's expectations?   If you can answer YES to these questions and share our values of customer first, teamwork, intellectual agility, ambition and continuous learning we encourage you to apply!   Fishbowl Solutions' employees say they learn more in one year at Fishbowl then they did during their entire college career!  Fishbowl Solutions delivers end-to-end content management, portal, PDM, PLM and MCAD Solutions. We specialize in delivering solutions based on Oracle WebCenter Content and Portal, PTC Pro/ENGINEER, Pro/INTRALINK and Windchill Solutions, and the Google Search Appliance.   Fishbowl's culture is based on knowledge sharing and continuous improvement, so our solutions are always evolving to be more powerful and our product portfolio is continuously expanding. This means our customers always benefit from what we learn. Our company is founded on the principle of customer first. We don't rest until our customers have the solution that they need. That's just who we are. description: Privacy Policy Job Openings Social Media & Marketing Intern amika Brand ‰ÛÒ Brooklyn, New York amika is a professional line of haircare and tools. The result is a culture of inclusion and positivity, all while delivering puddles of fun and a sunny disposition from looking at our packaging. title: Marketing Intern
description: Send this job to a friend Summer Intern Location: Downers Grove, IL Department: Marketing Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Shift Hours: 9am-5pm Job Details:   The mission of DuPage Medical Group is to enhance the physical well being of the patients we serve by continuing to provide the highest quality medical care available. We are tight-knit physician group that sets the industry standard and keeps ahead of the curve in the ever-changing field of healthcare.   We are looking for a detail oriented, compassionate individual that has exceptional customer service.   SUMMARY:            Think that working in the healthcare field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. This 8-10 week Summer Internship Program will allow students to apply their classroom knowledge in the world of health care.      ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Average daily assignments include but aren't limited to: Content creation for internal and external facing communication   Assist with writing and managing monthly consumer eNewsletters for DMG and affiliated brands   Manage collateral development process to completion   Data collection and analysis of e-communication efforts   Assist with event planning & activation (events may be after normal work hours on evenings and/or weekends)   Supporting social media and digital signage   Assist on video and photo shoots   Assist with organizing print and photo library filing system   Other duties as assigned     Requirements: Junior, senior or recent grad in marketing or a related field (e.g., English, Creative Writing, Marketing/Advertising, Communications)   Previous internship or related experience in marketing or communications is a plus   High standard of verbal communication   Should have a passion for writing   Ability to communicate in a professional manner with patients, consumers and community members   Must be computer savvy (working knowledge of Microsoft Office). Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite or video editing a plus.             KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Strong project management and writing skills      Knowledge and experience with multimedia content     Experience with social media and/or collaboration platforms Ability to problem solve, prioritize, organize and multitask     Self-starter, highly motivated and able to work with a minimum of supervision                                  EDUCATION and / or CERTIFICATION/LICENSURE: Bachelor's degree coursework related to requirements described above.      PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS: Sitting for long periods of time, standing, bending, stooping, stretching for files and supplies, occasional lifting of papers, files, etc. of up to 30 pounds.  Requires vision correctable to 20/20 and hearing in the normal range for face-to-face and telephone contacts.  Also requires hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, switchboard, telephone, calculator, photocopier, fax machine, and other related office equipment.  Entails prolonged use of the telephone and computer.  Walking is required throughout the day.     Click Here to Apply Online  Current Employees Click Here to Apply Online    back to top

title: Market Research Intern
description: Market Research Intern - 2017 Location: Cambridge, MA Department: Job Code: 820 # of openings: 1 Description Market Strategies International is a market research consultancy with deep expertise in consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, technology and telecommunications. We blend primary research with data from our syndicated, benchmarking and self-funded studies as well as Big Data to provide clients with the most complete and accurate insights needed to make confident business decisions. Market Strategies‰Ûª research specialties include brand, communications, CX, product development and segmentation. Our syndicated products, known as Cogent Reports, help clients understand the market environment, explore industry trends and monitor their brand and products within the competitive landscape. Founded in 1989, Market Strategies is one of the largest market research firms in the world. We are headquartered in Livonia, MI with regional offices throughout the US. We are currently seeking an Intern for our Cambridge, MA office.  The Market Research Intern will assist our research teams with tasks during phases of the project lifecycle, including survey design, questionnaire development, ensuring data quality, analysis, and report development.    This is a paid, temporary Internship estimated to last a few months, or as long as business needs require.  The Intern will work daily on a full-time (40 hour week) schedule.  Current students will be considered as long as classes are outside of working hours.   Earning credit hours for current educational studies possible: student required to set expectations for what is needed.   Qualifications: Must have 1 year academic and/or practical experience with survey or market research methodologies. Must demonstrate knowledge of basic statistics, research procedures, and survey methodology. Successful completion of coursework in graduate-level statistics and survey methodology helpful. Must have experience working with a data analysis package (SPSS preferred). Moderate to Advanced-level Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills. Must be able to handle multiple project assignments simultaneously. Must have excellent use of time management.  Must show strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Must be self-motivated, and possess a desire to work in market research with data and numbers. Must exhibit high ethical standards. Must have above average communication skills (written and verbal). Able to work effectively within a team-oriented, highly collaborative environment. EEO/AA EMPLOYER M/F/V/D   Previous Applicants: Email: Password:  If you do not remember your password click here. title: Intern, Integrated Marketing
description: Summer Intern, Integrated Marketing New York, NYFull-time Company Description OppenheimerFunds values the talented and diverse workforce we‰Ûªve cultivated over the years. Our nearly 60-year history includes a strong tradition of providing innovative investment ideas and a world-class experience for the individuals, institutions and financial advisors we serve. Our strong foundation is built on collaboration, creativity, and the extraordinary people who play an integral role in our success every day. Job Description The Client Insights team within the OppenheimerFunds Marketing organization plays an integral role providing critical client insights and marketing effectiveness measurement. The intern should expect to receive significant exposure and hands-on, practical experience working with a multi-channel integrated marketing team and brand and advertising team, participating in the development of new research-driven marketing collateral, data gathering and research to inform marketing strategy and data gathering, analysis and presentation of marketing campaign results data. RESPONSIBILITIES & DELIVERABLES This position will help conduct primary research within various client segments, evaluate internal and external data sources to enhance marketing effectiveness measurement, and gather secondary competitor research and marketing insights. The ideal candidate would possess a passion for marketing and research and ability to work on several projects simultaneously. This individual will have a broad exposure in the organization, so s/he must be comfortable working across business areas, both within and outside of the Marketing team. Support Marketing Client Insights team throughout all phases of the research project cycle: project scoping, questionnaire development, survey fielding and data collection, data analysis and reporting Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop actionable research projects that will answer key marketing questions and inform marketing collateral and thought leadership development Develop working relationships with external research partners Catalogue standard industry research tapped for marketing plans on the broad market place or specific areas of interest to the business Help with refinement and automation of marketing and advertising impact reporting Review and consolidation of internal marketing material web properties Help with integrating editorial and channel reporting Help develop research-driven marketing content/copy   Qualifications To be considered for an internship, students must be undergraduates entering their senior year or currently pursuing a graduate level degree.  Education curriculum should include a combination of courses in marketing, statistics, communications, social science, market research Highly proficient with MS Excel and comfortable analyzing various types of data; experience with statistical software (R, SPSS) a big plus Proficiency in other MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, etc.) Basic knowledge of market research methodologies, experience conducting research a plus Ability to turn data-based findings into actionable insights and create a coherent story Detail orientated with excellent oral and written skills Highly motivated and desire to learn about Marketing and Research Professional demeanor and ability to interface effectively with internal and external partners Ability to multi-task and work on several projects at once Curiosity and deep desire to learn Additional Information We are a dynamic firm that values teamwork and collaboration, and true to our history, we encourage independent thinking and provide ample opportunities for our people to stand out and make a difference. With offices in New York, Denver, Rochester and Dallas, we work hard to turn our unconventional wisdom into value for investors and pursue excellent results for ourselves and our firm. Learn more about the culture and opportunities at OppenheimerFunds here: https://careers.oppenheimerfunds.com OppenheimerFunds and its subsidiaries and affiliates provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law in all employment functions including recruitment, evaluation, selection, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, and termination of employment. Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. description: Welcome. You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Job Page Search|Jobs Matching My Profile| Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Marketing Intern-TRO0000R Description Marsh & McLennan Agency serves the group benefit needs of organizations headquartered in Michigan that employ between 100 and 10,000 workers. We provide innovative and individually tailored cost reduction strategies and tactics in all of the functional elements of group benefit plans.   We currently have an opening for an Intern in our Troy, MI office, within our marketing department. Our marketing department is responsible for building and establishing relationships with prospective clients; networking at conferences and events; and brand management.   The successful candidate will work closely with the marketing director and client service leaders on two key initiatives: (1) supporting the accurate and timely distribution of results of our Mid Market Group Benefits Survey; and (2) accessing and leveraging social media networks and other resources to identify and further build opportunities with potential clients, including updating the marketing database.     Qualifications Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Currently enrolled in a college or university. Strong experience with PowerPoint, Excel, and Social Media, particularly LinkedIn. Experience with using a database and/or Salesforce is a plus. Comfortable using the phone and Internet for research purposes. Must be innovative, analytical, detail-oriented, and enjoy working independently as well as a contributing part of a team. Must be able to work efficiently under competing deadlines and handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Marsh & McLennan Agency firmly believes it is the character and commitment of our people that make a difference, and we are always seeking those with ethics, talent, and ambition interested in joining our client-focused teams. If you are a committed professional with a passion for delivering excellent service, we are interested in hearing from you. For more information on our company, please visit our website at http://www.mma-mi.com ‰ÛÒ select Employee Benefits Division.     We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job Internship Primary LocationUS-MI-Troy Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.

title: Brand & Marketing Intern
description: Sign InEnglish Brand & Marketing Intern Richmond, Virginia Apply Apply with LinkedIn POSITION Brand & Marketing Intern LOCATION Richmond, VA COMPANY At Genworth, we believe that aging and the need for care touches everyone. Every day, we come to work with one thing on our minds: how can we help people age on their own terms so they are free to think more about important things, like living life on their terms? The products we offer help provide financing and care solutions to deliver peace of mind to our policyholders, caregivers and their families. POSITION SUMMARY Genworth is seeking a Brand & Marketing Intern to help with a number of different initiatives and bring in outside perspective and ideas. Job will provide intern the opportunity to work as a part of a cross functional team on projects and participate in on-the-job training, access to mentors, planned social events and other educational opportunities. RESPONSIBILITIES  Project Management New visual identity development and launch/new logo development and launch Marketing portion of the ‰ÛÏmural‰Û community project to include: budget and timeline, survey, skills based volunteering, working with photography and videography intern to organize and coordinating photo shoots and capture video content Marketing calendar management, including, but not limited to the aging experience, working with external suppliers, developing tour schedule, materials needed, media plan, partner needs, etc. Planning and implementation Develop plan to launch and sustain new company purpose to employees, including tactics, timing, budget, metrics for success, etc. Data and analytics Work with digital strategy leader to develop approach for our Cost of Care for Fall of 2017 Strategy development Work with external supplier develop a content strategy ‰ÛÒ what to use, where/how to distribute that tells the story of our purpose to consumers Campaign strategy and management Collaborate with brand marketing managers and email marketing team to develop an overarching approach for email communications to our existing distribution partners; manage campaigns from content development through implementation and measurement REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor or Masters degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Journalism or relevant field Excellent attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent English written and verbal skills, eloquent and well-spoken Positive attitude and the ability to prioritize tasks and manage deadlines Proactive, goal-oriented approach to work Apply Apply with LinkedIn Posted 30+ Days Ago Full time REQ - 170068 About Us Genworth is a Fortune 500 financial services company providing financial security and protection through our Mortgage Insurance and Long Term Care businesses. At Genworth, our promise to our employees is the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of our customers, our communities, and one another.
