title: Marketing Intern
description: Cemstone Cemstone Marketing Summer Internship  Mendota Heights, MN   55120              About Us Founded by the Becken family in 1927, Cemstone offers truly integrated and sustainable concrete solutions for its customers in the Upper Midwest and across the country. When you work at Cemstone, you experience more than just a job. You earn a rewarding career, one that delivers an incredible opportunity to build a better future for yourself, strengthens us to become a better company, and fulfills your desire for challenge and growth. Job Summary Marketing Intern for Cemstone Products Company, Cemstone Ready Mix Inc, Cemstone Concrete Materials, Cemstone Supply, Dakota Aggregates and East Range Ready Mix, LLC.  Must have the ability to function in fast-paced team environment with sales representatives and managers to meet and exceed assigned goals for overall customer experience and company reputation. Professionally and effectively communicates by phone, prepares quotations and pricing documents, and performs other administration as follows: Assist in the creation and maintenance of marketing tools (i.e. signage, circulars, mock ups, e-mail campaigns, on line promotion, video etc.). Assist in the distribution or delivery of marketing materials. Assist with fulfillment of marketing projects (i.e. project profiles, website). Assist with execution of social media. Assist with the preparation and delivery of training materials. Assist with the organization and presentation of retail stores. Update web data content of online store. Prepare presentations. Keep accurate and timely records and files; maintain tracking report of public relations activity. Perform all tasks with meticulous attention to detail, proper formatting, and correct grammar. Perform all other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications High School degree or equivalent required; business school or college experience preferred. Knowledge of the concrete industry desired. Must have 1 to 2 years of experience in photography. Photo cataloguing experience preferred. Ability to read and interpret documents and manuals; Ability to write various reports and correspondences; Ability to speak effectively to customers and/or employees of the organization; Excellent spelling, grammar and phone skills. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.  Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, multi-task and carefully proof their own work. Must be proficient in Adobe Suite, Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, basic Internet skills (including social media), etc. Must have the ability to learn and use new software systems quickly. ACI Certifications preferred. Terms and Conditions Internship duration: 3 months (June ‰ÛÒ August), full time employment; a reasonable compensation package will be provided. At the end of the internship term, prepare and present a fifteen-minute presentation to share the details of the internship experience. Closing If you are interested in becoming part of our team, please apply online today. We are committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities to all employees and applicants. title: Marketing Intern
description: Welcome. You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Internship - Marketing-24972 Description  Join National Heritage Academies (NHA) as a marketing intern for a summer opportunity. The available position will report directly to the marketing manager and will be responsible for speaking with potential parents and helping them to apply their child to our K-8th grade NHA schools as well as our 9th-12th grade PrepNet Schools. While working with the digital marketing team, there will also be opportunities to learn more about different markets and how to taylor your approach to each market we serve.   About Us NHA is a charter school management company that operates 80+ schools in 9 states. We are committed to our mission of ‰ÛÏchallenging each child to achieve‰Û_‰Û and we pride ourselves on our students‰Ûª ability to achieve high results in later education based on the foundations gained in grades K-8 at NHA.  In this role you will work out of our corporate headquarters (Service Center) located in Grand Rapids, Michigan. The NHA Service Center is where all the behind-the-scenes magic happens. Our 350 brilliant team members are brag-worthy. With a diverse group of departments like admissions, talent acquisition, facilities, legal services, and many more working together to provide top level back-office support. The Service Center is a place of bright colors, smiling faces, and opportunity. We like to gather for events such as the fall crocktoberfest cook-off, the sparkling Christmas party full of fun and unexplainable excitement, and our annual 5K Service Center fun run.  In This Role You will make an impact Gain valuable hands on experience Be paid  Your Role Making calls to families on waiting list; making attempts to get them to apply to another nearby options Working on projects that help the MA Team more effective. Examples of projects we will work on are: Data management: figuring out best time to call, conversion tracking, new process effectiveness. Also,Before/After Care PDF Project: Creating an information sheet to add to school websites to provide families with information on offerings Tour Scheduling: Scheduling applied families for tours with Admissions Representatives Screening/Appointment Setting for MA‰Ûªs: checking for interest before MA‰Ûªs call to do application    Requirements Enrolled in a Marketing/Communications degree program Experience with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Microsoft Dynamics preferred Ability to multitask and absorb information quickly Familiar with social media strategies and platforms Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to adapt and talk to people from different backgrounds/segments   To learn more about our core values, please click here.  National Heritage Academies is an equal opportunity employer. title: Marketing Intern
description: All jobs ‰ Õ Marketing Intern Marketing Intern New York, United States åá Intern DESCRIPTION Join Sweeten, a fast growing, award-winning tech company based in New York City. We're a team of super smart, driven and fun people who are fascinated by construction, design, and tech. We're building the go-to marketplace for home renovation by changing the way homeowners and general contractors find and work with each other. Sweeten interns have all-access passes to all elements of our business ‰ÛÒ you‰Ûªll sit in meetings with our CEO and COO and you‰Ûªll get to see what goes into growing a tech company. We‰Ûªll want to know what you love doing and what you want to learn, and you‰Ûªll be in an environment that allows you to explore both. We‰Ûªve had an awesome group of interns who have rolled up their sleeves to jump in on special projects including making sure that information on our website is easily available, evaluating industry data to understand home renovation trends and user experience, working on social media campaigns and community outreach, planning team events and pitching in with day to day office management needs, providing on-demand beatboxing (or other semi-relevant talents) for team-wide entertainment, and being all-around good-natured champions of our team and our mission.  RESPONSIBILITIES As our Marketing Intern, you‰Ûªll be helping out across the company to enhance our presence across all channels -- our blog, our social media platforms, and in person. In this role, you may: Contribute to new content development: Coordinate photo shoot scheduling with clients and photographers. Coordinate "during" photo shoots and visit work sites to take "during" photos. Evaluate historical Sweeten blog content to ensure updated references to general contractors, branding consistency, title search optimization, and photo quality. Track and report on content performance: Track newsletter open and click rates and provide analysis on performance. Track blog sessions, time on page, registrations, etc. and provide analysis on performance. Track press mentions and other big marketing initiatives. Build our brand reach: research and compile a shortlist of manufacturers featured on a regular basis, including their social media following, to recommend strategic partners. Help our contractors represent their work: update general contractor profiles by standardizing to help best convey our experts' skills, and optimizing for search. Create custom profiles for a segment of new experts to represent specialized skills. Research trending neighborhoods in new markets and narrow down sites and publications for us to consider for press and advertising. Pull together a potential advertising vehicles based on a list of target neighborhoods. Support contractor recruitment efforts. Support daily social media production. Support team and office needs related to reception, phone coverage, email inquiries, and team event planning. REQUIREMENTS available to join the team in two weeks college student or recent college graduate from any area of study highly organized and focused on details relentlessly driven with a collaborative spirit thoughtful about learning and building skills in a creative, professional environment able to work efficiently and intensely in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment BONUS POINTS IF YOU have a demonstrated passion for real estate, design, interiors, and/or renovation have experience using Wordpress, Adobe Creative Suite, any video editing programs, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, SproutSocial, and/or Google Apps can use a camera or take good (enough) photos on a mobile phone for publication BENEFITS We offer exciting growth opportunities, competitive pay, weekly team lunches and a team of smart and supportive people. Sweeten deeply values diversity and individuality, and is committed to creating a work environment where creativity, ideas, interests, and varied perspectives are clearly valued and central to the success of our team. If you have any interesting side projects or experiences beyond what might be evident in your resume, we‰Ûªd love to hear about them. If you're interested in joining our team, hit the "apply for this job" button below and fill out the brief form. Be sure to let us know why this opportunity sounds like a good fit. Apply for this job Sweeten website Powered by Workable

title: Business Marketing Intern
description: Business Marketing Associate - Paid Internship Marketing Development | West Los Angeles | Part Time, Contract, Temp to Perm, Internship, and Volunteer JOB DESCRIPTION FlitWays is a Los Angeles technology based startup company; it offers a functioning state of the art Booking System (via online and mobile application). The company is currently looking for a new dynamic addition to its Business and Marketing department. Responsibilities: Promote FlitWays service to new and existing users through online marketing  Identify new markets, and assess opportunities for FlitWays expansion into new markets Coordinate FlitWays Digital marketing campaigns Acquire and build new partners, providers and affiliates from ground up Work directly with marketing and business team to convert campaigns and leads to sales Strategically and professionally represent our brand and its offerings Ideal Candidate Has: Current Marketing Student or Bachelor's Degree graduate with Bachelor degree in Marketing Strong organizational skills  Strong analytically/business analysis skills, including an understanding of business economics and financial resources Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and highly organized Ability to partner with key staff members to create strategic consumer marketing plans. Ability to prioritize activities appropriately and determine which activities to act on first Excellent leadership and communication skills (both verbal and written) Excellent organizational skills and ability to multi-task Ability to successfully perform in a matrix organization Strong sense of urgency and very adaptable to change Additional Information: We are looking for someone who can start immediately and can work at least 20 hours a week, preferably 4 or more hours/day Mon-Fri. The internship is a paid. Lots of experience and exposure to the business world will be earned. You may be compensated opportunity for paid position after internship program. To Apply: Click on the link below, fill out the online application and upload your resume or send us an email with your resume with Subject line "Business  Marketing - Paid Internship" to be considered. https://careers.jobscore.com/careers/flitways/jobs/business-marketing-associate-paid-internship-aWY7FG_I8r5Rx3eMg-44q7   RETURN TO FLITWAYS APPLY FOR THIS JOB APPLY FOR THIS JOB SHARE NOT THE RIGHT JOB? title: Marketing Intern
description: General Internship Application OpEx Multiple, United States Apply Description Position at W2O Group W2O Group seeks motivated, ambitious and strategic-minded students and recent graduates to work with our teams in our stimulating and fast-paced office to help us shape and define the future of integrated communications.  Interns will have an opportunity to work with our teams to develop the strategic and creative thinking and project management/client service skills necessary to excel in an agency environment. Interns will work closely with seasoned professionals and actively participate in projects and receive exposure to all facets of the business.    An Intern at W2O Group will work closely with various teams on research projects, applications and various other projects from inception to completion.  The ideal candidate must have a passion for learning, a ‰ÛÏcan do‰Û attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset.   Essential Functions:    The internship may include, but is not limited to the following:  Provide support in documenting and creating processes to improve internal efficiency Research, write and prepare communications for account teams Support account teams with event coordination and client meeting preparation Analyze various types of data and develop insights Assist community managers on various social media platforms Create and maintain information resources for account teams (media lists, databases, intranet, etc.) Participate and contribute in planning meetings and team activities  Qualifications: 3rd or 4th year college student or recent college graduate Strong written, verbal, and strong interpersonal skills (writing samples may be requested) Leadership potential as demonstrated by on-campus or extracurricular activities Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Highly organized and mindful of deadlines, solution-oriented Able to balance multiple projects and the demands of a fast-paced work environment Thorough understanding and working knowledge of social media platforms, such as Facebook, YouTube, StumbleUpon, Flickr, Forums, Twitter, Wikis, blogs, etc.  Preferred Qualifications: 3.0 GPA or above in a related major (i.e. in public relations, communications, integrated marketing communications, or related field) Proven ability to function with minimal supervision Effective presentation and project management skills Agency internship experience preferred Experience with NetSuite is a plus Passion for integrated communications  Multiple Locations:  Austin, TX, Minneapolis, MN, New York, NY, San Francisco, CA Semesters: Spring, Summer, Fall Scheduled Hours: Full-time or part-time (varies by semester) Work Days:  Monday ‰ÛÒ Friday Work Hours:  9:00am ‰ÛÒ 6:00pm Duration:  8 ‰ÛÒ 12 weeks  Application Procedure: Apply through Jobvite Upload Cover Letter that includes links to supporting documents (writing samples, portfolio) Current Resume with contact information Selected candidates will be contacted for a phone interview in the semester prior to the start of the internship (i.e. candidates applying for summer internships will be contacted in the spring semester) Apply Apply Later ‰  Back to Current Openings Share LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Email Powered by Jobvite

title: Marketing Intern
description: Home Sponsoring Companies Student College Network Employer login All Jobs ITA Member Companies > United States > Oakbrook Terrace, IL > Marketing > Market Research Analysts and Marketing Specialists ALLIGATORTEK - MARKETING INTERN AT ITA MEMBER COMPANIES Date Posted: 2/16/2017 APPLY Not ready to Apply? JOB DESCRIPTION Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career! alligatortek is the leader in developing software applications to fuel growth. Over the last 20 years, we have helped our clients to gain market share and expand their businesses by developing desktop applications and building web browser-based solutions.   We are a fun-loving and entrepreneurial organization with a strong vision for the future. Our proud, passionate employees are committed to doing great things for clients. These clients rely on us to innovate solutions that enable them to better connect with their customers. Our employees are empowered to make a difference. They are well supported in their efforts to continually improve both themselves and our company. We recognize and reward top performance, and provide opportunities for growth in a fun and energetic work environment.   We are currently looking for a Marketing Intern that enjoys variety and challenging work in a dynamic environment. We‰Ûªre looking for someone who is driven, self-sufficient, and can ultimately increase sales activity. This is a hands-on role and opportunity to work with a growing and cutting-edge company.   This is a paid internship.  **Due to the high amount of applications received, only highly qualified applicants will be contacted.**     Responsibilities * Identifying trends in the technology sphere, and aligning them to our business  * Performing analysis of marketing and sales data  * Seeking and analyzing competitor marketing and sales materials both on and offline  * Providing support to social media/blog efforts  * Engaging with marketing team on a regular basis to brainstorm ideas for new and innovative campaigns  * Researching industry-specific sites (blogs, forums, etc) for product reviews, customer comments, and other relevant marketing information.  JOB REQUIREMENTS * Digital Native ‰ÛÒ o An active user in the following social media outlets: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and various blog sites  o Comfortable speaking the language in these outlets  * Analytical ‰ÛÒ  o Able to track the results of your efforts using metrics  o Interested in judging and improving upon the success of your efforts  * Reach ‰ÛÒ  o Able to draw people into a conversation  o Leave a memorable impression upon those you meet  * Content ‰ÛÒ  o Able to create remarkable content (blogs, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.) naturally  * Previous SEO knowledge  * Knowledge of software and consultative selling is helpful but not required.  * Active pursuit of a degree related to marketing and/or communications * Able to come into the office routinely during normal working business hours     Skills Preferred - Editing, Analytic Reporting, Copywriting, Copy Editing  APPLY Not ready to Apply? title: Golf Marketing Internship
description: 2017 Summer Golf Marketing Internship (Unpaid) | City and County of Denver Jobs page has loaded. Menu JOB OPPORTUNITIES Sign In City and County of Denver Jobs powered by NEOGOV å¨ 2017 Summer Golf Marketing Internship (Unpaid) APPLY Salary $0.00 Hourly Location Denver, CO Job Type Intern Department Parks and Recreation (DPR) Job Number TA0000 15501 Closing 3/19/2017 11:59 PM Mountain DESCRIPTION BENEFITS QUESTIONS About Us The secret is out: Denver is the nation's top place to live, work, and play. Being the best place to live isn't easy; maintaining such a reputation means we need the best people working for the residents of Denver. People who want to make a difference; people who want to give back; people who want to be at the heart of this city and have a hand in creating our future. When you join us, you will employ your unique skills to do important and meaningful work critical to the success of both your organization and the city as a whole. Be a part of the city that you love. Where Denver Works.  About Denver Golf: Denver Golf has eight convenient locations. Denver Golf has the largest municipal golf system in the Denver metro area: Four 18 hole regulation courses, one 27 hole regulation course, one 18 hole executive mountain course, two Par 3 courses, two miniature golf courses, six driving ranges including our signature water driving range, multiple practice facilities and more. Plus, we have the 2nd largest First Tee Junior Program in the country with The First Tee of Denver. About Our Job The City and County of Denver's Department of Recreation is seeking a Summer Golf Marketing Intern to join our team to gain experience working on special projects involving marketing, advertising, and events within our Golf division. This summer internship is unpaid and we are looking for a 25-35 hour/week commitment with some evening and weekend hours. The start date is flexible from April to June 2017.  As an intern, you will be responsible for: Tournament Program - Assisting with the tournament program by following up with new tournament inquiries Assisting on site with Denver Golf events: Denver City Amateur, Golf Socials, Ladies Golf  Working some nights and weekends facilitating events  About You In order to apply, please be sure you: Are currently enrolled in a college/university pursuing a degree in marketing/Advertising, Journalism, Golf, Communications or directly related field of study Have a valid driver's license, as this position requires driving Our ideal candidate will have: An interest or knowledge of golf An interest in sports marketing Completion of 60 credits of college/university coursework About Everything Else  Classification Title: Internships at City & County of Denver  Working Title:  Summer Golf Marketing Intern Agency:  Department of Parks and Recreation Recruiter: JC Pre-employment Screening: An offer of employment is contingent on the verification of credentials and other information required by law and City and County of Denver policies, including the successful completion of a background check. Candidates must pass a criminal background check and other verifications required for the position which may include, but are not limited to, employment and/or education verification, motor vehicle record check, drug test, and/or physical. The existence of a conviction does not automatically disqualify an individual from employment except where federal or state law or regulations prohibit employment of an individual with certain convictions. For more information about the selection and employment screening process, click here.  The City and County of Denver provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, age, or any other status protected under federal, state, and/or local law.   Agency City and County of Denver Address 201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 412 Wellington E. Webb Municipal Office Building Denver, Colorado, 80202. description: Have you visited us before? Position Summary: Under moderate supervision you will collaborate with our Director of Marketing and external marketing and advertising team in all stages of marketing campaigns. Your insightful contribution will help develop, expand and maintain our marketing channels. Essential Functions of the Job: Assist with streamlining company social media accounts (e.g.. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Flicker and other social media platforms), ensuring uniform content and tone of voice for landing pages, graphics and other elements within the communities. Increase Henke's social media presence through daily engagement of all social media accounts by posting daily and replying to posts Assist to create one piece of video content per month and post on YouTube. Upload and manage company blog posts in WordPress (initially under direct supervision). Track and report website statistics using Google Analytics. Look at how well specific content performs and look at the flow of traffic through our web site. Designing flyers, graphics, e-vites and other marketing material for major events hosted by Henke. Database management in Salesforce (adding, editing accounts, contracts, product descriptions, etc.). Perform market analysis and research on competition to include organizing competitive pricing information, product comparison, etc. Update the company website when needed. Help organize marketing events. Perform daily administrative tasks for the marketing department. May be assigned additional responsibilities as necessary. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:   Excellent knowledge with computer programs including Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word with the ability to learn internal database programs. Familiarity with marketing computer software and online applications (e.g.. online analytics and Google Adwords). Solid understanding of different marketing techniques. Passion for the marketing industry and its best practices. Able to think critically and identify solutions to problems. Able to plan, prioritize and organize. Excellent ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written. Good research and problem-solving skills. Familiarity with key social media tools (e.g.. Twitter and Facebook). An entrepreneurial attitude. A proactive, service-focused attitude towards clients and candidates and the teams you support internally.  Education and Experience: Minimum of one year (or 24 credit hours) of college courses required.  Coursework in marketing, advertising, branding or public relations preferred. Previous internship or related experience in marketing or communications preferred. Salesforce experience preferred. Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This position will generally work in an indoor office environment with frequent sitting for extended periods of time. Occasionally they may be exposed to a manufacturing environment including noise and outdoor environment. This position is sedentary which includes exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Use of vision, hearing, keyboarding, and verbal communication is required. "We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. title: Intern, Business to Business Sales
description: Careers Home Search Jobs WHY CHOOSE COMCAST JOB OPPORTUNITIES CAMPUS PROGRAMS MILITARY AND VETERANS EVENTS LOCATIONS FAQs  Intern, Business to Business Sales Job ID: 153432 Livermore, CA Administrative Services Job Description Business Unit: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.      Job Summary:  There are many opportunities to learn and thrive at Comcast. A 10 week, fulltime internship with Comcast gives you meaningful work experience, programs for development and networking, competitive compensation and the opportunity to move into a fulltime career post-graduation. You will ..  - Gain knowledge and experience in B2B Sales  - Gain the opportunity to make an impact on Comcast's business and results  - Participate in developmental activities  - Network with leaders across multiple functions  - Receive a hands on experience and see the frontline aspects that make cable possible  Primary Responsibilities:  - Actively participates in development, thrives as a dynamic, proactive, and continuous learner  - Helps to improve Comcast's results through a project or series of work in B2B Sales  - Learns to identify leads, prospect and cold call  - Learns to develop proposals, enter data into databases and close a sale while delivering on our customer promise  - Shadows Business Account Executives  - Works on a local marketing event/project  Core Responsibilities:  - Opens, sorts, and distributes mail.  - Processes routine items and records.  - Answers phones and takes messages or provides information.  - Operates various office equipment.  - Assists with projects to ensure deadlines are met.  - Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.  - Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. title: Marketing Product Intern
description: Skip to main content Custom Windows, Doors and Enclosure Systems Get Your Windows TODAY Find a Dealer Main menu WindowsDoorsEze-Breezeå¨Design StudioPhoto Gallery About Us Company Profile Management Community Newsroom Media Kit Careers Core Values Value Proposition Current Job Openings >> Marketing Product Intern Marketing Product Intern Summary Title: Marketing Product Intern ID: 1309 Department: Marketing Shift: 1st Shift Description PGT is excited about the upcoming 2017 Summer Internship Program. Days and hours are flexible. If you are interested in this position please complete the internship application and be sure to attach your resume.   Description:   PGT Industries, Inc. is looking for a qualified intern to join our Product Marketing Department. The Product Marketing Department manages the product portfolio in order to provide our dealers and their customers quality windows and doors that meet their needs. PGTå¨ is the nation's leading manufacturer and supplier of residential impact-resistant windows and doors, and aspires to develop innovative flexible solutions for all single family, commercial, and multi-family buildings. With a philosophy based on strength and functionality without compromise on aesthetics, we are successful because of our devoted employees.  This intern should be prepared to work in a fast-paced team environment, and will finish the internship having gained broad experience in various aspects of marketing, with a strong focus on Product Technical and Market Demand.   Students will have professional supervision and mentorship throughout the program. PGT will provide the student with a combination of hands on projects or tasks that relate directly to their field of study. PGT leadership will complete a performance evaluation at the end of the semester and will work with the school to make sure all internship or co-op requirements are met.   Responsibilities: Help manage the product line from strategic planning to tactical activities. Learn and help specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research. Assist in driving a solution set across development teams (primarily Product Management/Engineering, and Marketing Communications) through market requirements, product specifications and positioning. Learn about and assist with developing and implementing a go-to-market plan, working with all necessary departments to execute. Education, Experience & Skills Required: PGT Industries, Inc. is looking for an undergraduate who is majoring in a Marketing related degree (preferably with a concentration in Product Technical or Market Demand). This person should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with technical knowledge of product life cycles. PowerPoint, Word and Excel experience is a bonus, and will be considered when choosing the best applicant for this internship position. Students MUST be declared in their degree. Preferred to have 45-60 Credit hours (Junior or Senior). Must meet minimum GPA standards. Student should include any letters of recommendation with their application and resume. Student will be required to bring a copy of transcripts, if offered internship. description: VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS Events/ Marketing Intern Los Angeles, CA Internship Student (College) Collab, Inc (collabcreators.com) is a Downtown LA based digital talent agency and entertainment studio and the leading independent network for multi-platform talent. Collab was started by veteran video creators to help make the lives of independent creators easier and to provide everything they need to succeed creatively and financially.  We specialize in working with mobile video creators and helping them build their audience and earnings across multiple platforms (YouTube, musical.ly, Instagram, Snapchat, Facebook, etc). Our network includes over 400 top social media creators with over 700 Million Followers.  We are also a digital studio that produces original shows for TV and digital platforms. Who we are looking for: Collab is currently seeking candidates to join our fast-growing company for a full or part time internship position. This person will be an integral part of the team and will assist in planning live events, including sponsorship activation, presence at digital conventions, presence at industry conferences, VIP events, and PR events. title: Marketing Intern
description: En EspaÌ±ol Payment Locations Help Sign in Marketing Intern We are searching for a creative thinker with an analytical, ‰ÛÏget it done‰Û attitude to join our fast-paced B2B marketing team as B2B Marketing Intern. In this role, you will manage projects from concept to execution and coordinate administrative functions in the planning and execution of marketing strategies. As a marketing intern, your work will touch upon a variety of functions, from market research and creative planning, to advertising and event promotions across multiple channels. Through the duration of your internship, you will be exposed to current marketing trends and tactics in the fintech industry. You will have the opportunity to see your results in action through our various marketing campaigns. Job Description: ‰Û¢ Perform market analysis and competitive research ‰Û¢ Assist in developing and executing marketing campaigns (e.g. social media, digital ads, email, web) ‰Û¢ Manage the organization and execution of marketing events and tradeshows under direction ‰Û¢ Conduct research on buyer personas and customer journey ‰Û¢ Support the marketing team in daily administrative tasks ‰Û¢ Manage and update company database and customer relationship management systems (CRM) Requirements: ‰Û¢ Current enrollment in college, preferably a rising Junior or Senior ‰Û¢ Proactive thinker, passion for marketing and strong desire to learn ‰Û¢ Good understanding of different marketing techniques ‰Û¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‰Û¢ Excellent knowledge of MS Office ‰Û¢ Familiarity with marketing computer software and online applications (e.g. CRM tools, Online analytics) ‰Û¢ Passion for the B2B marketing industry and its best practices ‰Û¢ Proficiency and interest in social media content generation: Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook Perks and Incentives: ‰Û¢ Competitive salary ‰Û¢ Catered lunches and fully stocked kitchen ‰Û¢ Flexible work schedule (work from home on specific days of the week) ‰Û¢ Fun, collaborative, vibrant culture ‰Û¢ Frequent interaction with our executive team ‰Û¢ Ping pong challenges & Basketball Wednesdays More about the Company: www.paynearme.com We‰Ûªre Thinkers, Makers and Imagineers And we are reimagining how cash is used in the digital economy and making people‰Ûªs lives simpler in the process. Join us as we‰Ûªre building an exciting company and delivering services that impact people‰Ûªs lives. The PayNearMe family is led by a team of experts from the payments, mobile and retail IT worlds. We exist to build affordably-priced, innovative products that make it easier for consumers to conduct financial transactions and for businesses to serve those consumers. PayNearMe began in 2009 with the goal of giving cash users the same convenience that debit and credit card users enjoy when paying bills and making online purchases. Today, we offer a network of 30,000 retail locations such as 7-Eleven and Family Dollar, where consumers can make cash payments for everything from utilities and child support payments to bike share membership. If this position fits your skills and background, send your resume to jobs@paynearme.com and let us know why you can make a difference. title: Sales & Marketing Intern
description: Mattel About Us Investors Newsroom Careers Contact Us Customer Service Shop Careers Home Jobs Locations Rewards Culture Diversity Brands Internships Jobs   ? Home Search openings Search results Current page Job details     Job details in Share Job 1 of 1 Apply to job   Save to cart       Posting Title Sales and Marketing Coordinator Intern Requisition Number 160233 Location Denmark Zip Code 2650 Job Category Sales Company At Mattel, our vision is "Creating the Future of Play". We strive to achieve this vision primarily through our creative and enthusiastic employees who DARE to be innovative, and THRIVE in a friendly and fast-paced environment. Mattel is committed to developing employees and supporting their career goals, helping them GROW with a host of meaningful experiences and learning opportunities. And by promoting a culture of BALANCE that emphasizes working passionately and taking time to play often, we are proud of how our employees LEAD by example in all that they do! Job Description We Offer: An exciting and engaging 6 month summer unpaid Internship starting in March 2017 that offers a real professional experience and the opportunity to develop your skills outside of University A full time position, working 37 hours a week enabling you to expand your knowledge of Sales and Marketing in a global business Competitive vacation allowance, including Public Holidays and ‰ÛÏMattel‰Û days An opportunity to experience a professional working environment within one of the world‰Ûªs leaders in Toy Manufacturing. Background:   As an intern at one of the world‰Ûªs leading toy companies you will have the unique opportunity to help develop the future of play for children around the world. Working within the Sales and Marketing departments you will experience a fast pace of work which will give you invaluable experience for your Industrial Placement Year. You will also have the opportunity to communicate and work alongside a variety of departments and key contacts and get involved in some exciting projects, expanding and enhancing your knowledge of Sales and Marketing in a renowned business.  We are looking for candidates who are up for a challenge in this fast moving industry, people who thrive upon opportunity and are motivated to make things happen. This is a great placement for developing and putting into practice the business skills and the theory that you have learnt at university, as well as developing new skills in the process.  Job Purpose:  To provide dedicated and effective administrative and organisational support to the Nordics Sales Team.   Main Areas of Responsibility: Evaluate competitors and the retail landscape and distribution of key weekly reports Manage the ordering and delivery of sales samples ‰ÛÒ working with both internal and external stakeholders Upkeep of key channel support tool and responsibility for internal and external image and copy requests Manage the organisation and delivery of our B2B retail events Involved in logistic POS and Master Data process Gather data and map retailers promotional calendars on the different channels Monitor and share key highlights of Toy News in the European market Responsible for supplier management, invoice processing and payment monitoring Ad hoc Sales specific project work Key Relationships:   Internal Working Relationships: Main focus will be with Nordics Sales Team Interaction with Marketing department within the UK Contact with Customer Service and Planning departments Liasing with Finance and Accounting administration External Working Relationships: Support relationship management and key needs of Nordic direct customers and wholesalers Experience, Education & Skills Competencies:   Technical: Microsoft Office: Advanced Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint skills Strong analytical skills and methodical approach to interpreting data Exceptional organisational and communication skills Excellent telephone manner and typing skills Behavioural: Highly motivated, proactive, determined, dedicated, enthusiastic Creative problem solver and solution-driven Listens and asks questions to ensure understanding An interest in product design, innovation, fashion and an awareness of consumer and retail market trends Excellent organisational, time management & project management skills with ability to multi task and meet deadlines Ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders both internally and externally Must be a team player Self-sufficient and able to work under pressure Good interpersonal skills with high level of professionalism. This should include strong communication skills, articulate, flexibility, patience, with an honest and ethical approach Ability to build strong relationships and key contacts Wants to learn and demonstrates flexibility in response to change Requirements: Currently studying a relevant degree (For example, Sales, Business or Marketing) at University with a strong GPA Fluent in English alongside basic native Scandinavian language Resides within commutable distance to the Mattel Denmark office In possession of EU Citizenship Ideally have experience of working in a Sales or Marketing environment    About Us ABOUT US Mattel, Inc. (Nasdaq: MAT) is the worldwide leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of toys and family products. The Mattel family is comprised of such best-selling brands as Barbieå¨, the most popular fashion doll ever produced, Hot Wheelså¨, Monster Highå¨, American Girlå¨, Thomas & Friendså¨ and Fisher-Priceå¨ brands, including Little Peopleå¨ and Power Wheelså¨, as well as a wide array of entertainment-inspired toy lines. In 2013, Mattel was named as one of the "World's Most Ethical Companies" by Ethisphere Magazine. Mattel also is ranked No. 2 on Corporate Responsibility Magazine's "100 Best Corporate Citizens" list. With worldwide headquarters in El Segundo, Calif., Mattel employs nearly 40,000 people in 40 countries and territories and sells products in more than 150 nations. At Mattel, we are Creating the Future of Play! Visit us at www.mattel.com/careers, www.facebook.com/mattel or www.twitter.com/mattel Apply to job   Save to cart       About Us Investors Newsroom Careers Contact Us Customer Service Recall Information Toy Store Locations Shop Use of this site signifies your acceptance of Mattel‰Ûªs Website Terms and Conditions and Privacy Statement and Other Legal Information. description: Home Products How To Media About DAP Careers Careers JOB OPENINGS BENEFITS LOCATIONS    MENU      APPLY Job Title Digital & Social Media Intern Date Posted 2/17/2017 Location Baltimore, MD Position Id EB-1831851752 Job Description We're looking for a student who'll work part-time as a Digital & Social Media Intern, with a love of DIY and Home Improvements a plus. The ideal candidate is familiar with web content management, digital communications, and marketing. Our department is fast paced and a can-do attitude is essential. The internship is a great opportunity to gain real world professional web project, content management, and social media content creation and coordination experience. The Digital & Social Media intern will discover the ins and outs of marketing while assisting with projects such as the optimization and content management of our website, social media campaigns, influencer marketing, and much more. Responsibilities may include: Assisting with content management (uploading content in to content management system, ensuring content meets brand standards) Creation of original social media content (blog posts, Facebook posts, etc.) as necessary and maintenance of digital content editorial calendar Optimization of brand website (writing SEO optimized copy including keywords, product descriptions and website copy as needed) Conducting competitive keyword research Regularly producing analytics reports tracking progress towards internal goals Scheduling and coordination of social media content + partner blog posts Prior experience with social media/analytics is a must, as are strong writing skills and attention to detail Strategize new ways to reach core markets, staying up to date with emerging trends and styles across social platforms Supporting key retailers and our product content on their sites Assisting with creation of a new outreach/employee advocacy program‰ÛÓto include a Style Guide for advocates‰ÛÓthat we‰Ûªll be developing this summer Contribute both individually and as a team member in meetings and brainstorming sessions Update project plans, coordinate schedules and assist with project related tasks as needed Desired Skills & Qualifications (needed to perform the work): This position requires outstanding communication and computer skills as well as an in-depth understanding of the internet. Candidate must be self-motivated, mature, decisive, and possess an exceptionally strong attention to detail. The ability to communicate persuasively and with personality in writing is vital. The candidate must be highly proficient with social media, including: Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Tumblr, etc. Proficiency with scheduling tools like Sprout Social is ideal. title: e-Commerce / Marketing Internship
description: At thyssenkrupp we have more than 155,000 employees in nearly 80 countries and annual sales of ‰âÂ43 billion. We are active in automotive engineering, logistics, plant technology, steel production, elevator manufacturing and much more. We work in large and small businesses all around the world ‰ÛÒ but we always work together. We have over 200 years of experience in industry and the latest cutting-edge technology. We have a position that‰Û÷s right for you, that piques your interest, and that puts your skills to the test. e-Commerce / Marketing Internship Copper Brass Sales NA, Location Southfield, {region10537} Materials Services - With 480 branches in 40 countries the Business Area Materials Services concentrates on the worldwide trade of raw material and construction material. Coal, metals, gases, plastics in all shapes, qualities and dimensions as well as complex supply-chain solutions- this is for what this Business Area stands for. Copper and Brass Sales is a distributor and processor of aluminum, stainless steel, copper, brass, bronze and more quality materials serving markets across North America, including Canada and Mexico. By providing customers what they want, when they need it, Copper and Brass Sales is able to help them succeed in today‰Ûªs challenging global business environment. The company‰Ûªs focus on the Aerospace, Automotive, Electrical, Medical and Oil & Gas Industries allows them to offer these market segments expertise specific to their needs. The daily commitment of its employees to provide premium service focused on the customer first has earned Copper and Brass Sales the position of a respected leader in the nonferrous metals industry for over 80 years. Your responsibilities Summary of Position: The e-Commerce / Marketing Intern will be creating a variety of product related content for the CBS website assisting thyssenkrupp Materials NA- Copper & Brass Sales Div. with a variety of e-Commerce, Marketing, Communications, and Business Development activities.  The Intern will be responsible for supporting the day-to-day activities of the e-Commerce team while learning valuable skills related to marketing in the manufacturing industry. The Internship work hours are up to 40 hours per week. The internship will last 4 to 5 months, with opportunities beginning April 2017. The intern will report to the e- Commerce / Marketing manager. The e-Commerce Team Member will be exposed to: Interaction with the e-commerce team, IT, and other functional business units as needed. Use of Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, Hybris Content Management System, Hybris Commerce Software, Hootsuite, Google Analytics, Email marketing tools Opportunities to be creative, grow professionally and learn outside the classroom Key Accountabilities: Write, edit and publish copy related to products and other marketing campaigns using search engine optimation strategies Design creative marketing graphics and copy for website and email marketing campaigns Create, execute, and monitor social media Use analytics tools and plan strategies to increase conversion rates Knowledge of photo files and extensions Attend meetings with team members to learn and understand the business & projects Take on additional duties and responsibilities, as needed. Your profile Qualifications: Candidate must be a good writer and copy editor. Must refer to the AP stylebook for writing style. Have some working knowledge of Adobe InDesign and Photoshop. Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and Power Point. Experience creating content for a business or organization Currently enrolled full-time in an accredited university Junior or Senior academic standing Communications, Marketing, Business or any degree in the related field 0 or higher GPA Applicants should be competitive, assertive, and self-motivated. The ability to think critically, multi-task, and keep up in a fast-paced environment is critical. The ideal candidate will have a passion for marketing and e-business, and must have strong writing skills Good communication and organizational skills Ability to work independently The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirement for the performance of this job.  It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. title: Undergraduate Intern Digital and Marketing
description: Home Search openings Search results Job details     Help Job details   Job 1 of 1 Submit to job   Send to friend   Save to cart    Company Name Altria Grp Distr Co Position Title Undergraduate Intern Digital and Marketing Services Sub-Function Consumer Engagement Discipline Customer Service /Call Center Marketing City Richmond State Virginia Requisition Number 16744BR Job Description Altria Group is a FORTUNE 200 company that owns the premier tobacco companies in the United States including Philip Morris USA, U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, John Middleton and Nu Mark. The companies‰Ûª brands include Marlboro, Copenhagen, Skoal, Black & Mild, MarkTen and VERVE. Altria also owns Ste. Michelle Wine Estates, one of the country‰Ûªs top premium wine producers, and Philip Morris Capital Corporation, an investment company. Altria‰Ûªs mission is to own and develop financially disciplined businesses that are leaders in responsibly providing adult tobacco and wine consumers with superior branded products.  Altria Group Distribution Company‰Ûªs role is to provide sales, distribution and consumer engagement services for Altria‰Ûªs tobacco Operating Companies. Within this operating company, Digital and Marketing Services‰Ûª role is to define digital and marketing leadership and execute programs to achieve leadership for our Operating Companies' brands. We are currently seeking highly qualified undergraduate interns to join our Digital and Marketing Services department in Richmond, VA.  JOB DESCRIPTION Our 10-12 week summer intern program in Richmond, VA, provides students the opportunity to participate in on-the-job training, access to mentors, planned social events, and educational opportunities. Students will be assigned to work on a project that is relevant to a current business opportunity. Additionally, students will document their project work in a formal report and presentation to Senior Management at the conclusion of the internship program.  As a Digital and Marketing Services Undergraduate Intern with Altria Group Distribution Company, the student will be assigned to a specific business area within Digital and Marketing Services for purposes of learning, assessment, and ultimate contribution.  The business areas include: ‰Û¢ Digital Operations o Marketing Campaign Execution o Channel Management ‰Û¢ Marketing Services o Event Marketing o Customer Care Operations Projects may include: ‰Û¢ Develop and enhance marketing programs for adult tobacco consumer promotions including: one-to one digital marketing, email, mobile app, direct mail and experiential/event marketing ‰Û¢ Evaluate and recommend event marketing execution strategies ‰Û¢ Optimize performance of digital platforms and recommend enhancements for user experience ‰Û¢ Assess existing customer care infrastructure and propose consumer touch point improvements ‰Û¢ Analyze business/program performance and recommend enhancements for future programs Specific Skills To qualify for the undergraduate summer intern program, students must be enrolled as a rising senior in good academic standing at the time of the internship. Specifically, we are looking for students working towards a degree in Business, Liberal Arts, or Information Technology at the time of the internship. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 is strongly preferred. We are looking for students who plan time and resources efficiently and possess strong strategic, analytical, and creative thinking skills. In addition, successful candidates must demonstrate leadership, initiative, and accountability, as well as exhibit strong verbal and written communication skills.  Candidates must pass a drug-screen and background check prior to employment. A Housing Allowance is available for students who qualify.  HOW TO APPLY To apply for and be considered for this position, please go to the careers website for the Altria family of companies, www.cantbeattheexperience.com, and post your resume. Please note that we do not retain resumes submitted outside of our application process and in order to qualify for our internships or co-op assignments, you must be eligible to work full time within the United States without sponsorship. NOTE* Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other protected class. description: Panasonic Automotive Systems OUR TEAMS ABOUT US CAREERS BLOG SIGN IN Submit your information for this opportunity Apply Now                                          Marketing Intern About Us:   Panasonic Automotive Systems Company of America (PASA) is a global supplier to Automotive Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM's) around the world.  Our clients include Ford, GM, Chrysler, Daimler, Fiat, Tesla, Honda, Toyota, Nissan and many others.  In serving our customers, we don't just strive to put tomorrow's technology on the road ‰ÛÒ we pride ourselves on recruiting the brightest and best to do it. If you possess that rare combination of vision and passion, joining our team is probably the closest you'll ever get to a dream come true. Get a peek inside life at Panasonic and learn more about the city where Panasonic Automotive is headquartered.   Are you an innovator that strives to do things differently?   Panasonic Automotive is looking for undergraduate students excited about innovating cutting-edge technology and who like to see their projects come to life in the real world. We are looking for students to assist our Marketing and Commuications Department of Panasonic Automotive in a variety of challenging assignments.     Job Responsibilities May Include:   Coordinate, craft and deploy employee communications Assist in the coordination of customer technology events (e.g. gather/ship products, communicate and manage product/specialist schedules and logistics, etc.) Update event calendars and planning documents for monthly Managers' Meetings and provide weekly department updates on upcoming events/activities Develop ideas for brand content that will enhance customer awareness and opinion of the brand; content specific to website, social, sales presentations, etc.  Review and refresh customer sales presentations as needed Draft external communications announcements including executive messaging for media engagement (e.g. press release, social media posts, etc.) Scan global media database for relevant Panasonic and competitive news; weekly report out to Marketing & Communications department  Qualifications: Required Experience:   Must be a Junior and above pursuing a 4-year degree in Marketing or a related field Must meet the university's requirements for participating in the co-op/internship program Must be enrolled as a student during the semester in which the co-op/internship will occur Computer proficiency in various social media and MS Office applications Bilingual in Japanese/English preferred Must have a thirst for knowledge and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment Ability to work independently and as part of a team Strong organizational skills with an ability to prioritize time sensitive assignments Excellent written and verbal communications skills Interest in the automotive industry is a plus   Positions are available for students to work at our Farmington Hills, MI location.   Panasonic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees‰ÛÓ16,000 people working together across disciplines and time zones to provide smart, sustainable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in 400 locations around the world. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and are searching for innovative people to join our teams.   Our International Architecture and Engineering (A-E) unit has an opening for a Summer Marketing Intern to join the business development and marketing team in our Marlborough, Massachusetts office. This position supports Tetra Tech‰Ûªs growth in the international development services market, and offers an excellent opportunity to gain experience in a professional services environment.   Successful candidates will possess a strong passion for international development and excellent writing and communication skills.  Responsibilities Support marketing and technical personnel with researching international business opportunities; Prepare written proposal content (resumes and project descriptions) and marketing collateral (project success stories, web content, brochures, and presentations); Assist in maintaining library of resumes, project summaries, and past performance reports; Support proposal production by formatting documents, and assembling electronic and hard copies.  Qualifications  Qualifications Candidate must be currently enrolled in an accredited academic degree program, pursuing a bachelor‰Ûªs degree in a writing and research oriented field; Demonstrated interest in international development, international relations, engineering, public health, or a related field (coursework, study abroad, volunteer experience) a plus; Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with exceptional grammar and proofreading abilities; Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines; Available for eight to ten weeks during the Summer 2017; Attention to detail and motivation to assist team in capturing new business; Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook).   For more information on our company, please visit our website at www.tetratech.com. title: Pre-Sales Integrated Marketing
description: Pre-Sales Integrated Marketing Internship (LA) - Summer 2017 PLAYA VISTA, CAMARKETING & COMMUNICATIONSINTERN APPLY FOR THIS JOB Are you an undergrad junior/senior or grad student who has a passion for social media? Fullscreen has an Integrated Marketing department that specializes in influencer marketing, and we are looking for a paid Pre-Sales Integrated Marketing Intern to join our 12 week Summer 2017 Internship program in our LA office!   The ideal candidate will have a passion for and knowledge of digital entertainment and the world of social media influencers. The candidate would also have a proven track record of completing projects efficiently, be detail-oriented, and possess the ability to think outside-the-box to support and fulfill the strategic objectives of a highly cross-functional organization. This is a 30 hour/week internship position. In your time with us, you will learn how a tech media business operates, as well as day-to-day skills on how to support teams and projects. You will use your creativity to solve real problems and apply what you have learned at school directly to your job, while building professional relationships, that could lead to a career and lasting friendships. Responsibilities Creating and updating marketing materials Attending Brainstorms Assisting in RFP development Audience Research and reporting Influencer research Qualifications Must be on-site in LA office throughout internship Be currently enrolled junior/senior undergrad student or grad student with 3.0+ GPA Be extremely passionate about online video, especially YouTube Working knowledge of Mac, Google Drive, and Microsoft Office Willingness to go above and beyond to provide great work Superior communication skills as well as analytical Be a self-starter with a strong desire to win and to grow personally and professionally Perks + Benefits Internship is paid Flexible dress code Kitchen stocked with snacks Catered meal on Fridays ABOUT FULLSCREEN MEDIA:  Fullscreen Media is a global leader in social-first entertainment experiences serving creators, brands and consumers. Fullscreen Media is comprised of three key businesses: Fullscreen Creator Network is the biggest network empowering creators through a variety of services, from audience development and programming support to management, content production and merchandising. Fullscreen Entertainment reaches consumers through creator-driven experiences from Fullscreen Live, original content from Fullscreen Productions and the pioneering Rooster Teeth studio, and subscription video on demand services ‰ÛÏFullscreen‰Û and Rooster Teeth‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏFIRST.‰Û Fullscreen Brandworks partners with major brands to tap into the power of social media with original entertainment, influencer marketing, multi-platform social content and targeted media through the Fullscreen Media Network.  Fullscreen, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. title: Brand Marketing Intern
description: Feeding America Careers Brand Marketing Intern (Summer) Internships Chicago, Illinois Apply Description Work. Serve. Thrive. Imagine a place where your talent can make a meaningful difference in peoples' lives. Working at Feeding America is a uniquely rewarding experience in which our employees work together as vital parts of a much larger mission. We are innovative, mission-focused, diverse, collaborative, values-driven and focused on results. We are a national, nonprofit organization and the nation's leading domestic hunger-relief charity. Located in the heart of downtown Chicago, our mission is to feed America's hungry through a nationwide network of member food banks and engage our country in the fight to end hunger. Learn more about our culture of working at the Feeding America National Office. Working at Feeding America is a uniquely rewarding experience in which our employees work together as vital parts of a much larger mission. We are innovative, mission-focused, diverse, collaborative, values-driven and focused on results. We are a national, nonprofit organization and the nation‰Ûªs leading domestic hunger-relief charity. Lead several marketing projects during the course of the internship. Responsibilities: Prepare project recaps and provide strategic recommendations to inform future projects Create PowerPoint slides for internal meeting purposes Maintain and update brand assets on Feeding America intranet Write email and other communication materials for various audiences (national office, network food banks, etc.) Assist in ongoing responsibilities including project management, external partner correspondence, and market research and competitive analysis.  Requirements: Please submit cover letter with rÌ©sumÌ©. 2+ years of college (currently working towards completion of Bachelor‰Ûªs degree) Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) Strong analytical skills Passionate about Feeding America‰Ûªs mission Ability to multi-task with a strong sense of meeting deadlines  Feeding America embraces a philosophy that recognizes and values diversity. Univision is looking to recruit top talent for our Internship program to join our mission of informing, entertaining, and empowering U.S. Hispanic consumers. The ideal candidate is at the top of their class, is a self-starter, and is eager to learn in a team environment. Our internship program strives to grow our interns‰Ûª knowledge of the media industry and expand their networking opportunities.     SUMMER PROGRAM DETAILS Starts: Monday, June 05                                     Ends: Friday, August 11 åá         Runs 10 weeks; maximum of 40 hours/per week åá         Projects designed to build knowledge, skills, and experience in the Media Industry åá         Exposure to various business    leaders and company initiatives åá         Additional training and development workshops to build transferable business skills åá         Deadline to apply is March 17th   DEPARTMENT INFO The DIG Account Team is responsible for managing the process by which branded content is sold & produced for ad sales clients. We work closely with UCI AEs to prepare proposals in response to RFPs for custom branded & social content, inclusive of video, photos/memes & social posts. Our team synthesizes the RFP for the creative team to develop custom solutions for our clients and packages and shares those proposals with the sellers, supporting the sales process. We handle client management for production of content, acting as the liaison between creative/production team & our clients to ensure all deliverables are accurate, approved, on time and performing well for our clients.   RESPONSIBILITIES åá         Tier 1 Responsibilities o    Campaign reporting trackers (excels) o    Set up reporting template deck (we‰Ûªll send info and they plug into deck ‰ÛÒ I.e. Grab screenshots of all content,etc) o    Updating pre-roll inventory tracker o    Sending Daily pre-roll pacing email o    Taking Notes in Meetings/Sending Recap o    Update Marketing Status tracker o    they would update our status tracker as we discuss status in marketing meetings åá         Tier 2 Responsibilities o    Campaign Support ‰ÛÒ I.e. transcripts for videos (translate as necessary), look for influencers o    Competitor/Industry Analysis ‰ÛÒ send a weekly email with links on cool campaigns brands/competitors are doing and a quick 1-2 sentence analysis o    Updating Targeting segments (in Reelio and in DFP) åá         Core Project: o    Campaign Reporting 50% o    Proposal Assistance  25% o    Campaign Execution 25% MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS BASIC QUALIFICATIONS åá         Must be pursuing a Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, Media at an accredited institution åá         Ability to multitask in a fast pace environment, strong communication skills. åá         Must be a rising Jr., rising Sr., or recent May 2017 graduate åá         Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above åá         Must be 18 years of age or older åá         Technical skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint åá         Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the U.S åá         Must be willing to work from offices in New York, NY åá         Must be willing to submit to a background investigation DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: åá         Prior work/internship experience in a corporate environment åá         Proficiency with Word/Excel/ PowerPoint åá         Demonstrate leadership and adaptability åá         Demonstrate civic and community service     About Univision Communications Inc. title: Marketing Intern
description: Jobs Why Juniper My Account Join our talent network   All Open Positions   Intern: Marketing - 934871 USA - California Apply Apply with LinkedIn Share   About the Group: Juniper Marketing builds connections between Juniper‰Ûªs exceptional technology and our customer‰Ûªs pressing business challenges to enable our sales teams to sell more and customers to succeed more. We are challenging traditional marketing approaches by developing a remarkable digital experience for Juniper customers and partners with state of the art marketing tools and practices. At Juniper, we believe that to realize our company vision, Connect Everything and Empower Everyone, we need the extraordinary contribution of many individuals working together as a team.  We invite you to bring your best and become a member of this innovative team this summer.  About the position: Juniper marketing is responsible for the full spectrum of marketing activities.  While our marketing interns are assigned to specific, real business impacting projects they are also exposed to the other functions for networking and learning. This summer, we are looking for marketing interns to contribute to the following marketing functions:  Portfolio & Product Marketing:  Develop differentiated value propositions for Enterprise, Service Provider, Cloud and Security customers Field and Partner Marketing: Drive integrated marketing campaigns and sales team and partner revenue growth Corporate & Brand Communications: Drive Juniper‰Ûªs brand creation and corporate communications Analyst Relations: Forge influential relationships with industry analysts to help drive business and inform decisions Information and Learning Experience:  Develop and deliver the Juniper company website (juniper.net), and product information and training   Responsibilities: Work collaboratively with your manager and teammates to execute projects: develop plans, manage expectations, communicate effectively to all involved and deliver results on time. Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills, initiative, teamwork, autonomy and leadership in your area of expertise and work assignment. Demonstrate passion for delighting customers with technology solutions grounded in customer insights Demonstrate strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally & build enduring partnerships    Minimum Qualifications: Pursuing a degree in Business related degrees, CS, EE or other applicable technical degree Microsoft Office suite  Preferred Qualifications: Networking and/or tech industry familiarity ABOUT JUNIPER NETWORKS Juniper Networks is in the business of network innovation. From devices to data centers, from consumers to cloud providers, Juniper Networks delivers the software, silicon and systems that transform the experience and economics of networking. Our products and technology run the world's largest and most demanding networks today, enabling service providers, enterprises, and governments to create value and accelerate business success. Everyday our 9,000+ colleagues come together across 46 countries to realize our company vision - Connect Everything, Empower Everyone. We are innovating in ways that empower our customers, our partners and ultimately, everyone, in a connected world. These customers include the top 130 global service providers, 96 of the Fortune 100 and hundreds of public sector organizations.  WHERE WILL YOU DO YOUR BEST WORK? Wherever you are in the world, whether it's downtown Sunnyvale or London, Westford or Bangalore, Juniper is a place that was founded on disruptive thinking - where colleague innovation is not only valued, but expected. We believe that the great task of delivering a new network for the next decade is delivered through the creativity and commitment of our people. The Juniper Way is the commitment to all our colleagues that the culture and company inspire their best work-their life's work. At Juniper we believe this is more than a job - it's an opportunity to help change the world...  TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: Juniper Networks does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Juniper Networks employees or any other company location. Juniper Networks is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.   Job Scam Alert:  Due to a rise of fraudulent job openings/offers posted on job websites, please use caution and be sure to apply through legitimate job sites including Juniper Networks corporate career sites. The postings may appear legitimate with unauthorized use of Juniper Networks branding and copyright material. Some common signs that a job posting/offer is a scam include:  ‰Û¢ Request to cash fraudulent checks and monetary transfers; ‰Û¢ Correspondence from e-mail accounts such as Google, Yahoo!, AOL, Hotmail; ‰Û¢ Misspellings and grammatical errors; ‰Û¢ Get rich quick language; ‰Û¢ Failure to list a specific location for the job; ‰Û¢ Request for Social Security Number or financial information.  The best way to apply for jobs at Juniper Networks, is via www.juniper.net/careers.  Apply Apply with LinkedIn Share   YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN Intern: Technical Marketing - 934712 Marketing USA - California Intern: Marketing Analytics & Decisions Sciences (MADS) - 935156 Marketing USA - California                                                                                     å© 1999 - 2016 Juniper Networks, Inc. All rights reserved

title: Marketing Intern
description: Sign In Career Opportunities: Marketing Intern - Starkey Hearing Foundation (22981) Req Id 22981 - Posted 02/15/2017 - 1st shift - Temporary- Full Time - Foundation - None - United States - Minnesota - Eden Prairie ”âª  Job Description Print Preview Apply Apply using LinkedIn‰ã¢ Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List      Starkey Hearing Foundation is looking for an eager, passionate, Marketing Intern to join our staff for the summer! The Marketing Intern is responsible for supporting the marketing team within Starkey Hearing Foundation on various marketing activities, including but not limited to: branding, writing marketing content, digital media initiatives, assisting with events, public relations, etc.     Our Culture: A non-profit organization working towards a greater good A fast paced, ever changing environment Our success has as much to do with attitude as aptitude‰ÛÓwhat‰Ûªs in our hearts, not just our heads   You Will: Support the team in researching, monitoring and implementing social media Help with a specific marketing campaign for the Starkey Hearing Foundation brand Support for Marketing Team on various brand marketing projects and ongoing product support needs (e.g. website updates, material updates, etc) Support corporate marketing by assisting with blog content and social posts. Assist with foundation mission photo organization. Help with the 2017 So the World May Hear Awards gala projects, marketing initiatives and social media.   You will Need: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor‰Ûªs degree program in Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills Willingness to immerse in hearing aid and nonprofit industry Ability to organize and execute plans efficiently Team player mentality Ability to manage multiple projects at once       *LI-AP1 William F. Austin founded Starkey Hearing Foundation in 1984 with the premise: "Alone we can't do much, but together we can change the world." At this year's Clinton Global Initiative (CGI) Annual Meeting, he reported on the So the World May Hear Commitment to Action: to give one million people hearing aids this decade to restore the gift of hearing, and to make a difference in people's lives in new ways:  Starkey Hearing Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Vet/Disabled. EEO is the law.   Our reward is in the faces and smiles of each person as we help them hear again. We truly live through what we give. Starkey Hearing Foundation's national programs and global missions add up to something larger: a movement that enables the world to hear, one by one and community by community. A movement that teaches. And one that believes hearing is the answer to many of the world's most intractable problems: isolation, poverty, and illiteracy.
