title: IEEE Xplore Platform Design, Marketing
description: | | | | IEEE.orgIEEE Digital LibraryXploreIEEE StandardsIEEE SpectrumMore Sites   IEEE is an EEO/AAP Employer/Protected Veterans/Disabled  We require all applications on line, if you require assistance contact .talent@ieee.org  ADA Requirements  www.dhs.gov/E-Verify    Welcome. You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Basic Search| Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Summer Intern- IEEE Xplore Platform Design, Marketing - MAR0000011B: TT01  Description   IEEE is the world's largest professional association dedicated to advancing technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity.  The IEEE Xploreå¨ digital library is a specialized website for finding and accessing scientific and technical content published by the IEEE and its publishing partners.  IEEE Xplore provides web access to over four-million full-text documents from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics.   The intern selected for the 2017 Summer Internship Program will work with the IEEE Platform Design team responsible for business management and design of the IEEE Xplore platform.  This team leads and manages the IEEE Xplore release process and business prioritization for new capabilities, features, and functions.  They manage the site layout, the color scheme, on-screen elements, and the overall look and feel to maximize user engagement.  They keep track of market and technology trends, measure user activity and behaviors, and regularly listen to users to make sure IEEE Xplore is continuously evolving to meet their needs.   As a summer intern for IEEE Xplore Platform Design you will have an inside look at the day-to-day business management of a specialized website.  You will participate in the business analysis and documentation of new features and capabilities.  You will learn how to conceptualize the user experience and transform it into a compelling user interface design.  You will increase your knowledge of Google search rankings, web content management and presentation, competitive benchmarking, and user validation and usability testing. You will also acquire skills for preparing web analytics and usage statistics reports.  Responsibilities: Assist with documentation of business requirements and user experience process flowcharts for the development of new features and capabilities. Coordinate recruitment of participants and set up arrangements for ongoing user validation and usability testing. Assist with market research and competitive benchmarking of comparable online platforms, features and functionality. Analyze the findability of IEEE Xplore content in Google and other search services, and the user experience for linking to subscription-based content on IEEE Xplore. Assist with the preparation and management of informational content for IEEE Xplore. Present research findings to IEEE Platform Design team (and possibly other staff). Prepare Excel reports for web platform analytics and usage statistics. Assist in other platform design related activities and research projects as needed.    Qualifications   Education and experience: College junior or senior (as of Fall 2017) with strong academic performance ‰ÛÒ major in user experience design, marketing, communications, psychology, business, or liberal arts preferred.  Skills and other requirements: Basic understanding of websites and market research techniques. Ability to write and document in Microsoft Office tools (PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Visio) and Google Apps (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive). Strong planning and organization skills with an ability to prioritize and manage work, adhering to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication and presentation skills, both oral and written. Strong qualitative and analytical skills. Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.  For information on work demands and conditions required for this position, please consult the reference document, ‰ÛÏPhysical, Mental, and Work Environment Standards for IEEE Positions.‰Û  This position is classified under Category  I ‰ÛÒ office positions. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer:  This job description outlines the general nature and key features performed by various positions that share the same job.  It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.  Nothing in this job description restricts management‰Ûªs right to assign or re-assign duties  to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodations or other business reasons. title: Marketing Intern
description: Skytap Careers Marketing Intern Marketing Seattle, Washington Apply Description  Join the Skytap Team Skytap is a public cloud provider that extends enterprise Cloud and DevOps strategies to traditional on-premises applications. Skytap uniquely supports application modernization with production-ready development, software testing and training environments that work the same way as an on-premises data center. title: Style + Content Marketing Intern
description: Style + Content Marketing Intern Portland, ORPart-time Company Description Sseko Designs is a footwear and accessories company based in Portland, Oregon.  All of our products are designed for the western market and are produced in East Africa through partnerships with local communities and businesses.  We are building a sustainable and profitable company in East Africa as a means to provide dignified, fair-wage employment, and scholarship opportunities for women in Uganda.  We are passionate about beautiful, well-designed footwear and accessories, and we are raising awareness of the importance of educating and empowering women in developing economies.   Job Description Have your own fashion blog? Love sharing your style on Instagram? We are looking for an intern with an eye for style and a creative spirit to join the Sseko team during their summer break! If you‰Ûªre looking for an opportunity to develop visual content for an established fashion brand, this is the gig for you! This entrepreneurial individual would be responsible for: Visual Content: Work with our Marketing Team to develop imagery and stories that tie in with our campaigns. Campaigns + Brainstorming: Assist Marketing Team in finding creative ways to engage customers with our product. Gain experience in campaign planning through key summer campaigns, such as 4th of July and our Birthday Campaign! Copywriting: Gain experience blogging and developing written content for social media and more.  Styling: You get the Sseko brand‰ÛÓour style and our aesthetic‰ÛÓand you have a natural eye for style! We're excited to have you on the team to help style our summer products for flat-lays and mini photoshoots. (It‰Ûªs a plus if you aren‰Ûªt camera-shy, either!) Qualifications Ideally pursuing an undergraduate degree in fashion, marketing or related field. Love of fashion and always stays on top of the latest style trends. Experience blogging and/or writing. Personal fashion blog or Instagram a major plus! Basic design and photography skills another plus! Additional Information Interns are expected to work approximately 20 hours per week and attend additional events as necessary. We‰Ûªre a small company and we share responsibilities, event work, and lots of various projects. Be ready to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty if needed! Internships are unpaid, but you may receive college credit if approved by your college or university. Interns are required to live within commuting distance of our office in Portland, OR. We have a small, lively office here in Portland -- and we are excited to welcome you into it!  Application Deadline: March 31, 2017 I'm interested I'm interested Refer a friend Posted by Carolyn Cesario SHARE THIS JOB OTHER JOBS AT SSEKO DESIGNS Photography + Design Intern Portland, OR Events Intern Portland, OR Community Manager + Marketing Intern Portland, OR Show all jobs SIMILAR JOBS Content Marketing Design Intern AncestrySan Francisco, CA Volunteer/Intern: Content Marketing Manager Hasana, Inc.Chicago, IL Social Media Content Marketing Intern (part-time) UserIQAtlanta, GA Powered by

title: Marketing Communications Intern
description: Marketing Communications Intern US-GA-Atlanta Apply View All Jobs Share This Job Job Description Aptean is a leading provider of mission critical enterprise software solutions. We build and acquire industry-focused solutions to support the evolving operational needs of our customers. Our solutions help nearly 5,000 organizations stay at the forefront of their industries by enabling them to operate more efficiently, thereby ensuring higher customer satisfaction. For more information, visit www.aptean.com. We are looking for versatile, hardworking, and talented interns with strong writing and analytical skills to begin immediately and work part or full-time. Marketing interns will be focused on supporting the global sales marketing communications initiatives.  Our interns will learn about content creation, receive hands-on mentoring, and develop a wide variety of communications, public relations, graphics and marketing materials in addition to providing sales support and CRM data analysis. Interns demonstrating high performance will be considered for future employment as entry-level positions become available. This is a paid position. Responsibilities could include Work with communications and marketing, supporting both internal and external communications. Assist with the development of content (blog posts, case studies, press releases and byline articles) as well as assist with graphic design. Assist with social media channels to post updates, gain new followers, and analyze trends that help us better engage with our customers and audiences. Provide support to sales functions including telephone inquiries, liaising with customer accounts and marketing, contact data hygiene, and responding to customer inquiries Evaluate customer and prospect data with our Pivotal CRM solution to ensure accuracy. Skills & Requirements Qualifications and Requirements Must have completed at least 1 year of undergraduate studies pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Marketing or relevant discipline (PR/communications, business administration, digital marketing, product marketing, sales Excellent writing and editing skills with a high level of attention to detail ‰ÛÒ writing samples a plus Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver results while managing multiple projects. Self-starter with ability to work independently in a cross-functional environment where tight deadlines exist. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Ability to use Adobe Indesign/Photoshop would be an advantage Aptean, Inc., is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. In accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws No applicant for employment with Aptean shall be subjected to discrimination because of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, disability, age, covered military veteran status, reprisal for engaging in anti-discrimination activities, protected genetic information, sexual orientation or parental status.   #LI-JH1 Apply View All Jobs Careers @ Aptean Join a dynamic team of people who value excellence, quality and customer service. Looking for an exciting and challenging career? Aptean serves more than 10,000 customers from over 20 offices around the globe. Our fast-paced global business environment offers great opportunities to develop your skills and advance your career. You‰Ûªll join a motivated, high-caliber team dedicated to excellence in software and customer service. Aptean attracts a culturally diverse group of employees who have deep expertise in delivering world-class software solutions. You‰Ûªll work with motivated, high-caliber colleagues in a creative and ethical business environment. We deliver superior customer experiences that translate into real-world success. With a track record for product and service innovation, Aptean is a financially stable company with a commitment to market leadership in all the industry segments we serve. If you have experience in delivering, marketing, or selling complex enterprise software and information technology solutions, we want to meet you today. What We Value Most  Aptean uses its core values to guide its more than 1,500 global employees to serve every customer in every geography and market. Intelligence: Thinking and acting creatively, strategically and collaboratively to create better solutions and sound business practices. Intensity: Strong commitment to results. Going the extra mile, even when not required, to drive our long term success. Integrity: Ethics-based actions. Delivering on our commitments to our customers and each other in a transparent, fair, ethical and supportive fashion. Integration: The whole is greater than the sum of the parts. Inclusive, team-oriented, sharing success Aptean is an Equal Opportunity employer  Aptean is an Equal Opportunity employer and is proud to have a drug-free environment. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The ‰Û÷EEO is the Law poster‰Ûª is available here and the supplemental poster is here. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail at recruiting@aptean.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

title: Marketing Intern
description: Home Search openings Search results Job details     Help Job details   Job 1 of 1 Apply to job   Save to cart    Auto req ID 836BR Business Unit Mlive Media Group Title Mlive Media Group / Advance Local Marketing Internship City Grand Rapids State Michigan Job Category Marketing Posting (Advertisement) Mlive Media Group / Advance Local Marketing Internship    PROGRAM OVERVIEW: Advance Local, one of the nation‰Ûªs leading media marketing companies, is seeking talented and motivated individuals for a Summer 2017 Internship Program with positions in Content, Sales and Marketing. This paid national talent development program extends to Advance Local‰Ûªs affiliate companies located throughout Alabama, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, Central New York, Ohio, Oregon, Staten Island and Pennsylvania. Participants in the program will be immersed in one location for 8 weeks and then come together in the New York City area with fellow interns from across the country.  The 2017 summer internship program is designed to be a springboard for talented individuals with demonstrated interest and skills in journalism, marketing or sales.  POSITION SUMMARY: The Advance Local Sales and Marketing intern will work alongside the digital sales and marketing team to develop multi-platform advertising solutions for our local and regional advertisers. This person will report directly to an Account Executive and will help craft proposals and support the fulfillment of campaigns. The position offers the opportunity to gain an in-depth knowledge of digital marketing solutions, and to work with talented and experienced sales and marketing professionals. The Sales and Marketing Intern will have the opportunity to make significant contributions to the local media group as well as the larger community.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Day-to-day tasks and projects may include, but are not limited to: Participate in team strategy meetings focused on identifying prospects and developing plans to grow business Join Account Executive on in-person and telephone client calls Work with sales staff on pre-call strategies and proposals Attend training seminars on, among other things, company‰Ûªs comprehensive digital solutions and its products Other responsibilities as necessary to support the sales and marketing team Complete a project that will be presented to fellow interns and Advance Local executive at the summit SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES Ideal candidates will be goal-oriented, self-motivated and will have strong problem-solving skills Must be a current Junior or Senior Excellent communication and presentation skills required Must be able to quickly learn and become adept at using new technology Ability to work under deadline pressure and appropriately prioritize tasks Microsoft Office proficiency Sales experience preferred   APPLICATIONS DUE: Tuesday January 31, 2017   INTERNSHIPS BEGIN: Monday June 5, 2017       WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS General office environment. Extensive computer use required. Some travel required.   Advance Local, one of the largest media groups in the U.S. reaching more than 40 million consumers through its 12 local news and information websites that rank #1 among local media in their respective markets, and more than 30 newspapers. Our affiliated websites and newspapers are well known for their award-winning journalism. Advance Local is part of Advance Publications, along with CondÌ© Nast and American City Business Journals.  Advance Local is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, physical or mental impairment, sexual orientation or any other category protected under federal, state or local law. title: Integrated Marketing Intern
description: Welcome. You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Basic Search|Advanced Search|All Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Intern - Integrated Marketing - (36284)  Dynamic (adj): always active or changing; having or showing a lot of energy   Do you have a global perspective and are passionate about succeeding? If so, then let‰Ûªs talk!   At McGraw-Hill Education, we‰Ûªre accelerating learning to unlock the full potential of every learner. It‰Ûªs this vision that sets us apart, contributing to a brighter future where the science of learning meets the art of teaching. We‰Ûªre harnessing technology to enhance learning, both inside and outside of the classroom, deepening the connections between students and educators to empower greater success.  In fact, we also look for ways to better ourselves.  As an MHE colleague, you‰Ûªll focus on aligning yourself to four Core Competencies to better anticipate customer needs, more fully engage across our organization, execute with agility and create better products for the educators and learners we touch.   If you‰Ûªre smart, curious, and passionate about education ‰ÛÒ join us as we open doors. You‰Ûªll work in an enriching, collaborative environment where we create opportunities for learners and celebrate successes. Why? Because learning changes everything.  Watch this video for a glimpse into our Internship experience...http://youtu.be/A4En6Py9Yk4 (A number of our interns have become full-time employees at the end of their studies).   The 6-12 Marketing Intern will learn about the role integrated marketing plays in a publishing/edTech environment while contributing to ongoing marketing plans for key 6-12 programs. The Intern will work closely with the 6-12 Marketing Managers and will spend time observing, contributing, and finally leading various projects touching a variety of programs offered by McGraw-Hill Education. Responsibilities Collaborate within marketing to bring the voice of the customer to everything you do. Review and translate insightful, comprehensive market research to understand the needs of the market and drive program success. Develop campaign messaging for marketplace. Segment audience to maximize campaign impact. Provide support for key summer events. Bring insightful questions that challenge the status quo.   Requirements  A successful candidate will: Be enrolled in 3rd or 4th year of Higher Education, studying Marketing, English, Journalism or related area of study. Outstanding communicator in written, verbal, and visual forms, with samples available. Solid technical skills including fluency in MS Office. Analytical thinker with strong collaboration skills. Results oriented with a sense of urgency. Desire to learn, ask questions and challenge conventional thinking. Always acts with the highest level of ethics and integrity. Next Steps: If you‰Ûªre interested in this position, submit your resume. We‰Ûªll review your resume, and if you might be a match, we‰Ûªll contact you. After our first conversation, you may be invited to interview with others at McGraw-Hill Education. This is your time to shine! If you‰Ûªre eager, dynamic and ultimately a good fit, you‰Ûªll be afforded the opportunity to change the future of education. Join a team of those who want to make a difference in education, are intellectually curious and have integrity! We can offer a means for you to achieve the goals you want to accomplish in your career.  Please apply ‰ÛÒ right now ‰ÛÒ we can‰Ûªt wait to meet you!     McGraw-Hill Education is an EOE/Male/Female/Disability/Veterans/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. For special accommodation due to disability, please email TalentAcquisition@mheducation.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate individual. Participates in Ohio Budget and Management (OBM) Summer College Intern program by assisting the professional staff with routine duties involved in OBM programs. The duties will include one or more of the following activities:   The Ohio Office of Budget and Management Training Academy is seeking to hire a College Intern to: Assist in the design and implementation of modernized style guides and training templates (e.g. participant guides, facilitator guides, PowerPoint templates, training announcement templates, training newsletter templates, etc.). Applicants will be required to submit an official transcript prior to receiving a formal offer of employment. Failure to provide the transcript within 5 working days of being requested will cause the applicant to be eliminated from further consideration.   Please note that a transcript is considered "official" only if it is an original copy from the educational institution and includes an institutional watermark, ink stamp or embossed stamp. Transcripts printed from the institution's website will not be accepted. OBM reserves the right to assess the academic credibility of an educational entity's award of a putative degree.   Supplemental Information The OBM Summer College Intern program will run May 15th , 2017 ‰ÛÒ August 4th, 2017.   The final candidate selected for this position will be required to undergo a criminal background check. Criminal convictions do not necessarily preclude an applicant from consideration for a position. An individual assessment of an applicant's prior criminal convictions will be made before excluding an applicant from consideration. This is an extremely hand's-on, robust program where all Interns will participate in events throughout the summer program that revolve around the three main pillars of the program: Community Service, Social Networking, and Professional Development. These temporary seasonal positions are located at our Corporate offices in the suburban setting of Green Hills, PA which is 7 miles South of Reading, PA. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates more than 200,000 vehicles and serves customers from more than 1,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. Product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, transportation and warehousing management, and supply chain management solutions. The PFS Internship Program is designed to recruit and hire top quality interns to feed the talent pipeline for PFS.  The opportunities are available at our Corporate Office in Allen Texas.   We focus on identifying internships that offer ‰ÛÏreal work‰Û experience and we recruit the very best candidates to fill these positions. title: Marketing Intern
description: Welcome. You are not signed in. My Account Options My Job Cart Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Advanced SearchAll Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format     Marketing Intern - MAR03056 Organization - Pernod Ricard Travel Retail Americas Primary Location - US-Florida Job - Marketing Job Type - Internship Job Posting - Feb 3, 2017  Description  Pernod Ricard Travel Retail Americas (PRTRA) is the premium spirits and wine supplier throughout duty-free and domestic markets of the Caribbean and Central America regions and is part of the newly transformed Global Travel Retail division based in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.   Position Summary:  Under the direction of the Marketing Manager the Marketing Intern will be responsible for assisting in the implementation of marketing plans and promotional activities for key brands in the key markets of the Pernod Ricard portfolio.  Through this internship, the Marketing Intern will gain ‰ÛÏreal world‰Û experience in working with ‰ÛÏlive‰Û activities and key projects involving operations of marketing key brands in the Duty Free and Domestic markets.    The successful candidate must be a marketing major with interest in the spirits industry, Duty Free and/or International Domestic Markets.   ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Assist in special projects related to the adaptation of brand guidelines and global promotional platforms to local programs / initiatives in key markets. Assist in ensuring that all promotional activities implemented are in line with the agreed marketing plans and guidelines.    Provide support to Marketing Manager(s) in the process of executing marketing plans for the key brands in the key markets guided by the 4 year strategic plan. Assist in the preparation of tactical / promotional materials used internally and externally in the marketing of key brands. Assist Marketing Manager(s) in activities pertaining to POS/merchandising requirements. Perform market research; Monitor and various social media platforms, including but not limited to Twitter, YouTube, Facebook, LinkedIN and other social media platforms to support marketing objectives. Assist in the preparation of presentation materials and other informational documents. Assist Marketing Manager with all adhoc projects and marketing administrative tasks.   QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:   åá         Education:   BA in Marketing or Business required. Current MBA graduate student. Experience:   Strong business acumen and analytical skills.  Thorough and creative problem solving abilities and strong verbal and written presentation skills.  Strong proficiency in working knowledge of MS Office Suite.  Must be able to manage multitask and manage multiple projects.  Strong use of technology and social media.  All project activities of marketing and promotional activity must be handled with extreme professionalism. Start Date: Position open until filled, requires minimum 3-6 mo. commitment and/or ( 1 to 2 semesters) Hours: 4-5 Hours/Day, preferably 4-5 days/week Onsite‰ÛÒ No external work Compensation: Paid internship Languages: MUST BE BILINGUAL (Spanish / English)   Education Level - Bachelor's Degree

title: Marketing Communications Intern
description: Marketing Communications Intern Bloomington, INIntern Company Description We are proud to be an industry-leading digital marketing agency that specializes in just one thing: pay-per-click advertising (PPC). It‰Ûªs our objective to make everyone better at it: ourselves, our clients, our peers‰ÛÓthe entire industry. Founded just over 13 years ago, Hanapin has experienced year over year revenue growth since day 1. Our team is committed to being the PPC Agency of Experts by staying update-to-date in cutting-edge trends and providing unmatched service to our expanding client list. Not to mention, we also run the world's most popular PPC blog, PPC Hero, and PPC only conference, Hero Conf!   Job Description We are looking for a go-getting Marketing Communications Intern who is ready to learn a lot about the daily marketing efforts of a fast paced marketing agency! Are you ready to gain practical hands on experience in public relations and marketing? This position will work directly with our Sales Development Coordinator to give you experience in projects that produce high quality marketing materials and boost your writing skills in various formats. We want to help you develop vital skills and experience that will make you succeed in the future.  As our Marketing Communications Intern, you will get the opportunity to: Conduct research for our Public Relations and Sales efforts Provide copy-writing for the Hanapin Marketing website, press releases, social media, and our blog, PPC Hero Coordinate internal quarterly newsletters for our Team Assist with any special promotions or events that are hosted by the Marketing Department Utilize marketing tools to track potential clients Qualifications Able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week on-site at our office in Bloomington, IN during normal business hours: Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm Excellent written and verbal skills Comfortable learning new platforms including email marketing, public relations databases, and social media Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs Some college required with preference for candidates pursuing marketing, public relations, or communications degrees Additional Information To be considered for this position, you must apply through the following link and submit a formal cover letter: http://hanapinmarketing.applytojob.com/apply/RUEZWJuQxv/Marketing-Communications-Intern?source=SR In your cover letter, be sure to include the below information: A short, but sweet bio / introduction. Why this internship at Hanapin interests you What you hope to gain during an internship with us Let us know how you learned about Hanapin and the internship  This internship is unpaid, but we are happy to help you receive college credit in accordance with the required guidelines of your college or university. We are currently hiring for Summer 2017 interns. Thank you for your interest in Hanapin Marketing and best of luck!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. title: Communications Intern
description: Center for Court Innovation Research. Development. Justice. Reform. Communications Intern Back to Employment Type:  Internship Project/Site:  Center for Court Innovation Location:  Manhattan, New York The Center for Court Innovation, a project of the Fund for the City of New York, is a non-profit organization that promotes new thinking about how to reduce crime and incarceration while strengthening public trust in justice.  The Center creates operating projects, including the award-winning Red Hook Community Justice Center and Midtown Community Court, that have been documented to improve public safety and reduce the use of jail and prison.  Nationally and internationally, the Center performs original research on topics of justice reform and provides consulting services to criminal justice innovators. We are looking for a Communications Intern.  Reporting to the Product Manager, the Communications Intern would be involved in helping to shape the conversations and usage of technology in the criminal justice system. They would be responsible for editing written, audio, and video content, identifying interesting posts, assisting with interviewing experts, and helping to organize formal and informal convenings that will help support blog content.  The person would get to cover a vast array of technology topics and work with stakeholders including policy-makers, program implementers, activists, community members, technologists, researchers, and vendors. Responsibilities may include:  Working with the Center‰Ûªs communication staff as needed Writing and copy-editing blogposts and doing simple editing of audio and video interviews Identifying and building relationships with stakeholders in New York City and across the United States who have diverse perspectives on technology in criminal justice reform Curating blogposts from guest writers, with the opportunity to write some original posts if desired Researching current trends, including speaking to the Center‰Ûªs own program staff, to identify new topics of conversation Qualifications include:  Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on blog-style writing Familiarity with and interest in the criminal justice system Familiarity and interest in trends in technology Ability to work well with a multi-disciplinary team in a criminal justice setting Excellent organizational skills and self-driven Experience with, or interest in learning, editing audio and video Time Commitment: 5-10 hours / week, with some flexibility for interviews Salary:  $15 / hour How to Apply:  For interested candidates, please send your cover letter and the names and contact information for three references to Shubha Bala at sbala@nycourts.gov, with the subject line: Technology Communications Intern. The position will remain open until filled. Only applicants under consideration will be contacted. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Note: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete an employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.   CONTACT New York 520 8th Avenue 18th Floor New York, NY 10018 phone: 646.386.3100 Syracuse 601 Tully Street Syracuse, NY 13204 phone: 315.266.4330 London Canterbury Court 1-3 Brixton Road London, SW9 6DE phone: +44 2076.329.060 BROWSE BY TOPIC Access to Justice Bail Reform Community Court Community Prosecution Diversion Domestic Violence Drug Court Families and Children Human Trafficking Juvenile Justice Mental Health New Directions Problem-Solving Justice Procedural Justice Reentry Restorative Justice Risk Assessment Sex Offending Technology Trial and Error Tribal Justice Violence Prevention Youth Court This Web site is funded in whole or in part through a grant from the Bureau of Justice Assistance, Office of Justice Programs, U.S. Department of Justice. title: Social Media Recruitment Intern
description: General Investment & Development | Windsor Communities | Windsor Business Parks | Contact Us         Careers      BROWSE OPEN JOBS SEARCH OPEN JOBS SUBMIT YOUR RESUME EDIT YOUR PROFILE VIEW APPLICATION STATUS  Job Details   Title Social Media Recruitment Intern Location Boston Office City Boston State MA Description   The Company: Windsor Communities is a national, privately held property management company headquartered in Boston‰Ûªs Financial District. Over the past 50 years, we have established our reputation as one of the premier managers of luxury apartment communities in cities across the United States, and have 650+ employees servicing the residents of our growing portfolio of apartments. The Job: We are currently in the market for a Social Media Recruitment Intern to help enhance our presence across various social channels and leverage it to boost our recruiting efforts. If you‰Ûªre curious, self-motivated, and willing to roll up your sleeves to get involved, we want to hear from you! The Fine Print: This is a 20-hr per week paid position based out of Boston, MA, and a great opportunity for total immersion into the Recruiting function of a large property management company. The hours are flexible (between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday), and we‰Ûªll throw in a T-pass so you can get around. You will report directly to the Director of Recruitment and work with our HR Business Partners and Property Managers to redesign and execute a recruitment strategy across our social channels. Your day-to-day tasks will vary, but key responsibilities include: Social Media Maintenance: Assist in actively managing and monitoring Windsor Communities‰Ûª social media on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Glassdoor, etc. Write and post effective and engaging content for our social media recruitment pages, while maintaining our brand voice and personality. Edit and create relevant video/photo content, post relevant articles, company accomplishments, company job fairs, local property events, job openings, etc. Identify mechanisms to grow the number of followers and reviews we have on all our social channels by engaging with potential candidates, posting content, etc. Work with current employees and internal staff to help them promote and share job openings on their social media pages. Online Recruitment: Engage social media to promote Windsor Communities‰Ûª to passive and active candidates Use databases like LinkedIn and Indeed to identify passive candidates and recommend the most qualified ones to our Recruitment Department. Help create relevant content including posts, interviews, videos, employee photos, blog entries, etc. for the Windsor Communities Career‰Ûªs page. Requirements   Pursuing or completed Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Communications, Marketing or related field 2+ years‰Ûª experience and strong familiarity with social media and marketing channels including (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest) Experience with social media analytic tools Excellent oral and written communication skills Basic photo editing skills Team player, but also has the ability to work independently Apply On-line Send This Job to a Friend    Copyright å© 2002‰ÛÒ2009 Windsor Communities Contact  |   Webmaster  |   Terms of Use  |   Privacy Policy  |   Fair Housing  |   Site Map

This position is ideal for a candidate who is interested in learning how a leading global IT organization leverages a channel model to expand reach to customers. This opportunity will allow Interns to: ‰Û¢ Learn how VMware successfully scales its business through various Partner RTMs ‰Û¢ Understand aspects of overall channel business (not just one department) as our organization is highly-matrixed ‰Û¢ Learn valuable skills in process management, project resourcing and project tracking ‰Û¢ Collaborate with teams across all levels in engineering, education, marketing and sales ‰Û¢ Be part of an organization that delivers exciting, best-in-class EUC products and services  Duties & Responsibilities: ‰Û¢ Program and initiative development: Responsible for managing one or several cross-functional initiatives that touch EUC partners including the development and delivery of training programs, marketing assets, sales tools, communications and web projects.  ‰Û¢ Project management and tracking: Drive end-to-end projects from scoping, planning, to launch. title: Business Development & Marketing Intern
description: United States Login +1 (857) 284 7000 SOLUTIONS PLANS PARTNERSHIPS RESOURCES ABOUT US BLOG Get Started Business Development & Marketing Intern ‰ÛÒ Phoenix Home åÈ Job Listings åÈ Business Development & Marketing Intern ‰ÛÒ Phoenix By vcatuneanu  Posted April 25, 2016  In Location 5555 East Van Burren Street, Suite 100 Phoenix Arizona 85008, Phoenix, Arizona Overview Ve Interactive seeks a digital media coordinator to develop and maintain B2B marketing and sales and growth efforts for our West Coast digital and ecommerce sales team. As the sales intern/coordinator, you will introduce our cutting edge technology to new brands and ad agencies, while learning the ropes of the industry. This position serves as a liaison to the field sales team, organizing and carrying out all necessary duties to ensure flawless communication with current and potential clients. As the sales intern/coordinator, you will be immersed at the cutting edge of digital advertising. Responsibilities This project-based role will include any of the following: ‰Û¢Develop sales territories by managing lead gen responsibilities for the team, including prospecting, appointment setting and growth via B2B marketing ‰Û¢Create internal and customer-facing materials that clearly explain the value and unique advantage of our product and services ‰Û¢Develop and maintain B2B lead lists, and assist with CRM and pipeline database ‰Û¢Coordinate closely with marketing, product management, sales, and account management ‰Û¢Assist sellers and ops with any tasks to improve the go-live experience for the client. Ie: Work with account management and with client to get tickets, creative approved etc. ‰Û¢Assist Sales Manager on live business and additional administrative support Qualifications ‰Û¢Pursuing degree in marketing, public relations or communications, or high interest in working in the digital or advertising space ‰Û¢A combination of education and relevant work experience may be substituted upon hiring manager‰Ûªs approval. ‰Û¢Ability to communicate effectively with outside partners, vendors and other contacts, clients and all levels of employees. ‰Û¢Proficient with Microsoft Office suite and Google Drive products, (Word, Outlook, Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Publisher, Google Docs), social media platforms. ‰Û¢Familiarity with social media platforms for advertising and branding purposes. The Company Ve Interactive is a multi-award-winning technology company that offers a suite of apps across its VePlatform.  VePlatform is the e-commerce industry‰Ûªs No. 1 dynamic retargeting and re-engagement platform, designed to drive website conversions and incremental revenue. VePlatform provides you with comprehensive conversion analytics and instant access to Ve‰Ûªs award winning Apps, which are designed to acquire new customers, improve customer engagement, and increase conversions to grow your revenue with a one-time only attribution.  Ve works across 26 languages and has 34 offices worldwide supporting over 10,000 domestic and multi-national online businesses and retailers in the delivery of real-time marketing communications at key points within their customers‰Ûª journeys. description: Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details New Search View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account Job ID #: 51815 Position Title: Moto NA Marketing Intern Location: USA-IL-Chicago Functional Area: University Facility: Corporate Office Relocation Provided: No Education Required: Not Indicated Experience Required: Less than 1 year Travel Percent: 10 Position Description Motorola Mobility is one of the world‰Ûªs fastest growing smartphone providers, creating groundbreaking, affordable, high-quality products designed and built with the global customer in mind. And it‰Ûªs our people who make this all happen. We are thinkers, risk-takers and problem solvers, working together to constantly challenge the status quo. If you share our commitment to ingenuity, creativity and innovation, we want you to help us define our world of tomorrow.  Position located at Motorola HQ in Chicago, IL.  Team and Culture Description:  Motorola Mobility, LLC., represents the entire Mobile Business Group (MBG) under it‰Ûªs parent company, Lenovo.  North America is a focus market for the company and the NA Marketing team supports all smartphone sales efforts in the U.S. and Canada, along with promoting company brand and community initiatives.  The NA Marketing Partnership intern will be responsible primarily for partnership strategy and activation in the U.S.  Scope of Responsibilities:  -Identify partnership prospects in key markets that fit within Moto‰Ûªs partnership criteria (Target Demographic, Brand Awareness, Android software penetration, industry and relationship with Moto‰Ûªs other carrier and retail customers, etc.).  -Monitor prospect interests and evaluate opportunities to make recommendations for pursuing, based on company sales goals and brand objectives.    -Support the NA partnership team with event strategy and all executions.    -Update NA partnership team weekly with status of activation plans, including budget tracking, event asset management + production and execution process.  -Produce and distribute event briefs and materials timely (i.e. shipping product, coordinating installations, hosting conference calls).  -Participate in product and event training to ensure clear objectives and event operations to event stakeholders, i.e. corporate staff, field reps., brand ambassadors, etc.  -Work on-site to capture consumer data during the event and photos for recap purposes.    -Must have flexibility in schedule to work day and evening.  -Provide event recaps for internal discussion within 24 hrs of the event  -Organize all NA Marketing event assets (props, product displays, uniforms, etc.).  -Support other members of the NA Marketing team, as needed (i.e. digital media support, retail / carrier marketing, merchandising and training efforts).      Motorola Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. description: Post A Free Job For Companies For Talent Jobs Log in Marketing Summer Internship (Atlanta, GA) Vonage | Salary not disclosed | Intern | Atlanta, Fulton County, GA, US Apply Save Job MarketingTechnologyInternshipVoIPsales forecastingchannel salesGeorgiaTerritory PlanningCloud CommunicatonsAtlanta Vonage is a leading provider of cloud communication services for consumers and businesses. Providing a robust suite of feature-rich residential and business communication solutions that offer flexibility, portability and ease-of-use across multiple devices designed to meet the needs of a wide range of customers. Our goal is to transform how people connect by challenging the status quo and finding a better way. We believe friends, families and businesses should be able to communicate easily and affordably. The purpose of this internship program is to provide a consistent ‰ÛÏOne Company‰Û internship experience across all locations during a 10-12 week period. Our interns are given real project-based work in order to gain real-life experience as well as develop their careers. The goal is to provide an environment where college students are not limited to learn but also to innovate. The Ideal Candidate Who You Are: Thinker Challenger Innovator Pioneer Do People Describe You As‰Û_: A person who has the ability to take direction but also able to make decisions A systematic thinker who has demonstrated problem solving skills A person who has the ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage multiple projects independently A hands-on, energetic and motivated self-starter possessing a keen attention to detail and follow through Goal oriented and focused on producing the best quality work at all times Be Part of the Innovation Project: All the interns act as if they are in a Start Up Company where you will work in groups across the globe to answer a question of tactical importance to the organization At the end of the program, teams have the opportunity to present to a panel consisting of our senior leadership team members Winner gets to win awesome prizes! Specific Requirements, Skills & Education Current undergraduate students with a GPA of 3.0 or higher Ability to work in our Atlanta, GA office between June ‰ÛÒ August 2017 Our Culture Working at Vonage is fun! If you are someone who likes to disrupt technology and problem solve, then you've come to the right place. Here at Vonage, we work in tightly knit teams at a rather fast pace environment. The technology industry is constantly changing which means we need to be ahead of the game in order to create new ways to communicate for our customers. The open environment enables our employees to be creative and resourceful when coming up with new ideas to make Vonage a clear leader in cloud communications. The Perks $100 monthly credit for food (HQ) Health Care Spending Account Transportation/Parking Spending Account Retirement savings matching Employee Referral Program Free full gym and exercise classes Free snacks, soft drinks, fruits and happy hour Apply Save Job  Top About us Learn more For Companies For Talent Our Companies Pricing for Companies Jobbio on mobile Blog Get in touch Expand The Essential Guide to Generation Z Careers Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy Cookie Policy Use Policy Join us on å© Jobbio 2017 ÌÑ Cookie Policy By continuing to use this site you consent to the use of cookies in accordance with our Cookie Policy

title: Marketing Internship - Corporate Communications
description: Job Search Login / Register We are now hiring Req #1115 Marketing Internship - Corporate Communications - Summer 2017 -- NY Intern Hourly Temporary Monday, February 27, 2017 USA TODAY NETWORK is one of the top 20 digital companies in the country, sharing the list with Google, Facebook, and Amazon.  And we have over 100 million unique visitors a month, which is more than Buzzfeed, Yahoo News, and Huffington Post. Because our team consists of over 110 local properties with USA TODAY at the helm, you‰Ûªll have the luxury of living in a community you love while making a national impact. USA TODAY NETWORK is in search of a talented college student looking for an enriching paid marketing internship.      As part of our company, you will develop and apply skills and experiences to support our Corporate Communications team.  The purpose of the internship experience is to provide opportunities where college (undergrad and grad) students can develop, grow and become the next generation of talent for Gannett. This program offers mentoring, networking and real-world experience in a fun, entrepreneurial atmosphere.  As part of our team, you will help support the day-to-day internal and external communications efforts for the Gannett and USA TODAY NETWORK brands by working closely with superiors to execute across a wide variety of campaigns. Apply today!  RESPONSIBILITIES Support Corporate Communications team with variety of projects, both internal and external.  Develop press materials, including press releases, internal memos, pitch letters, recap reports etc. Assist in management of social media channels, including content development and monitoring Monitor and organize media coverage and be able to provide weekly progress reports to re•Ââect ROI on speci•Âc PR initiatives Collate daily internal newsletter highlighting relevant important company and industry news Participate in PR planning and strategy ideation Attend daily editorial meetings and work closely with PR team to determine priorities for outreach  REQUIREMENTS Degree-seeking student currently enrolled at a college or university with a GPA of at least 3.0  Preferred Majors: Public Relations, Communications Strong interest in the news and media industries Well organized, detail oriented, adaptable and flexible Familiarity with Cision and/or Critical Mention a plus  Ability to multi-task and work well in a team environment Excellent organizational, analytical, oral and written communication skills  Previous internship experience a plus Technical skills required for multiple aspects of the role Ideal candidates will possess strong Of•Âce, PC and Mac skills. Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are a drug free, EEO employer committed to a diverse workforce. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation or veteran status.   Connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Glassdoor, Indeed & The Muse to learn more about our dynamic company culture! title: Earned Media Intern
description: barre3 All jobs ‰ Õ Earned Media Intern Earned Media Intern Portland, Oregon, United States DESCRIPTION WHO WE ARE: At barre3, our goal is to make the world a happier, healthier place. With more than 100 studios across the country, our innovative streaming barre3 Online workouts, our ever-growing index of barre3 recipes, and our inspiring digital magazine, we encourage people to embrace whole-body-health. What does that mean? Nourishing their body with exercise and delicious whole foods, and surrounding themselves with people who feed them‰ÛÓboth literally and figuratively. Understanding that striving for balance is a whole lot healthier than striving for perfection. Our ethos shines through in our home office. At barre3, community is everything, and you‰Ûªll see that in the collaborative and respectful way we work together.  THE OPPORTUNITY: Do you have a passion for social media and public relations? Love the idea of helping one of the best boutique fitness brand in the country grow and connect with their online community and national media followers? Barre3 is looking for an earned media intern to support the Social Media Manager and Communications Manager. Responsibilities: Daily community management. Developing social media reports and tracking key metrics. You‰Ûªll get hands-on experience running social media advertising campaigns. Posting all approved social media content and attending regular team meetings. Writing social media posts and brainstorming post ideas. Helping manage blogger relationships. Blogger research and outreach. Presenting social media trends and findings to the marketing team. Creating local and national media lists and tracking company coverage on a local and national level. Supporting the B3 Magazine including managing uploads to the barre3 website and community management.  This position requires a minimum six-month commitment. The hours are Monday-Thursday, 9-3, with some weekend hours required. REQUIREMENTS Alignment with barre3 Core Values (Everyone Matters, Give Generously, Committed to Real, Make it Happen, Humbly Confident, Innovative) College degree (or graduating senior) Strong administrative and organizational skills Demonstrated initiative and passion, willing to offer up new ideas and go above and beyond the duties of the job Some experience or knowledge of the digital marketing space Apply for this job barre3 website Powered by Workable

description: Sign In Deutsch (German) English UK (English UK) English US (English US) EspaÌ±ol (Spanish) FranÌ¤ais (French) Italiano (Italian) Nederlands (Dutch) ’¥Ïµ_“Ð« (Korean) ¨ÛŠ_ÒŠü_¾Ðà (Simplified Chinese) _ŽÇÓŠü_¾Ðà (Traditional Chinese) Career Opportunities: Sales Internship - Full Time - Summer 2017 (103516) Job Id 103516 - Posted 02/24/2017 - Sales - Americas - United States - Colorado - Centennial ”âª  Job Description Print Preview Apply Apply using LinkedIn‰ã¢ Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List    Sales Internship ‰ÛÒ Full Time ‰ÛÒ Summer 2017 Centennial, CO  Arrow Electronics - www.fiveyearsout.com   Who is Arrow Electronics? Globally headquartered in Denver, CO, Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services, and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions, with 2015 sales of $23.28 billion. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for over 100,000 original equipment manufacturers, contract manufacturers and commercial customers through a global network of more than 460 locations in over 85 countries.   A Fortune 120 company with 18,500 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial, and consumer electronics.   Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.   Why Be an Intern? Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degree Chance to network with 160+ interns across the U.S. Small forums with our Executives and past interns Stretch your presentation skills in front of our VP‰Ûªs and Directors   Responsibilities The Inside Sales Representative Intern will assist in the day-to-day sales support and customer service activities for assigned accounts.  Perform sales support functions to provide the highest level of service and customer satisfaction while maintaining efficiencies in corporate operational processes and procedures.  Serve as a liaison between Arrow‰Ûªs internal resources (field sales, engineering, supplier marketing, manufacturing facilities, purchasing and other corporate departments), vendor resources and customers.  Demonstrates a proactive approach and sense of urgency on our customers‰Ûª behalf, anticipates our customers‰Ûª requirements and communicates efforts in a timely and effective manner.  Create influential customer, supplier and internal relationships.    Requirements & Skills Currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs or Master‰Ûªs Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Operations or equivalent  Available to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the summer (May or June through Mid-August) 3.0 GPA or Higher Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitask Proficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) suite with Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills (ex. Vlookups & Pivot Tables) Customer Service and detail oriented mind set Effective time management abilities   Compensation This is a paid internship. title: Search Intern, Category Strategy and Insights
description: Hershey HOME THIS IS HERSHEY PRODUCTS FOOD PHILOSOPHY RESPONSIBILITY NEWS CENTER INVESTORS CAREERS Enter job title or location Search Intern, Category Strategy and Insights (CVS Office: Cumberland, RI) Cumberland, Rhode Island, United States Share via Facebook Share via Twitter Share via LinkedIn Share via Email Share via GooglePlus Add To Job Cart Button Apply Now Button Position summary Job Location:  Cumberland, RI   Summary:  We are seeking top talent that has a passion for winning and making a difference.  Intern, Category Strategy and Insights Co-Op position at Hershey provides a launch pad for our future sales leaders.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with our customers, analyze customer and shopper insights to build selling stories, and develop your business acumen skills.   CSI is a mix of sales, marketing, and marketing research ‰ÛÒ Our CSI department researches and analyzes data to understand the present and utilize that information to impact the future. Some of the ways a CSI Manager influences the marketplace is by making strategic recommendations on: item assortment, product placement, promotions, and pricing.   As a CSI intern, you will have the opportunity to work with the following departments: Category Development, Sales, Marketing and Shopper Insights.   Responsibilities ‰Û¢ Develop fact-based analysis of customer business trends utilizing a variety of data sources. ‰Û¢ Utilize all appropriate Hershey business systems (Nielsen, Space Management, etc.) and other account sales information to identify key selling opportunities for market/account. ‰Û¢ Assist in the market analysis of scan and sales data to design programs with Key Accounts. ‰Û¢ Analyze sales information regarding key category programs and promotions. ‰Û¢ Identify and develop productive new processes to enhance Hershey‰Ûªs Category Management and Sales functions. ‰Û¢ Work with other departments within Hershey‰Ûªs sales organization to determine efficient ways to disseminate this information.   Qualifications ‰Û¢ A current undergraduate junior or rising senior with a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher (preference is 3.2 or higher). ‰Û¢ Majors in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, and Economics are highly preferred, but others will be considered ‰Û¢ Demonstrated leadership and academic achievement in student and extracurricular activities ‰Û¢ High level of integrity ‰Û¢ Energy and passion for winning ‰Û¢ Adaptability and ability to work independently ‰Û¢ Professional communication skills ‰Û¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving ability ‰Û¢ Customer service orientation Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including:  Excel, PowerPoint, Word ‰Û¢ Effective planning and organizing skills ‰Û¢ Some travel may be required ‰Û¢ Previous internship and/or sales experience is a plus     Work Schedule ‰Û¢ Student must be able to work 20-25 hours/ week during the school year (during business hours) and 35-40 hours/week during the summer. ‰Û¢ This position will begin as soon possible. Duration of the internship is dependent upon the student‰Ûªs availability and performance, with the goal to finish upon the student‰Ûªs graduation. Successful interns could be offered full-time, entry level Sales positions with The Hershey Company.   The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. title: Marketing Intern
description: Summer Marketing Internship Marketing | Portland, OR | Internship JOB DESCRIPTION We are seeking smart, energetic candidates to join us as summer marketing interns, working on a wide variety of marketing initiatives here at Zapproved. This position will partner with all members of our in-house team to assist with: maintaining marketing/sales materials, CRM/Database maintenance, campaign and content projects, and events marketing support. This is a unique opportunity for students to learn from marketing industry experts in an exciting software startup environment.  What You‰Ûªll Need: An interest in technology that is innovative and drives change A developing passion for the art and science of marketing Relevant academic experience marketing, business, technology, design or communications Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills Ability to juggle multiple priorities and events simultaneously A track record of meeting goals as an individual and part of a team  What Would Be Nice: Experience working with analytics, statistics, any sort of databases / datasets Experience with CRM Software (prefer Salesforce) Experience with social media and email marketing tactics Experience supporting events  Working for Zapproved: Zapproved is a software-as-a-service provider based in Portland, OR. Our suite of e-discovery software offers corporate legal teams cloud-based technologies for conducting e-discovery affordably and sustainably. Our growing customer base includes some of the world‰Ûªs largest companies, including many in the Fortune 500 and Global 2000, across a wide variety of industries. Recently, we‰Ûªve been recognized as:  Rising Star Company of the Year  - 2016 Oregon Technology Awards Best E-Discovery Legal Hold Product at 2016 Legaltech News Innovation Awards Entrepreneur of the Year in the 2016 Women of Influence Awards - Portland Business Journal 2016 Best of the National Law Journal - Best Legal Hold Solution - Legal Hold Pro by Zapproved How to Apply: To be considered, please provide your resume, cover letter, and summer availability. We are looking for the things that drive and excite you and the mark that you want to leave on the world, so consider that in your cover letter. title: Product Marketing Intern
description: Apply Now Product Marketing Intern at LifeDojo (View all jobs) San Francisco This opportunity is a PAID INTERNSHIP for the Spring of 2017. As a Product Marketing Intern on LifeDojo's fast-growing team, you will make important and lasting contributions to creating our brand and voice. You‰Ûªll work with our CEO and Marketing Director, engage directly with our users, and use your sharp intuition, research and critical thinking skills to help us create engaging content and user experiences. You'll work on projects like these: Crafting messaging for product and marketing emails Engaging with our users and assisting with user requests Researching topics like nutrition and fitness to find the best resources and apps available Helping us continually improve many aspects of our product About us: LifeDojo is a fast-growing, venture-backed digital health startup focused on improving employee health one habit at a time. We are re-inventing corporate wellness by bringing evidence-based public health programs online, taking the ‰ÛÏmedicine taste‰Û out of them, and giving employees the support they need to develop health habits that last a lifetime. The result? Employers save on healthcare costs, improve productivity and transform their culture, while we get to alleviate the suffering of millions. It‰Ûªs a pretty sweet gig. About you: You're pro-active and curious, you take direction and feedback well and always bring your own creative energy to the table. You might have experience in digital marketing or content marketing, and you can write 20 short customer messages 20 different ways to find the best result - you know that sometimes you only get 3 seconds of a user‰Ûªs time in which to capture their interest, and that we have to iterate a bunch to get there. You have an active personal interest in health, wellbeing, fitness, healthy eating and nutrition, mindfulness, mental resilience and healthy living in general. It's a treat for you to spend a day researching the latest news, research and tools related to these topics, applying what you find to your work, and sharing your knowledge with your team. Requirements: Bachelor‰Ûªs degree, or equivalent work experience Experience with SaaS and willingness to research and learn new tools An appreciation of the difference between science and fad A sharp, witty and thoughtful way with words Excellent written and oral communication skills Curiosity, enthusiasm, positivity and empathy Apply for this Job * Required (Optional) First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone * Location (City) * Locate me   Resume/CV * Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste Cover Letter * Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste LinkedIn Profile How did you hear about this job? * Please, provide a link to a writing sample of 100 words or more Share this job:   Powered by  Read our Privacy Policy

Home Entertainment is seeking an undergraduate intern for our Field Sales team. This internship is intended to provide meaningful and practical work experience to an undergraduate student interested in Sales for the Home Entertainment Group.  The duration of the internship is approximately 10 weeks.  Job Responsibilities: Product Detail Page Updates: optimization of amazon product detail pages Collect all relevant information for a predetermined list of titles from our internal database and marketing teams: synopsis, cast and director bios, trailers, clips, still images, reviews, ratings, related facts and movies/TV shows. Tie placement to sales performance : establish metrics and benchmarks to try and determine optimal promotional placement. Amazon Media Group (AMG) competitive tracker Capture competitive AMG activity supporting releases in the home entertainment window. Provide recap to the sale team.  Job Requirements: Must be enrolled as an undergraduate student in a college or university and in good academic standing (3.0 gpa or higher). Be majoring in either Business, Marketing, Communications, Finance, Information Systems, E-Commerce or a directly related field of study. Must have proficient computer skills; Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook preferred. Must have the ability to communicate effectively and tactfully with managers and other levels of personnel. Must have the ability to pay close attention to details. Must have the ability to organize. Must have the ability to work well under time constraints. Must have the ability to handle multiple tasks.  The Warner Bros. title: Marketing Intern
description: Privacy Policy Job Openings Marketing Intern Marketing ‰ÛÒ Dallas, Texas The Role:  We are looking for a creative, enthusiastic, business-minded individual to join the rewardStyle Marketing team to support the team to help achieve our goals. The Marketing team consists of Communications, Design, and Events. Responsibilities: Support the marketing team in daily tasks including but not limited to: -Client gifting logistics (tracking gift shop inventory, gifting assembly, errands to gather materials or prepare for events, scheduling pickups and deliveries) -Creating non-product inventory archives -Cataloging press, print and digital -Vendor sourcing Collect quantitative and qualitative data from campaigns and activations Write and research relevant, relatable content for rewardStyle newsletters and blog posts Format blog posts Assist where necessary including but is not limited to general creative ideation, marketing closet organization, errands, and event assistance Assist during photo shoots Contribute creative ideas during team brainstorms including but not limited to copy for invitations, swag, and client gifting Requirements: Marketing, PR or design experience required Hyper-organized Strong desire to learn along with professional drive Understanding of influencer marketing Excellent communicator with strong verbal and written communication skills Enthusiastic about marketing industry and best practices About Us:  In the last six years, rewardStyle has fueled the arrival of a new influence on the retail industry: professional content creators. By providing the technical tools, education and global partnerships necessary to empower a global army of 11,000 premium content creators, rewardStyle is now making a tangible impact on global e-commerce sales. In 2016, rewardStyle drove nearly $700M in retail sales to our retail partners; a cumulative $1.5B in retail sales since our 2011 inception. rewardStyle has redirected the style publishing industry and contributed to the professionalization and financial independence of thousands of influencers worldwide, enabling them to earn meaningful revenue on their digital content, ultimately empowering them to create and grow small businesses into international brands. In 2014, rewardStyle launched LIKEtoKNOW.it, our fastest growing platform, which allows Instagram users to receive ready-to-shop product links directly to their inbox after 'liking' a style influencer's Instagram photo, seamlessly creating a path to purchase for more than 2 million consumers worldwide.  Today, rewardStyle is a multi-national business. We have 200 team members who work from rewardStyle offices in Shanghai, New York, San Francisco, Dallas, London and Sao Paulo. Check us out on Instagram @rewardstylehq for a glimpse of what goes on in all of our global offices. title: Marketing Production Design Intern
description: Welcome. You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Basic Search|Advanced Search|All Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Marketing Production Design Intern - (36352)  Do you have a global perspective and are passionate about succeeding? If so, then let‰Ûªs talk!   At McGraw-Hill Education, we‰Ûªre accelerating learning to unlock the full potential of every learner. It‰Ûªs this vision that sets us apart, contributing to a brighter future where the science of learning meets the art of teaching. We‰Ûªre harnessing technology to enhance learning, both inside and outside of the classroom, deepening the connections between students and educators to empower greater success.   In fact, we also look for ways to better ourselves.  As an MHE colleague, you‰Ûªll focus on aligning yourself to four Core Competencies to better anticipate customer needs, more fully engage across our organization, execute with agility and create better products for the educators and learners we touch.   If you‰Ûªre smart, curious, and passionate about education ‰ÛÒ join us as we open doors. You‰Ûªll work in an enriching, collaborative environment where we create opportunities for learners and celebrate successes. Why? Because learning changes everything.  Watch this video for a glimpse into our Internship experience...http://youtu.be/A4En6Py9Yk4 (A number of our interns have become full-time employees at the end of their studies).   Have you ever opened up someone else‰Ûªs Photoshop file and said ‰ÛÏHow can you work like this?!‰Û When everyone else is itching to layout the illustrated 2-page spread, would you rather be tweaking the column structure? Have you ever said to yourself, ‰ÛÏThat paragraph needs one more point of leading‰Û? If so, McGraw-Hill Education has a Marketing Production Design Intern opportunity in Columbus, OH for you.   We‰Ûªre looking for someone interested in the art of production design for digital, web, and print materials. As a production design intern, you‰Ûªll refine your skills in:  Creating and implementing efficient templates. Organizing your design files so other designers can easily pick up where you left off. Organizing messy files from less-structured designers (it happens). Optimizing your workflow through use of shortcuts, actions, and reusable elements. Communicating effectively with web developers. And much more (no coffee-fetching skills necessary).   Requirements  A successful candidate will: Be enrolled in their 3rd or 4th year of undergraduate studies, preferably in Graphic Design. Have a strong working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign. Nob be afraid to share opinions, experiences, and techniques with the team. Raise their hand and ask questions in order to gain a better understanding of the project. Have a good eye for detail and the desire to continually learn and improve are a must. On our team, we all learn from each other. After all, we are in the business of education! Have experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript would also be a huge plus. Next Steps: If you‰Ûªre interested in this position, submit your resume. We‰Ûªll review your resume, and if you might be a match, we‰Ûªll contact you. After our first conversation, you may be invited to interview with others at McGraw-Hill Education. This is your time to shine! If you‰Ûªre eager, dynamic and ultimately a good fit, you‰Ûªll be afforded the opportunity to change the future of education. Join a team of those who want to make a difference in education, are intellectually curious and have integrity! We can offer a means for you to achieve the goals you want to accomplish in your career.  Please apply ‰ÛÒ right now ‰ÛÒ we can‰Ûªt wait to meet you!    McGraw-Hill Education is an EOE/Male/Female/Disability/Veterans/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. For special accommodation due to disability, please email TalentAcquisition@mheducation.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate individual. title: Intern - Integrated Marketing
description: JOB SEARCH CAREERS SIGN IN/REGISTER in Share Summer 2017 Intern - Integrated Marketing TX - Corporate Corporate Your Role Fossil Group is looking for an intern to join our Digital Marketing team this summer.  You will have an opportunity to work on the Fossil, Misfit or Skagen brand. This intern will work directly with the brand marketing team to gain experience in digital, social, channel, and partnership marketing. The candidate will have heavy involvement in competitive/industry auditing and high-impact seasonal launch activities for the brand, managing all aspects of campaign asset trafficking.  As an intern, you will work alongside your team on a variety of projects. Your experience as an intern at Fossil is both educational and fun, while keeping you connected with your mentor, manager, and fellow interns.  You will gain exposure to company leaders through roundtables, your final project showcase, and other company functions.   All intern positions are at Fossil‰Ûªs headquarters based in Richardson, Texas. Applicants need to be willing to relocate during the course of the internship and provide their own transportation and accommodations to complete a 40 hour work week. This is a paid internship. Your Skills Aligning with Fossil‰Ûªs core values, we are looking for someone who: åá      Develops strong partnerships across our organization åá      Brings a positive, service-oriented approach to work åá      Is driven by creating unique and efficient solutions for business challenges åá      Can articulate thoughts clearly as well as listen to and considers others‰Ûª ideas åá      Is passionate about their contribution to Fossil åá      Has a great time at work and encourages others to do the same  Required Skills and Experience: Rising Senior or MBA student currently enrolled in an accredited university majoring in Marketing, Communication or relevant major Strong in analytical (math) Minimum 3.0 GPA Software skills strongly preferred: Microsoft Office (specifically Excel), Google Enterprise Strong written and verbal communication skills Refined presentation skills Desire to work in a fast paced environment while handling multiple projects Interest in fashion and proficient in social media Familiarity with Adaptly, Quantcast, Doubleclick is a plus Brand Highlights Fossil is an American watch and lifestyle brand inspired by all things curious. Since 1984, we‰Ûªve been a creative collaborative focused on authentic design, craftsmanship, and storytelling. Fossil has grown to offer watches, bags, jewelry, eyewear, and most recently wearables. With more than 400 retail stores, 4,000 wholesale locations and 13,000 employees worldwide, passion drives our curiosity and inspires us to always ask, ‰ÛÏwhat‰Ûªs next?‰Û Get To Know Us Fossil Group is a global retailer specializing in the design, innovation and marketing of fashion lifestyle and accessory products. At the heart of Fossil Group's vision is a commitment to fostering creativity and delivering the best in design through its three core businesses: the Fossil brand; the Skagen brand; and a multi-brand watch portfolio business. This portfolio includes adidas, Armani Exchange, Burberry, Diesel, DKNY, Emporio Armani, Karl Lagerfeld, Marc by Marc Jacobs, Michael Kors, Michele, Relic, Tory Burch and Zodiac. Fossil Group is constantly developing its businesses through core competencies in innovative branding, world-class design and dynamic global distribution. Accommodations Statement Fossil is an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Anyone requiring special accommodations to our normal application process please email applicationaccommodation@fossil.com and we will assist you.
