title: Marketing Intern
description: Corporate Learning | Harvard Business Review | Higher Education  Job Title: Marketing Intern Department: Higher Education Employment Type: Full Time Office Location: Brighton, MA Date Posted: 2/10/2017 Job Number: JO-1702-900 Share | | Email this job  Harvard Business Publishing's summer internship program provides students who have a passion for learning with real world business experience through meaningful work; a general understanding of the publishing business; and functional knowledge and skills through ownership of projects. The ten-week program runs June 5, 2017 through August 11, 2017. Students work full-time and receive a stipend at the end of the program.  Harvard Business Publishing is a wholly-owned, not-for-profit subsidiary of Harvard University. We are media company with the mission to create products and services that educate a business audience about best management practices and leadership development. We publish books, magazines, blogs, and cases; sponsor webinars; and develop e-learning programs, simulations, podcasts, apps and learning solutions. Our authors are the leading thinkers and visionaries on the art, science, and practice of management. We are an equal opportunity employer.'  The Marketing Intern will gain experience with product marketing research, web site content, customer data, event planning and promotion, and production/scheduling. As a member of the Higher Education's (HE) marketing team, the intern will have a hands-on role in contributing to the group‰Ûªs active summer marketing schedule. The intern will report to the Marketing Communications Manager, Higher Education.  Responsibilities:  Marketing Tools, Metadata, and More: Customer data: Learn the basics of Salesforce.com (our customer relationship management database) in order to support Higher Ed‰Ûªs mission to improve accuracy of the customer data that drives our marketing campaigns. Specifically, the intern will understand the structure of our database of business instructors, and contribute to more targeted marketing efforts through projects that include, researching and tagging customers as targets for marketing campaigns. Reorganize, update, and build an online archive of curriculum maps. These maps are an invaluable tool for our sales reps. Update metadata on Item Detail Pages (IDPs) based on edits found by proofreaders Website resources: Help uncover areas that need to be fixed in PDF guides used by customers, specifically content maps. Make sure branding is correct and that only currently available content is referenced. Event Planning & Management Simulation webinars: Work with product marketing managers to approve/reject webinar attendees. Also update our CRM system with the attendee information to improve customer data. In support of seminars and conferences, aid in materials aggregation, shipping, and participant administration. This requires assembling folders, gathering display pieces, packing, lifting boxes, labeling, and shipping. Maintain adequate quantities of print collateral (brochures and sell sheets) in-house Organize, collect, and compile data from Case Method Teaching Seminars (domestic & international) Assist with catering orders and room/space reservations for several events. Help coordinate a local seminar produced by HBP and held on the Harvard Business School campus.   Research Research available literature regarding teaching and learning online using case studies. Research will be shared with Marketing and Product Design & Delivery teams. Requirements: Currently pursuing a bachelor's or associate‰Ûªs degree in marketing or related field Proficiency with MS Excel, Word & PowerPoint Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM tool a plus Strong communication and research skills Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task A can-do spirit     Apply for the Marketing Intern position  CAREERS SEARCH OPEN JOBS Submit Resume-General Interest Corporate Learning | Harvard Business Review | Higher Education Privacy Policy | Copyright Information | Trademark Policy Copyright å© 2013 Harvard Business School Publishing. All rights reserved. Harvard Business Publishing is an affiliate of Harvard Business School.

title: Marketing / Lean Intern
description: Marketing / Lean Intern Bethlehem, PAIntern Company Description Bosch Rexroth is one of the world‰Ûªs leading providers of drive and control technologies. Regardless of the motion task that customers face anywhere in the world, they will always find a Bosch Rexroth team with the local experience and the appropriate know-how from more than 30 industries and all drive and control technologies. Our associates take on their customers‰Ûª challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found. This is what makes Bosch Rexroth a strong, reliable partner for Mobile Applications, Machinery Applications and Engineering and Factory Automation. As the Drive & Control Company, we develop, produce, and distribute our components and system solutions in over 80 countries. You‰Ûªll find our drive and control technology in a wide variety of applications: From excavators and tractors to CNC woodworking and metal-cutting machines. You‰Ûªll find us in automotive factories, packaging systems for the food industry, medical devices and laboratories, and even in grand-scale projects such as the London Eye or the Panama Canal. (Watch our video!) With a product portfolio that includes all technologies, as well as a comprehensive offering in service and support, Bosch Rexroth is an expert partner for the complete machine life cycle. For our associates, working at Bosch Rexroth means having more than just a secure job‰ÛÓit means having the doors open to exceptional career pathways. Our values derive from a commitment to leading-edge technology, global partnership, and a strong sense of responsibility‰ÛÓto our communities and to the environment. We find our strength in our diverse backgrounds, experience and individual talents and capabilities. Our associates are a competitive advantage that is unmatched anywhere. They allow us to continuously impress our customers throughout the world. Job Description We're looking to fill an internship position for someone with an interest in applying digital marketing and business skills to join our growing team. You'll participate in a fast paced environment wearing several hats. The marketing internship provides a unique opportunity to gain firsthand experience in a large corporation and add value through executing on various marketing and business development activities. The ideal candidate will have an opportunity to experience many facets of the business however will focus on digital marketing and business process development. The ideal candidate will work with us to build brand awareness through event marketing, online/print advertising, and other marketing activities through social media. Among the responsibilities that come with the role, you will be involved in: Developing and executing the company‰Ûªs social media strategy Developing email marketing campaigns Assisting with the development of marketing and training content to be used throughout the buyer's journey Development of business processes to interact with parent company regarding quoting, order management, invoice payment and capacity tracking We value every member of our team and encourage our employees to bring their own interests and skills to the table whether they pertain to events, marketing, design, social media, or any other relevant areas. Qualifications Must be currently enrolled in an accredited university (ex. CHEA) and pursuing a Bachelors in Marketing or Business with minimum four semesters completed or Masters Degree in Marketing or Business with at least one semester completed. Minimum overall GPA of at least 3.0. Must be minimum of 18 years of age. Sales /marketing professional experience is strongly preferred Strong Social Media Skills Must have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a changing environment Strong personal and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently as well as in a team and to lead small project groups. Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office with a focus in Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. title: PR Intern
description: AT A GLANCE POINT OF VIEW EXPERTISE CULTURE & CAREERS CONNECT Join us! This could be the start of something great. Home 0 Apply Now     Req # 7806 PR Intern - Austin Location: Austin TX US Job Category: Intern Job Description:  When you work at WE, you will find compelling work, global partnerships, worthwhile professional development, outstanding benefits and the opportunity to make a difference. We value those who share our passion and belief in the power of change, discovery and innovation. We invest in our future by creating a fun workplace full of creative, skilled, curious and enthusiastic people. If that sounds like you, we want you here.  Interns at WE are provided professional experience and practice to learn about strategic communications. The agency is committed to providing interns with a valuable experience that will help build a strong foundation for entering the profession. In addition to a structured mentorship program, customized industry and agency training, regular feedback, and networking opportunities, our interns are exposed to a broad variety of projects with multiple teams.  The program will begin on Wednesday, June 21, 2017.  Responsibilities:  THROUGHOUT THE WE INTERNSHIP, YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO: Understand the significant role that strategic communications can play toward achieving clients‰Ûª business objectives. Learn WE‰Ûªs unique methods and practices guiding client contact, influential relationships and strategic communications. Learn how the media works, how to build relationships with editors, analysts, and reviewers, and how to identify important influencers to clients. Research the basics of clients‰Ûª products, PR plans, and teams‰Ûª strategies and tactics to help clients tell their stories to their target audiences. Work with a WE team to respond to client requests, manage editorial and analyst requests, develop story ideas, pitch stories to journalists and plan for major events. Contribute to logistics and preparation of press activities, press or analyst tours, trade-show press meetings, on-site influential visits and other events. Participate in the development and distribution of media alerts, press releases and related materials. Master working with team members in other locations and incorporate videoconferencing technology. Report on relevant coverage  Qualifications:  EDUCATION: Bachelor‰Ûªs degree or above is required EXPERIENCE PREFERRED: 0-1 years of professional experience - Public Relations Internship experience a plus Developed written materials that are organized, professional and concise Managed multiple projects simultaneously Worked under deadline pressure IMPORTANT SKILLS AND CHARACTERISTICS: Exhibit agency values ‰ÛÒ Respect, Integrity, Collaboration, Innovation, Passion, Curiosity Creative Proactive Resourceful Follow-through Strong writing capabilities. Ability to gather and synthesize large quantities of information into succinct and clear communications. Ability to manage multi-faceted projects. Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize are very important. Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.  While the exact functions and responsibilities will vary depending on the teams to which the intern is assigned, the agency works to ensure that the intern‰Ûªs experience is creative, dynamic, fulfilling, and consistent. **Employment is not guaranteed at the completion of the internship program.  **Please note that due to the volume of applicants, we are unable to contact every candidate individually.  Apply Now     Not ready to apply? In addition, WE complies with applicable federal, state and local laws covering nondiscrimination in employment. title: Digital Media Intern
description: Home Jobs Digital Media Intern ‰ÛÒ Corporate Fundraising Search Jobs Login - Development Indianapolis, IN, USA Internship Email Me This Job Are you a creative thinker who enjoys connecting people and maintaining relationships? Do you believe companies should give back to their communities? Are you willing to invest in the details for the success of a larger goal? If so, spend your summer getting professional experience at one of Indiana's most progressive nonprofits.           "Interning with Children's Bureau was a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience working for a nonprofit while simultaneously giving back to my community. Collaborating in a fun, team atmosphere enhanced my knowledge of social media, event planning, corporate relations, and ultimately provided me with the skills necessary to start my career." ‰ÛÒ Jessica Almon, 2015 Children's Bureau Intern   As a Children's Bureau intern, you can look forward to: Collaborating with other interns and supervisors in a fun, fast-paced environment Interfacing with a variety of stakeholders -- agency volunteers, corporate partners, clients, executive staff, donors, etc. Moving on with a wealth of experience in fundraising, digital communications, project management, relationship-building and stewardship A team that listens and is committed to your learning experience   Key Objectives: Design, schedule and track daily social media posts that highlight the companies that partner with Children's Bureau and their corporate social responsibility Use Adobe InDesign to create visually appealing, interactive review packets for partner companies Develop engaging content for email marketing Coordinate logistics for monthly Meet and Greet events and corporate networking Learn about Children's Bureau's corporate partners and invest in the relationships Contribute to preparations for signature fundraising event, the 20th annual Children's Bureau Celebrity Cook-Off Present your experience to Children's Bureau executives at the conclusion of your internship   What We're Looking For Use of good judgment and ability to maintain confidentiality Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with attention to detail Good organizational skills, integrity and excellent follow through Be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university as a junior or senior (in good standing) Minimum of intermediate design skills with Adobe Creative Suite (emphasis on InDesign/Photoshop) Enjoy learning and working as a team! The Fine Print 20 hours per week (full time consideration for the right applicant) Must have access to reliable transportation Language requirements: Fluent written and spoken English This is a paid internship with a stipend awarded at the end of 12 weeks   Children's Bureau is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status.
